Reviews.Title: “Annoying”
Reviews.Author: itchyfins
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room and only 2 towels were provided (by the time we realised it was too late to call for more as we had a plane to catch so used a hand towel). Was told on check-in that breakfast was included, but when we went to get it we were told it in fact wasn't included. There were lots of staff but the whole check-in process was unbelievably slow and frustrating and I waited more than 20 minutes at midnight just to get a room key when finally my friend turned up with one - I'm sure I would have been another 20 mins otherwise. WiFi in the lobby was so slow it was unusable. The location is good and I'm sure if you stay there longer it's fine but I wasn't impressed. I had much better service at the backpackers I stayed in a week later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Trudie H
Reviews.Content: First stay at the refurbished Carlton great location and lovely staff. The cafe in the lobby serves great coffee and a good option for those not wanting the full on buffet breakfast. Only downside is the charges for in room internet $25SGD a day free in the lobby. So lots of people in the lobby on wifi many not guests. Otherwise fab

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: MattnPia
Reviews.Content: Ours was only a short stay (1night) however its was memorable. Beautiful hotel lobby to greet you, staff were fantastic, restaurant had some great food, the room (1735) was large and very comfortable. As highlighted in previous posts the location is one of the more central to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: sam0123
Reviews.Content: 5-night business trip at Carlton, overall impression was great and better than I expected. The location is very convenient, and just a short walk or cab to Marina Bay area and quays. Lobby is large, gorgeous and inviting with a good coffee shop and a restaurant with very good buffet breakfasts and lunches (didn't look at pricing as they were included in our event booking). My room in Premier Wing (#1855) was excellent, with a great view of Raffles City mall & towers and Chijmes restaurant complex from the bay window (see pic). Room itself is good size with modern furniture, very comfortable king bed, Nespresso espresso machine and HDTV. Desk area has wall outlets that accomodate US and European plugs, no need for adapter. The bathroom has separate large bathtub/shower enclosure with rain shower & handshower and Molton Brown toiletries. The tub filler is very fast. Overall the room was impeccably clean and well maintained, staff showed up to replace a burnt lightbulb I hadn't yet even noticed. Gym is spacious glass-walled space on 5th floor, well equipped with modern cardio equipment (treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, rowing machine), weight machines and free weights although the sauna at gym was at the moment closed for renovation. The pool was mid-size and nice, not a full lap pool. The spa was busy, massage therapy was good but expensive. Event services were great, if you're doing an event in the hotel the catering is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mand2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton for 3 days in Premier room. Rooms are clean and neat and bathrooms quite nice with Molton Brown shower supplies. Hotel in excellent location, lobby lovely to walk into, staff friendly and efficient, Mosaic cafe nice and pleasant for a quick dinner. Taxis east to get and walkign distance to public transport. Would stay here agin for the price, nothing too flash but certainly ticks the boxes for a clean, well located and reasonably priced hotel

Reviews.Title: “Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Bvesh
Reviews.Content: My stay at carlton was verynice with a luxurious feeling mixed with nice and comftable for people coming with their families.friendly staff,clean rooms and good service very happy with the hotel and i would like to comeback

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: malepilot
Reviews.Content: Hotel Carlton has a very nice and spacious lobby. Staff were very professional and polite! Rooms are superbly clean and comfortable! I was upgraded to the Executive room, it was nice and spacious. The bed is very comfortable and huge! Location is excellent, as it is next to Raffles City Shopping Mall, City Hall MRT Station, Boat Quay, Bugis....

Reviews.Title: “Worst 4/5 star I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for a 3 days trip and I decided for Carlton based on their pictures and reviews. Once arrived I was truly impressed with the lobby, but this was the last thing which I was impressed about the hotel. The room were very outdated and I felt like I have walked into a 2 star hotel if I compare to the other hotels I have stayed in Singapore before. Even though the rooms were clean, the bathroom needed much improvements! The shower curtains were stained and I couldn't adjust the shower head because it was broken, there was also hardly any amenities in the bathroom which I kind of expect from a 4/5star hotel. This is a 2 star hotel with a 4 star pricetag, definitely not worth the money and I would suggest everyone to choose another hotel. (Having said this, I haven't seen the newer Premier rooms in the new tower, so it might be better than the one at the old tower) Nevertheless I give the hotel 2 stars, due to its location! however this was the last thing I would sdisappointed with the rooms once I've arrived. The rooms are very outdated and I've seen cleaner bathrooms in a 3 star

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Steven P
Reviews.Content: First time stay here, and i can say it's perfect hotel although the room looks old a bit, especially on the bath room ( a bit sour smelly ). The lobby very nice with FULL MARBLE which make the hotel become real 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good position”
Reviews.Author: colombre
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days with my family when visiting Singapore. This is a big modern hotel, good on all aspects, including a restaurant with adequate selection of Asian and western food and a nice outdoor pool. The hotel is also definitely recommendable for the position, in front of the Raffles, close to several shopping sites and at walking distance from the Marina bay and the historic district.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gumbo3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlton for two nights and it did not fail to deliver exactly what I was looking for. Good location with shops, bars and restaurants nearby and opposite the famous Raffles hotel which is worth a visit. The staff were polite and helpful while the hotel provided good facilities like a useful snack area in the lobby and internet access to check into your flights etc.. The room was clean and spacious. Another nice touch was that I had no cash for my taxi from the airport to the hotel so on arrival the attendant went and got cash from the reception to pay for my taxi which I was able to charge onto my hotel bill. Have no complaints about this hotel and would stay again....

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: GoneFishing
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with very comfortable rooms. I appreciate the security of having to use the room key to access the floor of your room. It is a slight inconvience when you want to visit a friend on another floor, but are able to work around this by meeting your friend in the lobby and then going up with them. Good food in all the resturants in the hotel and very convenient to other resturants and MRT. I did encounter one issue, in the bathrooms, where the shower is located, it is all marble floors and very slippery. Contact housekeeping when you arrive, and ask for an extra rubber mat for the floor. It is very slippery. I fell and brusied my hip the first morning. The conference capabilities are a little above average. The catering was good and they do work with you if you have special times that you need to have snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good food”
Reviews.Author: Vivek K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlton for 1 night. The location is fantastic with the Raffles mall, and lots of bars and restaurants just across the road. The bar is very nice with live music, and the breakfast is outstanding : excellent spread and tastes very well. A perfect place for a short business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: WeeChancer
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, short walk from most places and taxis are cheap. Beware that Taxis are difficult to get and so the wait may take a long time, especially if it is raining (tip pre order at reception and walk past the queues!). Bar is expensive, but just opposite is a complex of restaurants and bars, big sports screens for those who want them. Friendly staff make you feel very welcome

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and value-for-money”
Reviews.Author: babypig82
Reviews.Content: Location was the biggest draw for me - it is only a 5 min walk from City Hall MRT and 10 min from Bugis, so it's right in the heart of town. It is also considerably cheaper ($180++ vs $230-$260++) than other hotels in the Marina Square area near City Hall MRT so this was good value. Hotel feels newly refurbished, everything was nice and clean. Service was an A+ in general 1) fast and friendly check-in 2) TV screen in my room was very dark at first, but they sent a maintenance guy to fix it 5 min after I called Operator. Minor annoyances 1) Sheets are scratchy, maybe they were overstatched 2) even after the maintenance guy fixed it, images on TV was still fuzzy and not sharp at all. Overall, good value-for-money, nice, but not for creatures who need unadulterated luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: scott_dot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton for 4 nights while we explored Singapore. The breakfast buffet was amazing as was the service. The location was incredible, across the road from Raffles Plaza and near the City Hall MRT. Pretty amazing place considering our travel agent said that it was not "that flash". Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel, easy location”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey T
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful -- whether by accident or design, there are always lots of people there because the wi-fi is free. This is actually helpful, because you see all the comings and goings, and have a chance to meet new people. The bar is pleasant, with pleasant live music and efficient waitstaff, and expensive prices. Singapore as a whole seems to be divided between expensive and cheap -- the Carlton is expensive. My rooms was very well-maintained and quiet, if a bit old. Lobby staff and doormen consistently pleasant and helpful (I watched a lot while I was computing in the lobby!). Location is good for downtown, just across from Raffles, but taxis are omnipresent and reasonable, as is public transit. The swimming pool and fitness room are superb, well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, good service”
Reviews.Author: pinacolada53
Reviews.Content: very useful for the central biz district . Read other reviews (booked via hotels.com) and requested to stay in the new wing which was well worth it. Smart, functional rooms - decent size double with modern shower and bath. Efficient service - lively bar, though expect to pay $20 for a beer! Would stay here again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Care and attention superb.”
Reviews.Author: TasmanianTourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for seven nights and became ill in the middle of the trip. I was on my own. the hotel organised an excellent doctor who came within twenty minutes with an assistant. I was able to continue to go to my conference with the medicines helping. The staff in the dining rooms coffee shp0s reception were all first rate. This is a truly great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and location...!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchtraveller007
Reviews.Content: I went to the Carlton hotel to mainly visit my friends wedding and i have to say that the night there and the feeling of the hotel have left a great impression. Never heard of the name before, the style and attitude of the staff was real nice 5 star level. Being welcomed with the "Quatar Airways" staff waiting in the lobby for their room, you know that the hotel must have good quality..!!! The rooms were very clean, modern and spacious and the Banquetting was very well maintained and set up. The service staff was clearly "Part time" but very well trained and mannered. Pleasently surprised by the quality of the entire function and i am sure my friends had a great wedding experience with them as well. Be located next to "Chijmes" i loved that you can just cross the street and you have tons of bars to choose from. Also everything else is in walking distance. From "City Hall" and "Clark Quay" to even the "Suntech Shopping Center".... all locations are in reach. Great place to stay...!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Total Package”
Reviews.Author: srt04kpop
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here on a business trip. There was some sort of communication problem with our booking so we were upgraded to two suites at no charge. Room was very clean, comfortable, and the breakfast buffet was amazing! The location is great with the Raffles Long Bar literally a 30 second walk! No complaints and will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MikeNowell
Reviews.Content: We booked via Internet site and got a great deal so we didn't expect to much when we got there, boy where we surprised ! The rooms where spotless and well appointed. The location was great, right next to Raffels and the Raffles shopping centre, needles to say my wife was happy. The staff where very good and nothing was to much trouble. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, bad view”
Reviews.Author: Singapore_trav
Reviews.Content: We checked into the NEW wing of the Carlton hotel for a night, took the premier room, which was ok in size, new in design, and reasonably well equipped. The price was devoid of any fringes, like internet access and so on, but the hotel staff was nice enough to allow us a late checkout, at 3pm the following day (normally it's 12 noon). Room service was good. The food was not cheap, but it was tasty, and the portions generous. We also found the menu selection to be quite good. Now, what kinda spoilt it all was the view. We asked for a high floor, and should have included a request for a good view. Instead of getting one that had a view of the financial district, we got a room that faced the rear of the hotel, which looked into a rather old and drab by office building, and some public housing in the distance. Not pretty. I tried requesting for a room change, but was told the hotel was booked solid. I believed it at first, but doubted it later when I saw one of the staff going from room to room changing the batteries for the TV remote (on the side which had a good view). As the doors were open, I could see none of the rooms were occupied. An above average perception of the hotel quickly sank, knowing this. That said, the Carlton is close to some key malls, like Raffles city (just opposite), Marina Square and Raffles link (which connects the two, underground). It also houses a good Chinese restaurant called Wah Lok, which offered a unique selection of dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable stay, pricey food”
Reviews.Author: sundomain
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton for 2 nights (Tuesday-Thursday). Booked an Executive room through HotelClub a few months prior to the visit. We just breezed through check in at the hotel (at about 3pm) with no trouble at all. Got a room in the 11th floor which was good because it cut off completely any noise from the streets below. The rooms were well appointed and had amenities such as cable TV, mini-bar, full-sized clothes cupboard, and safe. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was big enough, clean and had an enclosed shower cubicle separate from the bathtub - which is good. In fact it was bigger than the bathroom of the King Deluxe room at the Hilton Singapore. No bidet. The only complaint about cleanliness of the hotel is the carpet. It appeared to be heavily stained in the room and along the corridors as well. Also, the room remained very cold even after the air conditioning was turned off; which wasn't comfortable. The location is a definite advantage Carlton offers. The Bras Basah MRT station's just a 3 minute walk away. From there, once you get to Dhoby Ghaut interchange (next station), you have access to trains running on the North South (red), North East (purple) and Circle (yellow) lines; which will help you to get to practically all attractions you'll visit in Singapore. Raffle's City (mall) is located right in front of the Carlton and has a wide selection of branded shops and restaurants as well as a supermarket. Raffle's City also has the entrance to the City Hall MRT station which is an interchange for the North South (red) line and East West (green) line. We didn't get to try out the buffet at Carlton (which seemed expensive). Dined in-room. The food was good; pricey though. Room service was courteous and prompt in meeting our requests. Our request to check-out late at 2pm was also promptly entertained. Concierge was also pleasant and helpful. The Carlton is a good hotel if you are looking for a convenient location and comfortable accomodation. But food prices can be high for a four-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MrCushtie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks at the Carlton; after the first day we were upgraded to a premier room, which was much better - more spacious, a better bathroom, and a nicer view. Also, the smaller rooms on the lower floors open onto a corridor that smells of gravy; this was consistent with my previous stay at the Carlton, which suggests to me they need to change their air freshener at some point. Good points: the location is great. You're diagonally opposite Raffles City mall, and thus the City Hall MRT is a few minutes' walk. Chijmes is on the other side of the road for medium-to-upscale dining, and if you want something cheaper there's a hawker centre just a few minutes' walk in the other direction. There's also lots of museums and other amenities close by. The gym is good - rather than being hidden away in the basement it's up on the 5th floor, with a view of the swimming pool (if you lean sufficiently), and with a good selection of modern exercise equipment. The pool's also very nice. Not so good: internet isn't free, and breakfast is astronomically expensive - when they quoted us a price for breakfast at check-in I was initially amazed, because it seemed cheap for two weeks. And then I realised that was per day. Room service meals are good, but for the price you pay they should be - and given the nearby competition (like the food court in Raffles City, or the hawker centre down the street) it seems the hotel is only catering to rich agoraphobics. Keycards have a habit of failing to work, which means you may make frequent trips to the front desk to get them reset. Not a massive problem in the general scheme of things, but a little annoying. The image on the television in our room was always much darker than it should be, but I suppose with the view of Singapore out the window you'd be a fool to spend your time watching the telly. Plus, although you're facing onto a busy street, the soundproofing is good enough that we never had a disturbed, sleep-free night. So it's good as a base, but probably not a sensible place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate convinent hotel with in walking distance to most places of interest.”
Reviews.Author: ppllai
Reviews.Content: Took a taxi from the hotel to the airport at 0600. It took 18 mins and cost $18. 5 mins walk from Bugis Junction. Raffeles City opposite of the street. 15 mins walk from Espanade. 30 mins walk from orchard road. Hotel is unremarkable. It has everything you need. Good business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Su M
Reviews.Content: Superb location - close to all the restaurants. Staff were very friendly and accomodating. Made everything possible from late check-in's to last minute dietary changes. The views are great of the city and its close to a very good italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: BossPrestonUK
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three times and now that the renovations are completed, the entrance foyer is magnificent. Foyer staff are very pleasant and booking in is very efficient. We opt for a high room floor 10 or above to avoid the traffic noise at this very busy junction. As we are pensioners on a budget, we do not eat in the hotel as it is very expensive, preferring the adjacent malls and a nearby Italian Restaurant, we also eat at Chimes across the road where we have the choice of cuisine. The courtesy shower rooms are below standard, you have to leave your clothes etc in the adjacent room whilst showering. The concierge is on the ball looking after your baggage for the day once we had checked out - we could not afford to pay 50% of the room tariff just for keeping the room on for 5 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious”
Reviews.Author: Nic_Weston
Reviews.Content: My first time in this hotel in Singapore. Rooms are adequate. Clean. All the basics are here but not over the top. Very convenient location being opposite Chymes and close to Raffles City Shopping Centre. Would stay here again... like the location. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Good location large lobby bus Ctr & pool new wing better accom restaurant 24 jr meals buffet breakfast is good rooms are tired & old fashioned ditto for small bathrooms flat screen tv wifi is chargeable & doesn't work in rooms & entitled to 20% off meals from reservation yet had to argue for this they tried to say only available against buffet airline crews are noticeable here

Reviews.Title: “Premier Club Room”
Reviews.Author: neese01
Reviews.Content: Private check-in at Premier Club Lounge on 19th floor. Included in the Premier Club Room package was small buffet breakfast, all day hot and cold drinks and cookies, drinks and canapés every evening in the Club Lounge, Internet/WIFI, Newspaper, welcome fruit platter and late check-out until 3pm. I paid SGD$363 / Aust$288 per nt. My room on the 16th floor was beautiful, quiet, and had an amazing view over Marina Bay Sands. The bathroom was huge with separate rain shower and very lengthy bath. The bed was very large and extremely comfortable. The Club Lounge staff were very attentive (maybe a little bit too attentive and formal). I hardly saw any other guests on the number of occasions I attended the Club Lounge. The wine was nice, but the canapes in the evening were disappointing –meatballs in tomato sauce, small chicken skewers, sandwiches, fruit, a choice of only 2 cheeses and bowls of potato/corn chips. I was expecting better quality – I could have bought a bag of chips and meat skewers in the basement foodcourt at Raffles City Shopping Centre across the road. The sweets were nice – chocolates and a couple of types of cake. Service overall was a bit patchy – lovely turn-down service in the evening, but tea and sugar not being replenished in the room, morning newspaper didn’t arrive, staff would get you a cup of tea but no spoon, empty pepper shakers on tables, and maintenance problem of music playing from a ceiling speaker in the room for nearly 2 hours before being fixed. On my final day bathroom lights wouldn’t turn on, but the entry light kept coming on by itself. Despite these few service glitches/lapses the Premier Club Rooms are very comfortable. Not sure why the Premier wing was empty – probably overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Highlights: Breakfast & Gym”
Reviews.Author: ElCheapoTraveller
Reviews.Content: The rooms are average, try to avoid the old wing. However breakfast buffet has a very good selection and gym is outstanding. Location is great! I would come back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Room”
Reviews.Author: Denise07012
Reviews.Content: (Superior Twin-bedded room) I paid SGD$205 / Aust$163 per nt. The view from my room on the 13th floor was amazing facing Bras Basah Road and looking over Raffles City Shopping Centre, Suntec, Theatres by the Bay, St. Andrews Cathedral and the CBD. The room was a good size, quiet, but the bed was rather firm. These rooms seem to have had some renovation done since my last stay in 2005, eg. newer carpets and flat screen TV. The bathroom was small and a little old, but functional. Housekeeping were very prompt in making up the room each day. Reception staff were very friendly, efficient and proactive. The Hotel is in a superb location for tourists planning on sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Tad expensive”
Reviews.Author: Aspi123
Reviews.Content: right in middle of everything. gr8 pool and fitness center. but slightly expensive, unless you get some gud deal.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms in the new wing, service just ok”
Reviews.Author: disport
Reviews.Content: the rooms in the new wing are lovely! Thee food from room service is some of the best in Singapore hotels. I stayed for a week to look at moving our company business there. Strange service, I booked a premier room in the new wing with a "harbour view" according the website. On arrival I was "upgraded" to a club room (without club privileges) but now harbour view. The city view was nice, but when I asked reception they said no rooms had harbour views just bay glimpses anyways, very strange......... There's a Nespresso coffee machine in the room, its S$1 to have a coffee as they charge for the pods. The pool area and bars are great. The housekeeping was fantastic with the room spotless every day and the Molton Brown products re-stocked each day. The internet was S$20 per day, why do hotels still charge this? I had my business shirts ironed, instead of hanging them they were left on the bed to get creased.... I usually stay at the Swisshotel across the street and this was way better despite the few things. For such a clean new room it's great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to Raffles City”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrottingBabe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times before and then they had to renovate the hotel. Now we're back with them and we went like "wow", when we saw the lobby. They've expanded it to occupy the vacant lot next to it before so now you can enter the lobby after crossing from Raffles Hotel or Raffles City. And it's brighter, airier and has more aesthetic lighting. But I think, the renovation was mostly done for the public areas as the guest rooms were pretty much the same. Singapore is an asian foodie heaven where you can eat at any time of the day and have choices from hawker centers to higher end restaurants. I've ordered room service here and food is pretty good and service pretty fast. You can also walk to several tourist areas and if needed, the MRT at Raffles City is next door.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: hhreviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. We were concerned that we would not be given good rooms as we had prepaid, however the rooms were very clean and satisfactory. Marble bathroom with separate shower and bath as well as robes. Big room with comfortable beds. I even managed to forget an expensive coat and a pair of shoes, I called to ask about my shoes and they had the coat ready when I came to pick the shoes up! A stuff up on my part but I appreciated the honesty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very bad checking in”
Reviews.Author: TravelerCG1
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1 and the queue was already very long. We finally can rest in our room past 5. After a long negotiation with the front office we can get our room (executive) 2 rooms for 4 nights. They offered to "upgrade" us but smaller and older room. Luckily we didn't take the offer. Other than checking in process that takes very long, it is a hotel with great location. Overall staffs are friendly. They surely looks stressed up during the rush hour of checking in. Check out is speedy.

Reviews.Title: “Smell of old smoke in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dennis H
Reviews.Content: I requested a non-smoker room, got one in the old tower on level 17, came in... and the whole room smelled of old, cold smoke. After cranking up the air condition, it was bearable, however the aircon was so loud that I couldn't sleep. After switching it off, the smell came back, and with it the noise from Bras Basah Road, pretty much unfiltered through the single-pane windows. Likewise the walls seemed to be made out of card board, so i could listen to my neighbours talking. After some restless sleep, I was woken up by the PA announcing that the fire alarm has been set off and that I should stay calm. After 10 minutes of no further announcements, I had to call the operator to hear she was sorry that it was only a false alarm. I checked out 2 days early and went to a proper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: RMC47
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed in the old tower we found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The great advantage of this hotel is its location being near Raffles City shopping centre and City Hall MRT station. This made moving around Singapore easy whether by foot,bus or train. The only downside was the bathroom which was showing its age.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Matt_83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton in Jan 2012. The hotel is in a perfect location with a MRT only a 5 min walk with connections to everywhere in Singapore and also Raffles is directly over the road from the hotel. The rooms are clean but I dont believe clean enough as we had toe nail cuttings on the floor at the side of the bed. The corridors are clean but the carpets are getting very grubby and their is often a smell of cigerettes. Our room had a nice view on the 15th floor and the bathroom was very nice. The staff are friendly and if their is a problem they will act upon it very quickly. Overall a nice few nights but it is very overpriced for what you get. Always remember that when you come to checking out their is a 10% service charge and 7% tax to add on to each nights room rate. I believe this is standard in all hotels unless you have paid in advance. I would stay here again but only if the cost was less.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: WibiUdayana
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general is good. The service is not so bad but you will come across some employees that are rude. For example, when I called customer service from my hotel room, I was greeted with a monotonous 'hello'. Instead of, 'Customer Service, how can I help you?' or something. Its like calling my sister to get me a towel downstairs and she's couldn't be bothered to. & instead of a simple 'Anything else I can help you?' or 'Thank you for calling', after a request, you hear a dial tone... Maybe I just called an employee who had a rough day. :/ The towel did come on time however and the rooms are always nicely cleaned everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Bec M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton hotel for the Formula One in 2011. The hotel was a great base - the location is fantastic for seeing the city on foot. The rooms were nice, a bit basic. The bathroom wasn't fantastic. Although, we stayed in one of the older towers. A fellow traveller had stayed in the new tower previously and said it was much nicer. Would recommend trying to secure a room in the new tower if available. Breakfasts were amazing. Gravity Bar had a great vibe and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dt3012
Reviews.Content: Our two families (2 adults and 2 children each) stayed 3 nights at this lovely hotel and both of us are happy with the room and services. We had interconnected rooms so our children were able to see each other. We booked online and the rate was reasonable. The location is superb and train station is a stone throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, lovely new rooms”
Reviews.Author: rc28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with 2 children (8 & 9) and stayed in the new wing. These rooms are new and are beautifully appointed. They are clean, modern and stylish. Service at the hotel was excellent, all the staff were very attentive. It would be great if free wifi was available (cost was S$0.20 per minute max of S$20) Stay in the new wing, lovely hotel with warm and attentive staff

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton in Sept 2011. It didn't start off well, when I booked online for 2 adults & 1 child and later found out that I would be hit for extra charges for a foldaway bed for our 5 yr old son. A friend had recently returned from Singapore and said she had this problem, so told me to check with the Carlton. Needless to say I was unimpressed, as when you add on the extra costs for the bed, the total price would have been more than that of a 5 star hotel. In fact most of the 5 star hotels include foldaway beds and cots complimentary. In fairness to the hotel, after much arguing and threatening to take my business elsewhere, they agreed to waive the fee. On check in at 2am, there were no issues apart from the fact they advised us they had given us adjoining rooms with our friends, however, when we arrived at our rooms, we were on opposite sides of the corridor! Our friends had an adjoining room, but not with us! Anyway, we didn't complain, as we weren't fussed. The rooms were very disappointing. Very very dated and the bathrooms were so tiny you couldn't swing a cat. I believe the rooms in the new wing are very nice, although I haven't seen them. The pool was quite good, although we ordered cocktails and they were so awful that we had to send them back and swap them for beer. They were practically undrinkable. Again, in fairness, they took them back and did not charge us for them. The internet cafe wasn't very nice, there was no staff attendance and I had to wait ages for someone to show up and assist me. Aside from this, the lobby is very impressive, the location is awesome, you can walk everywhere. However, due to the fact we have a child, unless the hotel agreed to waive the extra bed fee again, I think I would return to the Swissotel Stamford over the road, which is slightly more expensive, but they provide bedding free of charge. By the time you add the cost of the bed to the Carlton's price, you may as well stay at the Swissotel which is a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, convenient location and well-appointed rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Davo55_11
Reviews.Content: We would be happy to spend more time at this property. It is well located to shopping areas and sightseeing (such as the Singapore Flyer and the Marina Sands complex), next door to Raffles Hotel. We stayed in the new Premier wing; the bed and linen were really first-rate, and the bathroom very well thought-out. It was nice being able to open a window, and most relaxing to sit on the window seat and enjoy the view. The only reason I am not rating the 'service' aspect as 5, is that it is annoying having to pay for wireless internet access. This should be a presumed service of such a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: fazzigucci
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe room for new year celebrations with a couple of friends and we enjoyed the spacious room in the main tower (old wing). Don't really like the old furnishings in the room, could really use a refurbishment. Rooms and bathrooms just looks plain but I got a good deal so can't complain. The new premier tower looks nice and would really love to see the rooms in there. Staff at check-in didn't leave an impression with me and the I noticed the front desk staff don't really look friendly. Maybe it's due to the high season and they're all so busy. Lobby looks nice and I noticed quite a few airlines also put up their cabin crew at this hotel. Would return to this hotel again maybe to try the premier wing rooms or due to the excellent location, just across raffles city shopping centre but not for the deluxe rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Beeswife
Reviews.Content: First time in Singapore. Checked in after midnight and found everything was perfect in the room. The beds were comfortable. The room was clean. Staff friendly and efficient. I loved the location as we could walk to numerous shopping areas and site-seeing highlights. The lobby is phenomenal with the glass art. The breakfast was everything you could want, other than being pricey. Downside: not a fan of the internet cafe.

Reviews.Title: “not that friendly”
Reviews.Author: craiglen596
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton for 4 nights the room was a good size clean and had a good view. The best thing about it was its location we were able to walk to just about everywhere. The staff at main desk did help you when asked but over all were not friendly. Would stay in same area again but don't thing would stay at same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Vaniades
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton for two night over new year eve. We had an excellent time: we were given an excellent stay. The room was large and clean. bed super comfy. Bathroom has both shower and bath. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The swimming pool was refreshing, but ambience could be improved. The location is excellent, walking distance from major attractions (raffles, sands marina bays etc...). We truly enjoyed our stay. We travel a lot on business and for leisure and often stay in top market hotels. We recommend this hotel if visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and deceptive”
Reviews.Author: janfrommanc
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel through Singapore Airlines stopover and had what we thought was a good deal. We checked in at 11pm after a flight from Australia and were told that we had been upgraded to a topfloor larger room. It then transpired that the "upgrade" was to a smoking floor (we had booked a non smoking room) and that the room would be ionised. We checked out the room and it did not smell too bad , we were tired so we accepted it. The room was in the older tower and although comfortable with a superb view it was distinctly faded. The Singapore stopover includes a 50% discount on food so we decided to have breakfast in the restaurant next morning .To obtain the discount you need to select from the a la carte menu. This is not such a good deal when you take into account full price for fruit juice and coffee - at 8 and 9 dollars respectively perhaps I should say overpriced. We did return to the restaurant to try the inclusive cooked breakfast.Perhaps better value if you like inedible fatty bacon and possibly the most disgusting chicken sausage I've ever refused to eat and coffee which would make Starbucks blush. This is not a 4 star hotel despite the plush reception.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve weekend fantastic”
Reviews.Author: calikid12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton for 4 days over the New Years holiday. Hotel is rated 4 stars...more closer to 5. We were put in the new tower maybe for the non-smoking room request, old tower is clearly dated on the outside. The pool sits in between the two on the 5th floor. Our room was incredible, marble top to bottom in the bath. Room nice clean carpet, with light wood trim.Bed super comfy with two down pillows each. All the lights,maid service,do not disturb are on lighted switches for them to observe in the hallway. Location is downtown. A nice mid-point for shopping at Orchard and Marina Bay. The MRT station is across the street for two lines: Green and Red. Green gets you to the airport. Red goes to Marina Bay and Orchard Rd. very convenient. Only about 1.50USD for a one way ticket. Most taxis know this hotel so getting back there is easy. Getting a taxi from there is super easy too. As for not being a 5 star....Only complaint we had was the internet daily/min charges.... 60cent per minute or $24 a day. We needed it for some restaurant advise so we paid to surf for a little bit. Very nice hotel and great value too we paid $260 S a night avg. for the New years weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Debbie K
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel this is. Well situated, next to the Raffles Hotel and bar and shopping mall. Rooms well equipped and generous in size. Fantastic views from upper levels over the skyline. Hotel staff very helpful. Meals good. Buffet breakfast to die for. 100% quality

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel for the location”
Reviews.Author: IWasHereBefore
Reviews.Content: Clean, neat and tidy. Fantastic location and possibly the best value hotel in Singapore given the fantastic location. We had adjoining rooms in the new part of the old wing of the hotel and were very happy with rooms, staff and amenities of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: royDrachten
Reviews.Content: the location is good. China town, Singapore's art museum, City hall MRT, Chymes, Boat Quay, Esplenade, Marina Bay and Funan digital mall are all within walking distance. Large , fairly clean rooms and just as efficient as most of the other hotels in Singapore. One have to pay for wired internet in the room, no wireless connection (yet?).

Reviews.Title: “Anxious to serve”
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the new Premier wing of this hotel on three previous occasions, having stayed a number of times in the older part of the hotel. This stay confirmed my earlier thoughts about it. Positives: excellent location opposite Raffles Hotel (in fact if you ask for a room on the front you can overlook Raffles); Molton Brown toiletries in the room; comfortable beds Negatives: the staff in the Club Lounge are too anxious to please, but English proficiency was of a low level, leading to lots of misunderstandings; the lounge has some great views towards the new Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer. It's a bit lacking in character, and especially lacking in guests - there were never more than a handful at any one point. I suppose this could be a positive if you don't want to be disturbed. Not cheap here - paid S$520 per night for the premier rooms - but then most hotels in Singapore are far from cheap. You could do far worse than this and it's certainly handy. You just can't help your mind from wandering onto how much character Raffles exudes, as you gaze at it from the Carlton lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: VanessaAdele
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Carlton. We were in the older wing, not the beautiful new wing, but the price was good and the location excellent, opposite the Raffles Mall. Our special deal in November with Singapore Airlines included a reduction in the cost of food at the Hotel Restaurant, which was much appreciated. The food was very good, especially the delicious, aromatic curry! Staff were helpful and we were able to move into our room quickly, even though it was breakfast time. No WiFi in the rooms, which was annoying, but the hotel Business Centre had computers. The carpets in the hall have seen better days. Our room was large, spotless and reasonably comfortable, although the furniture was not new. I liked the pool.

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Singapore including the week end”
Reviews.Author: gian2010
Reviews.Content: First time in Singapore and I honestly tell you that is a really pleasant city..Peoples are frindly, weather is a "lttle bit warmed" and humid but... once you'll be in the marina district..you won't think about the weather..

Reviews.Title: “Good location but Internet connection is a problem...”
Reviews.Author: Sugarbbuummpp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a executive suite in old wing, toilet could be improved and there are stains on the carpet, unsightly peeling wall paper.... what really disappoint us was the internet - there's no wi-fi on the 20++ floors and we need to pay for internet connection via LAN or Wi-fi (per machine and accessible from lobby only). I don't understand a hotel of this standard not including such a simple service in the already expensive price. Pros will be the location - easy access to the main attractions and shopping district. We are on the high floor and had amazing views (save you from going on the Singapore flyer :)

Reviews.Title: “carlton takes a turn for the worst”
Reviews.Author: Angela1940
Reviews.Content: Well never again!!! we stayed in the new wing on the business floor the business excuctive lounge has a lot left to be desired in their service, we asked for a chardonay and were refused on both nights ,they told us they only serve saviugon blanc.we decided not to take no for an answer on the 3rd night and asked to speak with the food and beverage manager, a staff member bought us the phone and told us that the F&B manager would speak with us.He said that he could not offer us a chardonay and apolagized and told us to go to the bar downstairs to purchase one. We went down stairs and decided to ask for the manager,he told me that the F&B manager was not on that night!! so then who were we talking too!! It turned out that one of the front office desk clerks pretended to be the F&B manager, yes we did get a bottle of Chardonay in the end.Well we have stayed at most of the Hotels in Sinagpore over the last 20 years and I don't know what they were thinking> As you can guess they will never have the pleasure of our business again and also many of our work colleagues, funny how bad service storys travel fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn5125
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us because of its location--it was just right. We got a good 3 for 4 might deal which is good for Singapore. The hotel amenities were excellent and the rooms spacious, clean and quiet. Eating in the hotel was expensive but it was so close to many other places it didn't matter. Across the street behind the white wall were more restaurants than you could frequent in a month. We had pizza under the stars--both food and ambience was wonderful. It was a short walk to Bugis Street Market -- great shopping! Diagonally across the street was Raffles City Shopping Centre where the food court was excellent and very reasonably priced with lots of variety if you are feeling homesick. Starbucks near the MRT located I. The centre had free WiFi with no passwords to hamper use. Of course, being in Singapore, it was incredibly clean and very well air conditioned. A short walk toward Bugis Street a new shopping mall is being built but the fifth floor cinema is complete and movies were right up-to-date and very cheap. We will stay at the Carlton when we next visit Singapore as it was very comfortable and only $17 from the airport (at night). The service couldn't have been more pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: Vil25
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only 3 nights with my husband and 19 month old baby. Check in was ok, did not take that long and staff were professional. Room was quite clean except for abit of guck on the corner tiles in the bathroom. Breakfast buffet was decent but not happy with the hard stiff bacon they served. If you are a light sleeper then during the night you may hear alot of planes going in and out of the airport which is only about 20 mins drive away. Well I personally didn't hear much of it but my husband complained about it. Location is good, close to and in walking distance to MRTs and Raffles City and Chimes. Overall stay was good! Much more of a business targeted hotel than a family with young kids kind of hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MrCushtie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the Carlton while working down in Cecil Street. The best thing about this hotel is the location - it's opposite the Raffles City mall, which sits on top of City Hall MRT, so getting around is very easy. If you're not laden with huge amounts of luggage you can take the MRT all the way from the airport, rather than spend 20 or 30 dollars on a cab. Speaking of saving money, you'll need to save all the money that you can if you want to use the internet in the rooms (20 dollars a day) or room service (a hilarious 9 dollars for a glass of fruit juice). You can walk from here into the centre of town, which is a pleasant 20 minutes when the night is cool, and a perspiration-drenched 20 minutes all the rest of the time. Orchard Road and all its shops is also very close. So there's not many places with a more convenient location than this. The downside of this hotel, and why I end up rating it as average, is that the hotel feels worn out. The carpets in the hallways are grubby, and every day when I left my room and walked to the lift, there was a pervasive smell of unwashed bodies, or soup, or general sadness and ennui, like a gloomy public institution, in the corridor. Perhaps it's because there's no natural light in the corridors. Perhaps they need to give a good squirt of air freshener every once in the while. The room itself isn't appalling, but not brilliant. From little things, like the batteries in the TV remote being dead, to the internet being priced ridiculously expensive (along with the room service, as I've already mentioned), up to the bathroom feeling rather old, the soundproofing against the traffic not being very effective, or the gloominess of the decor and the low-wattage bulbs in the room, it all added up to being somewhere you didn't really want to stay longer than you had to. So I stayed at the office as late as I could, and only went to the hotel to sleep. Breakfast I'd have elsewhere - again, why they'd quote a price of 30 dollars seems nearing offensiveness, unless this was a breakfast served by a minor member of a royal family. It's more disappointing because the foyer of the hotel is lovely, and very recently decorated - but while the new wing may be very pleasant, if you're staying in the old wing like I was, that brand new foyer is a mask behind which an ugly face hides. Staff were friendly and helpful, but again, I hardly interacted with any of them during my stay here. If all you need is a bed and somewhere secure to leave your belongings, fine, but other hotels in Singapore are more enjoyable than this.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay. City Centre. Nothing Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: dushyantmotta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for 2 nights. The hotel is nicely laid out, rooms are nice, spacious & pleasant. The hotel is centrally located and is close to most business establishments. I have stayed at the Pan Pacific & Marina Mandarin during my earlier visits.The Breakfast at the Carlton is OK. Could do better with more options. The Cantonese restaurant Wah Lok certainly is one of the must visits. I did not find anything exceptional or special about the Carlton. While I don't have any complaints, I fell that the overall stay experience was better at the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Wing”
Reviews.Author: tony10014
Reviews.Content: Echo the other responses. Clean, well-appointed room. Good location adjacent to Singapore Management University. Breakfast was disappointing. Only very basic choice of fruit. No smoked salmon. Limited range of bread. Atmosphere was a bit like a canteen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service!”
Reviews.Author: Enjoystravelling
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through travel agent. Hotel looked nice and comfortable. Checking in was very cumbersome though because they did not have my booking though I had a confirmed booking number. Spent easily 20 minutes sorting out the reservations. The manager on duty came to assist and was kind enough to upgrade us to a junior suite I believe. He also gave extra bed for free as we were a group of four. Hotel room was nice. The upgrade greatly helped us enjoy our stay with the extra space we had. The kids slept in the living room whilst we took the bedroom. Generally no complaints here. It was a typical family room environment with family type furniture. It worked out comfortably for us though I would assume someone on a biz trip staying in a suite would expect more upscale and luxurious settings in the suite. Location wise - good. Close to raffles city mall (2 mins). Suntec is 20 mins walk. Closest mrt is city hall which is in raffles city. There is a mcdonalds at the next block to the hotel. The people in the hotel are mostly friendly. Not the courteous friendly only but warm and friendly. Concierge was good. Two individuals stood out - Waran and Redzuan. They were warm and friendly and even went out of their way to assist me in any way I needed. Internet is horrible. SGD20 a day that I considered ridiculous. It was ironic though that Singapore, being a country quite advanced must still charge such prices. I ended up not using the internet throughout my stay there which is a negative for the hotel n Singapore. Checking out was again a problem. Again they had not resolved e booking problem and initially wanted to charge me for my stay though I had paid through the agent. I had to again retrieve my booking reference and so on. The front desk was very apologetic about it though. All in all, would I stay thereagain - yup!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: retiredat55
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very centrally located, adjacent to Raffles and the Chimes centre. Everything about the hotel was Ok but nothing outstanding. It certainly suffered in comparison to the other hotel we used in Singapore on this trip - and was more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore”
Reviews.Author: 223Katharine
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. When we checked in though we were given a room with 2 single beds when we had ordered a king 6 months prior. Apparently, there were none available! The following day we complained again and they moved us to a much nicer room with a king. Reception staff not very helpful but the man who helped move us was exceptional and advised us on what to see and do. He refused our tip also! Pool was quite nice. Breakfast very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this one!”
Reviews.Author: zacstar
Reviews.Content: Great location and easy to get to from the airport. Walk to marina and river and one train stop from Orchard Road. Lovely room and a pool to boot. This was an amazing find on Expedia that really surprised us for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, but poor cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: erik0829
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on two occasions in the last month or so. The location is good, next to Chimes and within walking distance to Arab Street. Also a short cab ride to Orchard and of course, it's across the street from Raffles Hotel. Breakfast was above average and the gym facility is newly renovated with good equipment. The rooms however, are a bit dated and ventilation in the hotel could be better. Smoking floors are interspersed in the hotel and I could smell smoke in my room from time to time. Acquired a nagging cough during the stay and I'm pretty convinced it was due to air quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired hotel. Overpriced for what it is. No WIFI (free or otherwise) in rooms !”
Reviews.Author: Jo C
Reviews.Content: After spending 4 weeks travelling through Europe, we decided to treat ourselves to 3 days in Singapore on the way home to Australia. We stayed in London, Paris and Prague and this was the most expensive hotel and the worst quality of all of them. We arrived early and as was to be expected, our room wasn't ready. The staff were pleasant, took our luggage, although it was stored in the public area with no security. In fact, we went to our bags a couple without anyone questioning us. The staff told us to come back in 3 hours and our room would be ready. Which it was. When we got to our room, it was a twin, not the king we had booked and it was obviously a smokers room, something we had definitely not requested. Rang downstairs and asked to be moved to a room with a king bed. Staff were very confused and eventually we found someone who could help us. Despite our voucher stating all of this as well as an upgrade, we had to constantly point this out. Finally got upgraded further and received a king room. Room was very tired.. In fact the whole floor was tired. Bed was very hard and uncomfortable.The carpet in the rooms and hallways have massive stains. Carpet definitely needs to be replaced. Bathroom was nice. Found unfortunately, the person staying in the room next door smoked in their bathroom, so our bathroom stank of smoke. Buffet breakfast was ok, but a lot of the hot food was luke warm at best. If you can, avoid the 8-9 rush, as this is when the business people are there and there are no tables. Overall staff are nice. Very average hotel, but great location. There are several other hotels nearby, Swisshotel Stamford and Fairmont. Maybe they are of a better quality. Wouldn't recommend if there were other choices available. Biggest disappointment was no wifi (forget that it wasn't free as it was in every other hotel we stayed in). You need a laptop in the rooms, so if you have a smartphone, absolutely no use what so ever. Wifi is only available in the lobby. Not where I like to do my business or personal stuff...

Reviews.Title: “Cold and Snobbish Check in”
Reviews.Author: frozzty
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1am for a night stopover in Singapore, nobody at the front lobby door, not until they see me dragging my suitcases with my wife and 2 kids, then they chased us to help dragged our 2 big suitcase. Requested a King bed, got me a twin room with two single bed. The ladies on the reception were cold and snobbish, kind a prejudice and racist toward us Indonesians, no smile, once i asked why "twin bedrooms, just answered, sorry fully booked!, What??, hello, i paid already!.Tiny beds! the indian porter who helped our luggage try his best to put us on a king bed room and yes he did managed us to moved to a smoking floor with a king bed as i requested and confirmed by the hotel email letter. The room suprisingly doesnt smell of any smoke or bad dusty smell. excellent. so, what's this fully booked explanations. the hotel is an airlines based hotel, where i saw they treat them really, really nice, when i tried to exchanged my $usd for $sgd for taxi to mustafa late at night. the receptions should be put on a hospitality lessons once again, at least towards all customer who stay in the hotel. Again, i give the porter and the front door lobby man, a big big two thumb ups, they make it up against the coldness of the receptions front desk staff. I understand the way of the singaporean, who work,work,and get money,money. but if they treat guest and visitor like this? the country would loose its charms.

Reviews.Title: “Premier wing is excellent”
Reviews.Author: FlorinCT
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded for free from Superior Room to Premier Room. The rooms are new, excellent quality, spacious and modern. Quality is even better than many 5 star hotels in Singapore, breakfast is good and very good service. Price on high range, but this is Singapore recently. Position is excellent, close to MRT and within walking distance to many attractions. Looks more like a business hotel rather than vacation hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: captmike_11
Reviews.Content: I took a room in the premier wing of the Carlton hotel. I was on a business trip so I could not use the other facilities that the hotel provides. The rooms are spacious, and the bathroom extremely clean and modern...nice experience. The service was also good and all in all, a very pleasurable experience here as compared to other similar priced hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lamlim13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton Hotel on Bras Basah Road last week. Was there for 6 nights with work colleagues for a shopping holiday. Arrived at some ungodly hour and was checked in very efficiently. I had a room to myself :) and was placed in room 926. I was so tired and exhausted but was kept awake by the constant noise of the lifts going on all night. The next day, I politely asked to be moved and guess what, they did - without any hesitation. They very kindly upgraded me from a superior room to a deluxe room! The location is what makes this hotel - its close to the City Hall MRT as well as to the rest of the island. The pool, though abit small in size makes up for lots of sun beds and chill out areas. The gym too was excellent. Overall a great hotel - great price, excellent location and very friendly staff. I'll be back definitely and thanks for the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Premier room”
Reviews.Author: Abdul R
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights during my business trip. I arrived at the hotel around midnight so the check-in procedure was done quickly by the staff. The room that I stayed was the new type Premier room. It is roomy and very comfortable. The bathroom is clean and excellent day after day. One of the best part of this hotel is the location. It is very close to Bras Basah MRT...only 3 mins walk. And the hotel is just opposite Raffles City shopping centre. The breakfast buffet is very average. The choice and quality of the food is no better than a 3 stars hotel. The cooked food were barely warm. Overall, Premier room is good, staff is good & friendly. But let down by the breakfast buffet and the relative expensive room rate.

Reviews.Title: “A good Place”
Reviews.Author: Tarun_Mavely
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place for a day. I found that was the hotel was conveniently located and the rooms are neat and clean. The lobby is impressive. Clark quay is just walking distance from here, so is Bugis. I would still recommend marina bay sands over this one any day though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Singapore, but not a 5* hotel at all.”
Reviews.Author: Koni21
Reviews.Content: We booked online and were picked up at the airport on time. The CARLTON is a big hotel in the middle of Singapore, a small walk behind the RAFFLES. The entrance hall is huge and let you expect a 1st class hotel. But on the way to your room you will realize that you not have booked a five star hotel. The gangways are not very clean, the rooms are nothing special, they are ok but definitely not to stay fore a long time. Internet is not free, the minibar is small assorted and overpriced. We loved it because you are near to the MRT station and can reach every point of Singapore very easily. Even by feet you are able to reach the big shopping malls, the harbour or many other places of interest. I think it is overpriced but even like that it is not easy to get free rooms. The pool is huge, clean and something of the best this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT a 5 star Hotel!!!! Try Traders, they are excellent.”
Reviews.Author: CindyMBali
Reviews.Content: This is the worst "5 star hotel" i have ever stayed in. Not worth the starting price of $315 SGD per night at all. From the minute i checked in until i left i had nothing but issues, they didn't have the room i booked and expected me to share a king bed with my colleague, CRAZY! The said there were no twin rooms (which is what i booked) then tried telling me that I didn't book a twin room) this was at 1am in the morning when i just wanted to go to bed. It took 35 minutes for them to put me in a twin room. Day 2 at breakfast $38 per head, very average, low grade buffet, the burners were not on under the food and it was all cold, when i told the staff they suggested i eat something else, this was at 7am with many people still to come. No one at the egg station had to wait for 5 mins for the chef to come and when i told him i wanted an egg white omelette he was very annoyed at the inconvenience, Moving to that evening where i had to move rooms and it took 1.5 hours for them to find me a room and then put me in a smoking room and told me it was a non smoking room. It stunk of smoke and had ashtrays everywhere and when i questioned this being a smoking room they replied, they advise guests not to smoke due to poor ventilation but they can if they wish. I do not appreciate being lied to by the staff and being taken for a fool. So after finally getting into the 2nd stinky room at 10pm at night we ordered room service, at 10.45pm we got a call saying they did not have what we wanted and to reorder, we finally had our COLD and tasteless dinner at 12am. My boss who was paying then went to the reception after hearing all that had happened and they compensated me by giving me a late checkout and a cold breakfast at the club lounge, i had booked and paid for an exec room which includes this anyway. In addition, the beds are hard and uncomfortable, television in one of my rooms was so dark i couldn't see the picture, my room wasn't made up until 3pm, I had deliveries not sent to my room and waited hours to get my bags. The hotel is clearly lacking in leadership, currently they have an acting general manager who must not be inspiring any accountability or service level standards within this hotel. The only redeeming feature was the duty manager who was eager to please but he had allot working against him with what he is working with. I will never return here. I recommend you try Traders hotel, they are fantastic , cheaper, excellent breakfast, amazing service and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Carlton Singapore a decent place”
Reviews.Author: abhijit_k2003
Reviews.Content: Carlton hotel is located at a good location, It has good staff and the rooms are nice The ambiance is good and the Staff is very cooperative The malls nearby makes shopping easy but if you are still not happy then you can take an MRT and travell to Orchard Road ;)

Reviews.Title: “An average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajeevemirates
Reviews.Content: A very average business hotel. The location is good and is in the middle of down town singapore and very close to Raffles Hotel. The reception area is very nice, the room itself was average - nothing wrong with it, just a bit plain and ordinary looking. The internet wasn't included so you need to pay to use it. The rooms were not so clean and it looks bit run down. The hotel can be quite crowded since it's a crew hotel for many airlines. Overall, an ok hotel for a quick stopover

Reviews.Title: “Good food and pool”
Reviews.Author: marcel186356
Reviews.Content: Stayed over on the way to australia, and the breakfast was nice and varied. The pool on the side of the building, halfway up was amazing at night, for the view of the city (and the weather).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJReid1030
Reviews.Content: We loved the convenient location of this hotel. There were several restaurants and shops within walking distance and when we did need a cab, it was an inexpensive ride. This is a fairly large hotel and with that, it feels a bit impersonal. When we booked the room, we were told we'd be in the 'new' wing as an upgrade. This hotel has a few wings and while I think we were in a 'new-er' section, it certainly wasn't brand new. The carpet had stains and you could see the distress in the bathroom. The room was nice and spacious which was a bonus being that many hotels in Singapore have such tiny rooms. I was a little disappointed that Internet was not complimentary in the majority of the hotel. The business wing on the opposite side of the lobby had complimentary access but in this day in age, everyone should have access. We did have lunch at the small lounge on the ground floor for convenience sake and we were thoroughly disappointed. It was nothing more than cafeteria food warmed up. Head across the street, you'll be much happier!

Reviews.Title: “nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: layang-kangen
Reviews.Content: I've always stayed at this hotel when I travle to Singapore, with couple exceptions when I wanted to try another hotel. location is great for sightseeing and business, close to 3 MRT lines, bugis, bras basah and city hall! service is cold but they are efficient so I dont complain about that! my concern is that they dont have any loyalty program !

Reviews.Title: “Good, no longer great”
Reviews.Author: DiggerPerth
Reviews.Content: The Carlton is an hotel we haven't revisited for many years - we used to frequent it when it was smaller and more homely. Level of service is still good as is location. However it seems to have lost that personal feeling it used to have. Also rooms are fairly ordinary - feel its time they were given an update to make them feel brighter and more modern. Its still a good hotel but no longer the standout it once was. We only had a brief stopover between flights and had to leave very early so didn't get the opportunity to test the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and satisfactory room.”
Reviews.Author: 29AJW
Reviews.Content: Carlton Hotel is in an excellent location, right in the middle of downtown Singapore, very close to Raffles Hotel if you want to get a Singapore Sling and close to shopping malls as well. There is a swimming pool which was nice to have. The reception area is very nice, the room itself was average - nothing wrong with it, just a bit plain and ordinary looking. Great view of Singapore from the room we stayed in. Hotel staff were good. The internet wasn't included so you need to pay to use it. Overall, it's a good hotel if you are having a quick stopover in Singapore and happy with an average looking room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Rick S
Reviews.Content: Thiswasa2 day stop over on the way to France to break the 24+ hr flight from Australia. Good location andeasy walking to many favorite shopping spots and Raffels just accross the road. Buffet food was excelent andwe got free vouchers for thingslike the Zoo, Bird Park, Bum Boat & China Town Museum and more but ran out of time. Staff are friendly and eager to help. We will stay again on the way back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lncclc
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore for two nights when my husband was there for business. We loved the location of this hotel. We walked the whole city. If you want the harbor and the marina, this is too far (but we did walk it once - taxis aren't too expensive) The price was better than most (all prices are very high!). Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “no problems, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Denali68
Reviews.Content: we stayed in July for a 4 night stopover (we were on the 10th floor) and would stay there again. pro: * very helpful staff - nothing was too much to ask * we used our singapore stopover vouchers (issued by travel agent) so the restaurant was 50% discount - which was SUPER helpful as i thought the breakfast prices were very expensive * didnt hear the traffic. there are some reviews about traffic noise but i never heard it at all and our window faced a busy street. * late checkout - we asked for a 3pm checkout and no problem, super glad for this as we had a quick nap after the zoo and before for our flight con: * expensive internet but we were so busy sight seeing we only had to buy one 24hr pass * mould on some of the bathroom tiles - yeah, the one thing i though uggghhh, it was only a few tiles but to see it anywhere in a hotel is disappointing * breakfast buffet - although looked WONDERFUL there is no way anyone can taste all of it and get your monies worth - its huge and has so much food wish i knew before we booked: * they have kind size beds. we usually book 2 singles as hotel beds are usually soft and we cant sleep in a double but would have booked a king if we had known next trip: although we would be happy to return i think there are too many other options so would stay at a different hotel to get a different experience

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at Carlton Hotel, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: qantas_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Carlton Hotel, Singapore. Checking in was a breeze. The reception staff were helpful and genuinely enjoyed their work. The concierge staff were always helpful and arranged a taxi for me for pickup at 4am for flight to Hong Kong. All staff I met always said hello, which was nice. The room was on 17th floor and overlooked the city of Singapore. My room was in the main building or 'old wing' as some have described this part of the hotel. In opinion, it wasn't all that old, and nothing to complain about. The room was spacious and room made up every day by house keeping. The bath room was okay. I am not keen on low ceilings, but it was nothing to inhibit my stay. Something I cherish most about staying in hotels is instant hot water, and here, it was. The television had a variety of channels and you could pay for movies, however, I did not. I used the internet everyday (broadband) and paid $20 SGD for 24 hours use. The internet is charged at 60 cents per minute, but not more than $20 for 24 hours. Therefore, no matter if you left the computer on, as I did, the highest charge was $20 per 24 period. I thought that was a fair deal. The hotel pool was a great respite away from the heat of Singapore and not overly used by hotel guests. I used it every day and towels provided at the pool. You will need sun screen! As part of my booking, I had breakfast included. It was everything one could ask for. All types of food from cooked to fruits to breads and different drinks to be had. I liked their coffee. The hotel is right across from Raffles City Shopping Mall and a short stroll to Clarke Quay for more shops and dining. It is quite central, but then everything is central in Singapore. I booked my stay through the Qantas website and paid for three nights and got the fourth free, with breakfast included. I could not complain about the service or the room. If I noticed anything that was not fantastic, I would say the carpet in some of the hallways was looking slightly tired, but as it is under my feet and I am not sleeping on it, it did not matter! I recommend this hotel for a good stay, I did.

Reviews.Title: “Old wing is... old!”
Reviews.Author: AlexBuzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the old wing where the rooms are definately old and outdated... I would definately recommend requesting a room in the new wing when you book as it looked much nicer. As far as the hotel and staff go, I wasn't overly impressed with either. The room was outdated as I said, beds were comfy, tv, telephone and plumbing all worked. The location is great, price is right, and it's close to the MRTs and all, and I would only stay at this hotel again if I made sure prior to booking that I was getting a room in the new wing.

Reviews.Title: “awful , 2 star hotel, do not believe what they claim”
Reviews.Author: OJ C
Reviews.Content: Carlton Hotel Is an awful hotel. It should be rated 2 stars. The hallways to the rooms are dirty and wet and smelly. The hotel has mold throughout. I am allergic to mold. The pictures of the rooms you show are not the rooms that they give to the guest who has prepaid. False advertisement. The telephones in the rooms do not work. Some have awful static. Others just do not work. Bathrooms are moldy. Staff not responsible. many things are broken.

Reviews.Title: “utterly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: turret k
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of our good previous experiences stayed in this hotel many years back. Unfortunately, the rooms we were alloted did not match what was stated in our confirmation email. From the confirmation email, we were supposed to have a harbour view room and based on that I was misled to believe that the hotel is referring to the premier wing (as that is the only wing facing the harbour/sea). BUT to my dismay, we were given a room in the old wing which has a building view(see photo). The carpet was stained and a mushy smell once we stepped out of the lift lobby leading to our room. The room itself was old and the small bathroom. The water from the shower point did not has sufficient pressure as well. It was a disappointing stay given what we were promised and the the price we have paid. Despite the good location, I would urge visitors to exercise extreme caution when considering to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Alison-K-QLD
Reviews.Content: Just had a week in Singapore staying at Carlton. From the minute our taxi turned up we were very impressed in every way. Great front desk service, arranged late check-out, room service orders were always correct and fast, the Cafe Mosiac had fabulous food and a great menu, it's great value for the money. We walked everywhere! Raffels City shopping was right over the intersection, a handy 7/11 food shop open across the road, walked down to Suntec City and Marina Square shopping then walked the other way to Bugis Junction. We also walked to the Singapore Flyer and Esplande area. The hotel was clean, room was serviced everyday with free bottled water. The only things were the air con was a bit noisey the first night but then got used to it and the fridge is only small so cannot really put big items in or freeze anything. The hotel views were great, the pool was well set out again with excellent pool-side service. The tours we did picked up from Carlton and it is well known by taxis, etc. Hope to go back to Singapore one day (still plenty of shops to check out) and will not even bother to look at another hotel option - will stay at Carlton again!

Reviews.Title: “Location the saving grace”
Reviews.Author: homesyd
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location to Raffles City and City Hall MRT. It was also within walking distance to Bugis and Esplanade MRT. We were put into the old wing (our request for the premier wing was denied) where the rooms were styled in the 80s, small bathroom and room. The only good thing about the room is the large flat screen TV. The carpets were also slightly stained in the corridors and lift foyers. Beds were comfortable. The pool was small, which we did not use. In the old wing, there was no wi-fi at all, not even in the lobby area. You could access the internet in the Business Centre, 15 mins for S$6. Free wi-fi is now widely available in most hotels, so this was disappointing, given the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Service not up to 4-Star”
Reviews.Author: ACR R
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for 3-nights in advance but was disappointed to be given rooms on a smoking floor on check-in. They offered to change the rooms that promise went unfulfilled. Though twin sharing with two guests per room, I was charged for an additional guest in each room for God knows what reason. The rooms were decent though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in very busy city”
Reviews.Author: ShahFamily2011
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel while the F1 one going on. Hotel was very busy. Had booked a standard room in the Premier wing. Got an upgrade to a higher category.
