Room was well decorated, large LCD tv with pay movies too. The bed was amazing. Bathroom size was larger then most other hotels in Singapore. Location is excellent, lots of places for food near by. In room dinning menu was very dull not much for vegetarian eaters, besides sandwich and one type of pasta. Service is excellent, all the staff are very helpful and friendly. Will definitely stay back again here.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: Andrew U
Reviews.Content: For our second trip to Singapore we booked the Carlton mainly due to its location and the fact it has a pool. The rates seemed reasonable at the time, reviews here mainly seemed positive and the hotel looked nice on the website. We originally intended to stay in March, but had to change our travel plans. The hotel was initially reluctant to let us do so and wanted to charge us 100% of the rate (as per their policy) as a cancellation fee. However, they relented, as allowed us to change the booking to September, which was appreciated. I think that this policy needs review. We stayed in one of the regular (superior) rooms and it was a good size, clean (although the carpet looked grubby) and quite well appointed. When we arrived we found a fold out bed in the room instead of the baby cot we had requested. This took a couple of phone calls and, eventually, a visit to the reception desk to resolve. The staff were professional, willing to help and quite friendly. The pool area is small, but quite nicely done although in need to a little renovation. It seems that the more expensive a hotel is the more inclined to charge for things they are. Wifi was available only for $21 per day of $0.66 per minute! The hotel also had no guest laundry, just a per item paid service. When we stayed the Ibis on Bencoolen Street wifi was included and a guest laundry provided. Not that the Carlton is *that* expensive, but it is significantly more pricey than the Ibis. The hotel lacks character or charm. It is perfectly functional and smoothly run, but I will not be staying again, nor would I recommend it to my friends. Other travellers have described it as a business hotel, but unless I had a very good corporate rate I wouldn't want to stay there on business either.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the name of the game”
Reviews.Author: yusil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Carlton for a week. The good thing with this hotel is that it is within the CBD. Shopping malls, restaurants, clubs/entertainment areas are all within walking distance from the hotel. The train station is also nearby. The services of the hotel and the amenities are quite good. Rooms are spacious and clean. Worthy to mention is the welcome fruit basket which is in your room upon arrival. Transportation system in Singapore is very organized. The train system is likewise one of the best in Asia (I guess). You can go from one place to another by merely walking through the underground halls connecting several major buildings/sites. For those new in Singapore, be prepared to furrow your brows and clear out your ears as sometimes, Singlish is quite a challenge to understand.

Reviews.Title: “If WiFi is Important, Beware...”
Reviews.Author: ThomasTXNY
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location run by professional staff. Definitely geared towards the business crowd and that's okay My issue is that not only do you have to pay for WiFi but you have to pay $20 SD for EACH device AND the service is available only in the lobby - no reading in bed or checking emails in the morning. Big hassle and expense, especially if you aren't on an expense account. Just factor the expense and inconvenience in If you like to walk, this hotel works. You're about a mile, 30 minute walk +\-, to Chinatown, Clarke Quay, Little India, Arab St, etc. Right across from Rafflrs City, if shopping is your thing WiFi not important, I recommend this hotel. Connectivity part of your life, investigate elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lalina_Norway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Carlton for 6 nights. We stayed in excecutive floor and rooms were large and nice, internet and breakfast included. Lounge service was excellent, perfect fingerfood and drinks. The hotel was next to Raffaels, so do not forget to try a Singapore Sling there.. The Raffaels Shopping mall and a nice outdoor eating area was close to the hotel. We stayed here for business and would warmest recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and more!”
Reviews.Author: 48Bev
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - right opposite the famous Raffles Hotel (the place to go for high tea...make sure you book well in advance) and opposite the Raffles City Mall that has a great Marketplace downstairs where you can experience foods from many different cultures for very reasonable prices. Don't forget to checkout the bakeries while there and try some of the best sweets/desserts I have ever seen! The staff at the Carlton were all very friendly and efficient. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “1 Week in Singas”
Reviews.Author: RissK
Reviews.Content: The Carlton was really nice, we stayed in a deluxe room - the floor was really quiet, which was good, there was no noise from any of the other rooms. The conceige staff and bellhops were really friendly, There was always a steady flow of taxis to jump into when we wanted to pop out. It was also relatively cheap for our stay- which was booked through Bookings.com, when we stayed an extra night and paid directly - it was alot more expensive. The buffet breakfast wasnt the greatest for the amount we paid, The egg station guy was good, and the bacon was REAL bacon, but the scrambled eggs was mushy as hell... otherwise, we enjoyed out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really good stay”
Reviews.Author: kimsantos
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Carlton during our vacation to Malaysia and Singapore. The hotel was top notch and it is hard to put a finger on anything. The location is very good and close to the shopping malls. Staff seemed very friendly. We only really did miss free wifi. The price is way to steep as it is with most other big city hotels. I believe we stayed in a Deluxe Room. Had good space. The king size bed was very comfy. Bathroom nice and with all in necessities. The view of the city from our room was very beautiful. The breakfast buffet in Café Mosaic was deliciuos and with almost all you could dream of - Cereal, oatmeal, bread, croissants, cakes, juice, milk, coffee, eggs, bacon, waffles, fruit, you name it. We did not try out the fitness but it looked good and with a variety of machines. We also did not get a chance to try out the pool neither. But it also looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, bit hectic”
Reviews.Author: Peedies
Reviews.Content: Due to Jetstar cancelling our flight, we missed our first night at the Carlton and arrived after midnight the second night. We had sent advance warning of the late check in, but unfortunately were given a standard room, instead of executive. The next morning, however, the reception staff were apologetic and upgraded us to a lovely suite in the old section with complimentary breakfast. Classic decor and three times bigger than the original room we were given. While there were a few other issues with our charges, in all instances, the staff quickly rectified the problem and were pleasant about it too. The location is great and it's nice to be able to walk out the door and be within 10 minute walk of the Marina, Fort Canning, and other sights. I'd stay again, but only in the new section (or that lovely suite in the old bit).

Reviews.Title: “Check in experience was lousy”
Reviews.Author: GuptaDebjani
Reviews.Content: Was on a business trip with 2 of my colleagues to Singapore and we had our bookings done at the Carlton, this hotel comes under our company's approved hotel list. We reached the hotel at around 8:15 PM. While checking in we were informed that there were only 2 rooms booked for three of us. When asked to correct this error and give us the 3 rooms that were booked for us and we were carrying the confirmation letter with us (thank God), the lady at the reception was all confused and said that for the 3rd room she will give us the rack rate. When asked why, gave us some feable excuse that they need a mail from the organisation who has done the bookings etc. etc.... Found it very strange as all of us had our visiting cards and company id cards and had email proof that we have confirmation for 3 individual rooms. This took was some 45 mins.....so we asked her to put us to her duty manager as we were not able to get through to her at all. It took her 20 mins to get her manager and all this time we were waiting with our baggage at the desk after a long flight. Thankfully, the manager understood the issue and he sorted it out for us. This was my first stay at the Carlton and the first impression wasn't great. Thye rooms were fine....no frills ....also the check-in process was so stressful that it left a strong impression on us.

Reviews.Title: “Slips at the Last Post”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located. Pleasant staff. Upgraded room on arrival. However this is a business style hotel and they are all the same (nice, but all the same) so it is the attention to detail that matters. The bathroom sink was cracked, the shower attachment on the bath had been removed without it being sealed off making it impossible to run a bath without water splashing everywhere except the bath (and how did they manage to clean it wihout noticing, or if they did notice why was nothing done about it?), the temperature guage in the (separate) shower was completely inaccurate and the red safety button did not work (maybe OK for an adult, but possibly rather grim for a child) although since the reading was wrong you could still scald yourself on 20 degrees anyway, the television control button needed pushing a dozen times before it responded. The toilet paper was folded nicely though. The room was clean, spacious and decorated as pleasantly as any other in the same price bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectation”
Reviews.Author: Ilia N
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of hotel, would have no hesitancy in recommending others stay there. Service from staff hotel was great, close to Raffles City Shopping centre and if looking for some Aussie food, there is an Australian restaurant right next the the centre. Also in center there is a food hall with plenty of choice in food for all tastes. Hotel is close to MRT so you can easily get to any part of city quickly. Hotel does not have its own shuttle service, but taking taxi from airport and back is cheapest. Near City Hall MRT is a laundry place a very good rates if needed. While in Singapore, must try out Santosa Island, by Skyrail.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel made returning to Singapore perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Evek63
Reviews.Content: This was first time back to Singapore having been born there 47 years ago. The hotel and the staff were professinal warm and friendly giving that personal touch often only associated with small hotels. Our room was beatiful on the 26th floor and the hotel was within walking distance of most major attractions including Raffles Hotel, Orchard Road and Clarke Key. Would definitely rate this hotel and its wonderful staff as excellent!

Reviews.Title: “It will do”
Reviews.Author: itsstanners
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel ever but it kind of give's you the attitude "At least it's a roof over my head". I was in the old building and it has aged a bit you could say. Pros: - Friendly staff - Wireless included Cons: - Was in a room where our wireless didn't work - Breakfast wasn't inclusive - Swimming pool in the old building wasn't the best and only spent an 1 hour down there as it was tragic. - Slow service with the operator trying to work out the internet - Never any answer from the reception

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Raffles but very average rooms”
Reviews.Author: KiwiStevechch
Reviews.Content: Not a hotel I would return to... If forced to make sure you are in the new wing as we were in the old part of the hotel where the rooms were very average and extremely basic for the cost. The bathroom had black hairs on the floor and the bed had a foriegn object in it. At $200plus a night I was not impressed. The entrance etc is nice but thats where it stops. The staff are very good with great service. First and last time for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very good revamp, good service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm R
Reviews.Content: The public areas of the hotel are very swish - although there's too much plastic in the main restaurant - it feels like a cheap cafeteria (but the food was excellent in quality and selection). Bedroom was fine in all regards except for a stupid positioning of the closet - if you open the door and then pull out a drawer it is impossible to get from bathroom to bedroom - fit sliding doors you idiots! Conference facilities good and staff attentiveness and efficiency very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Book the Premier Wing Rooms if you can”
Reviews.Author: ACChua
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Carlton Hotel over the new year's. Had originally booked for a normal room in their old wing. Upon check-in however, I requested for a room with the nearest view of the city due to the new year's fireworks display. The staff gladly upgraded us to a room at their premier wing and I must say it does not disappoint. For starters, the room is huge. I have stayed in about 7 other hotels in Singapore and this was certainly the largest I've seen. The bathroom was also larger than normal, with cool marble tiles and a see-thru glass panel. The toiletries were from Molton Brown. 2 bottles of mineral water were also provided on a daily basis. The furnishings are new, well-appointed and add to the ambience of the room. It looked like some conscious effort was really done to differentiate the premier wing rooms from their regular ones. Their gym facility was well-equipped, with the machines maintained relatively well. Did not get to try the hotel breakfast as I had only booked for the room, but room guests were given some discount coupons to dine in the restaurants in the hotel. All in all, I was pretty satisfied with my stay at Carlton Hotel. The room upgrade really made the difference. If it were not for that, I believe I would not have been able to give such a positive review of this hotel so try the premier wing rooms if you decide to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: VK83
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 30 day advance rates so it was a reasonable deal for Singapore. Room was nice and a decent cot was provided free of charge for my niece. The hotel has a decent gym and a nice swimming pool, although the water is quite cold as it does not get a lot of sun. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is opposite raffles and a short walk to city hall MRT. The hotel has been recently refurbished but work still seems to be going in as there was loud drilling noises in the morning. However, it seems almost Free Internet was provided with the room and wifi is available in the lobby. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Carlton Hotel was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: loriperth
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself recently stayed at the Carlton Hotel in Singapore for the first time. Although we travel to Singapore regularly, this was our first stay at the Carlton and I was a bit apprehensive as we are used to staying at a particular hotel in Singapore. However, we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was great - beautiful rooms (new wing) with fabulous bathrooms and great location. The staff were wonderful - we had arrived via an early morning flight having travelled all night - the staff kindly allowed us to check in early as they could see that we were very tired - we were even given a coupon for a complimentary beverage while we waited for our room to be ready. We were very impressed with the hotel and the warm and friendly staff and will certainly return for another stay. Thanks Carlton!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Debb W
Reviews.Content: If you could use the internet for free there this would have been the best hotel we have stayed in all year. Close to everything, friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms...perfect!

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: sherpafamilyhk
Reviews.Content: the hotel location is great!! the rooms are clean and nice. the pool is small but good and clean. the restaurants in the hotel are excellent. cheap food court also right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one of the finest hotels”
Reviews.Author: bhavana_praveen
Reviews.Content: its in the heart of the city its a class apart, we had a great stay here more than anything its walkable to many malls and eat outs....and other attractions. the rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “It won't wow you, but won't disappoint you either”
Reviews.Author: Kyungshikah
Reviews.Content: A personal favorite hotel of mine in Singapore. I've visited Singapore for business trips as well as personal trips, and though it isn't the flashiest hotel around, it is the best of the second tier(or 4 star hotels if you will) in Singapore in my opinion. My personal preference when choosing a hotel in a city is to find a hotel which is which is close enough to the central locations but far enough where you're not right in the middle of the madness. I prefer a little distance, and don't mind traveling to the main attraction if I choose to. That said, in terms of location, though not on Orchard road, it is right across from Raffles shopping centre, Chimes(they have some very decent restaurants there) and 5-10mins walk to a lower tier shopping centre called Bugis Junction. Not to mention, there are convenience stores all within walking distance, supermarkets, internet cafes, money changer, restaurants, cafes, and any other stores to fulfill your needs. Location wise, this place is fantastic! As for the rooms itself, I usually stay in the superior or executive room; I wouldn't say there is an awful lot of difference between the two rooms besides a slighter bigger bed. The bathroom is of fairly good size and quality, every so often I get a room where the bathroom door doesn't shut properly, but that is a minor issue not even really worth mentioning. The TV is large, and it comes with multiple channels to choose from. Unlike in many of the Australian hotels, it comes with many of the cable channels! Again, not a big deal unless people choose to travel to another country just to remain in their hotel rooms. I find the service to be professional and helpful. I personally don't need someone to be overly friendly, and in my face or even overly eager. If I need assistance I'd like the staff to be helpful and the staff here from my experience do just that. Mostly I eat out, but when I do eat within the hotel I choose to eat at Cafe Mosaic - you'll see it as soon as you enter in to the lobby. The buffet breakfast isn't the best, but it will fill your stomach nevertheless with decent to good food. In regards to the other foods served at this cafe, I would say it's pretty decent to above average. When you factor in that it's a 4 star hotel, the food is very good. The gym is small but decent, as is the pool. Again, nothing flash but gets the job done. Overall, I'd say it's one of the better 4 star hotels in Singapore has to offer. Good location, good service, clean, good food, and a very decent bed (yes, bedding is extremely important to me; I'm not afraid to admit it!). If you want an affordable yet, comfortable hotel to stay in during your stay in Singapore, Carlton is where I'd suggest. Want something a little more grand and stylish, I'd suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel looks great shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: keenbean06
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in stopover and was by a pleasant experience. Air conditioning was not working and in the middle of the night changed to 33• and service was horrible. Had heard such great things but was very dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “great location but dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: natalie623
Reviews.Content: got a room in the old wing--apparently in an executive wing...room was alright,the closet door of the refrigerator was broken,the room was a bit stuffy and some areas in the room were dusty door knob,table...room didnt have a good view..no face towels provided,not even an extra pilow.. :( breakfast was good though,lobby was beautiful and location was great thats about it...will give this a 3/5

Reviews.Title: “lovely 4 star hotel ,opposite Raffles, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gypsy039
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here before 3 years ago but it has been added to and renovated and is a really nice hotel . Right opposite Raffles, on the Hop on Bus Route, good restaurant, bar and rooms nice & roomy with a super king bed.. The new addition has the premier rooms in so imagine them to be of a high standard. Good gym & swimming pool. walking distance to Suntec City ( about 15 min) , bus pick ups for all tours, really attentive staff. I got a package with room, breakfast & 2 tours & airport transfers with Creative Holidays for a very reasonable price. will stay there again if I get back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service. Lovely hotel. Central for shopping.”
Reviews.Author: DanSimmo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few hotels in Singapore and this is the nicest. And it's well located for Raffles/Chijmes shopping in the huge malls between the Hotel and Suntec. It's walkable to Orchard road, but in reality it would be a nicer trip in a taxi. It's less than 100m from the hotel to the start of the air-conditioned malls that stretch for miles. I can't really speak for the rooms as we were upgraded to a colossal five-room suite. It was pristine and well equipped, as you'd expect it to be. We were in the 'old' part of the hotel - not that anything looked old. We had three peaceful sleeps. Some neighbourhood music in the distance one night it didn't last for long. We tried the room service one night and it was reasonable value (we felt like some typical hotel food). But there are dozens of restaurants and food courts within easy walk. Try the food court in the mall attached to the SwissHotel (level 3 maybe?) to save money ... or head to the basement of the same mall for a huge choice of restaurants. The staff were always very helpful, and seemed genuinely so ... not just chasing a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, compare prices with other hotels in the area before making your choice”
Reviews.Author: smilingtraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton after staying at the Swiss Hotel. Strangely we managed to get a better rate for the Swiss hotel which is a step above the Carlton. The Carlton has comfortable rooms, a nice pool and gym. The location is excellent to explore the city as you are 2 minutes walk to the MRT. Chimes, Raffles City and the Raffles Hotel are just across the road from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby decoration, super friendly & helpful bellboy, food is good, one block away from Orchard Rd.”
Reviews.Author: MerryGoRoundKnight
Reviews.Content: The lobby is well-decoreated. The staff are nice esp. the Indian bellboy who gave us direction to the Flyer. Room is clean but the tub didn't drain well, had to wait at least 20 mins after one took a bath then the next person can use it w/o flooding. The location of the hotel is good as it's just a block away from Orchard Road. There is a subway station about 5-10 mins walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Jill35dg
Reviews.Content: Room was large with good lighting for work. Pool was good and easy to use towel system. Staff at front desk were helpful. Food in cafe was mxuch better than expected from a strong buffet focus. Ordered off menu and was pleased with service and quality. One drawback on cafe is that if you are there during durian season, they had some special promotion. If you like durian and it's smell then great. If you do not Ike it than avoid at that time as the odor was strong. Going forward I would say the hotel needs some refurb and some cleaning up but reasonable and more than acceptable. Has at least 2 air lines crews staying so reaches some reasonable standards.

Reviews.Title: “I suspect you pay for what you get with room quality”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeAussieExpat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because was inbetween houses in singapore and needed one night's accomm. Seemed good value for money, got a wotif.com deal and it was cheaper than a lot of 3 star hotels. Pros Location was great, by city hall MRT, chijmes, Boat Quay etc Taxi was easy to get in the morning Cons Bed linen was old, what was once white, is now beige, the only non smoking rooms left were twin singles, carpet and furnishings a bit dated, and TV dated.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: patsot
Reviews.Content: me and my friend really enjoyed our 4 day stay in this hotel... excellent place to rest after our whole day tour.. good service as well...my friend bing lourdes who sponsored this trip indeed was very happy.. she made the right choice ... Carlton hotel is d best...

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A1bs
Reviews.Content: The check in was quick and staff friendly and professional. However once I got to my room, it was a smoking room and being a non-smoker the smell was unbearable. I asked reception for a non-smoking room and it took about an hour to arrange, which was OK as I went over to the shopping mall across the road for that hour. Room was ready and much better than previous. The room and bathroom was large with the décor a bit on the old side, the TV channel connection was poor giving a sub-standard picture and sound. However overall the room was comfortable. The gym was well equipped and good size. The breakfast buffet lacked choice and quality could have been better. Overall the hotel is comfortable, with its professional and friendly staff being the hotel’s main asset. I have stayed in a number of hotels in Singapore and unfortunately the Carlton ranks low in comparison

Reviews.Title: “terrible severe from staff and management”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at just about every 4 or 5 star hotel in singapore and all i can say is dont bother with this one... I booked a room on their website thinking i had booked a room in their new tower, when i was checked in i was directed to a room in the old tower, i informed the staff member that i thought i had booked a room in the new tower, she said no you have booked an executive room, she said if i wanted the new tower she could sell me a "package", i informed her i have stayed in this old tower before and was not happy with it, she recommended i check it out first, the old tower is shocking, very old and warn out, the room and hallway stunk of cigarette smoke, the room was rubbish with a crappy old 20 year old bed and terrible pillows, anyway i was in the room for 15 minute and the reception didn't even bother to call to see if the room was ok for me.. anyway i ended up moving rooms to the new tower, the hotel and management attempted to fraudulently charge me an extra $100 for the privilege, on there own website they were only charging $20 for the better room but they were insisting to sell me there upgrade "package" I said no way... I said for the utter cheek of attempting to rip me off i am now not paying anything, they ended up giving me the better room for free but at that stage i was so annoyed, i would have been more happy just to move to a better hotel.. Anyway the premier rooms are fine, but good service at this hotel is nonexistent, most of the staff struggle to speak english and quite often speak their native langue to each other while in front of a guest. You think with all the trouble I had the management would have called my room later to see if I was happy but no nothing not a word from them, they dont care less and just want to sell you a "package" or "upsize" you like your at McDonalds...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: BenDunstall
Reviews.Content: After doing quite a bit of research on the location of hotels and trying to find something on a reasonable budget which is difficult for Singapore I settled on the Carlton Hotel for our 4 night stop over on the way home from Penang. When we arrived we were upgraded to an Executive room which came with the extra perk of free internet which came in handy. The rooms were a good size, with a separate walk in shower which was a bonus. We didn’t have a great view but if you peered between two buildings you could see the pool at the Raffles hotel. Location wise it was excellent for everything we did as there were a number of MRT stations at close distance including city hall which is an interchange station between two lines. The fact that breakfast was not included did not really matter as Raffles City was directly across the road and the marketplace downstairs has a range of breakfast options, toast shops seem to be a big thing in Singapore. If you don’t have internet included don’t use the hotel one as we had to use the business centre to print our boarding passes for our trip home and it cost me $8 for 5 minutes on the computer and 2 print outs. I should have looked around for a internet café, my lazy fault. The pool is OK but no afternoon sun and the gym is well equipped. Overall and excellent hotel in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: stus5
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews about the Carlton hotel before we left I must admit I had my doubts about staying there. ALL unfounded!!! The hotel was fantastic the staff were lovely and extremely helpful, all were friendly and polite. We especially appreciated the welcome from the gentlemen at the door after a long flight that was delayed. The rooms were clean and the hotel facilities, pool, bar, restaurant and lobby etc were fantastic. The hotel is located in a fantastic area, across the road from Raffles on one corner and a huge range of restaurants across the road in Chijmes. There are many shopping centres within walking distance, and Orchard Road is about a 15 minute walk or a short taxi ride (less than SGD $8) We also walked to Marina Bay sands about 20 minutes and also small taxi fare. Also had a good travel desk within the hotel with lovely ladies who gave us information and organised tours for us WOULD DEFINITELY STAY HERE AGAIN ANYTIME IN SINGAPORE We didn't have dinner in the restaurant or use the spa

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babsfromtas
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights en route to Europe. Booked through SIA Stopover package so got a good price. Were upgraded to a better room and although in the old part we have no complaints. Room was spacious, clean and quiet and we slept well. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful and we even got a free late checkout (to 3 pm). Did not try the pool but we could view it from our window. Hotel is in excellent location near Raffles and Metro station. Would recommend and stay here again. (we actually prefered this hotel to the more upmarket hotel we stayed in on our trip back home).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lots of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: griangraf2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a five night stay, and found the staff to be polite and helpful, and the rooms were very comfortable. The pool is nice, and there is a well equipped gym. My only gripe was the extra charges for internet and breakfast, it's so petty to charge extra for these when staying at an expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: greenerie
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the great service, from reception, concierge to ground staff. The moment you get off the taxi, there is someone who will take your luggage all the way to the front desk. And when you collect your luggage from the concierge to leave the hotel, someone would be there to take your luggage and spontaneously brings it to the entrance of the hotel and help you flag a cab. There was always someone who comes forward to offer help while you the front desk. The room is always kept clean and tidy. Great location too. I would go back there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame they rob you for the wifi”
Reviews.Author: Grant13
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel particularly if you stay in the Premier Wing, the rooms there are fantastic, they are spacious, modern and well appointed (see the photos). The pool is good, however if you want to get a tan you have to be there in the middle of the day as it is shaded in the mornings and afternoons by the surrounding towers. The location is great, across the road from Raffles and a 15 minute walk to Clarke Quay or to the better parts of Orchard Rd, of course with the price of taxi's you may just choose to take one instead and there are always plenty around here. Across the road from the hotel is Raffles City Mall and Chimes (a place filled with resteraunts) if you dont want to eat in the hotel or travel far for a meal, between these two places there are lots of choices to suit most budgets. Alas the hotel is let down by its internet charges - you pay 60 cents per minute up to half an hour then $20 for 24 hours access and just to add to the pain if you have a laptop and a mobile that you wish to connect to the wifi they charge you for each device so you can end up paying $40 per day (about the same as a months unlimited acces costs me at home). In a city that provides free wifi hot spots this is a crazy policy for a hotel that wants to be recognised as a leading establishment. They need to look at doing what many hotels in a competative market place do and provide access for free or for a very nominal charge - the current arrangement just makes the place look cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Not as what it look, new outside but old inside.”
Reviews.Author: LevneK
Reviews.Content: I just went for a 2 days 1 night stay. Kind of disappointed, we were given a old room, the view was even worse. When I first check in, the lady at the counter wasn't friendly , didn't smile with greeting, but that was fine. When we ask about our late check out, she sighed and paused. Then replied, I can't let you check out at 3pm, the most is until 2pm. See, we already stated in our booking on late check out, and we are not begging leh, why must you sigh. When we reach our room, the view was other building's rooftop. Not even harbor view. The room looks quite old, the furniture was old. The door to the tv cabinet was dropping off. Never expect this from a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, well maintained rooms”
Reviews.Author: Doralicious28
Reviews.Content: Location: Very close to the MRT. (train). The location (Marina Bay) is also walking distance to all the tourist attractions (Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, Merlion) in Singapore. It is also right next door a a mall, (Raffles City) and bars and restaurants (Chjimes). Rooms and Facilities: Very well maintained. Rooms are clean and complete with whatever you need (hair dryer, iron and ironing board, mini bar, toiletries)

Reviews.Title: “Good located hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutchcouple_9
Reviews.Content: Business hotel. Stayed here for three nights. First night I had a room at the street site. For me, the noise was too much, so asked for another room for the remaining two nights. After getting a room at the street site again (why is it so difficult to get a correct room) I got a room overviewing the pool. This was located in the new building and was much more comfortable then the first room I had (not noise, separate shower and more modern). The beds are great (very important for a hotel). Breakfast was perfect. Lots of different styles, from European to Asian. One big comment is that there is no Wifi available in the rooms, only in the lobby. A big minus for a business hotel. I forgot to switch of the privacy light the second night. Just did that at 6 pm and immediately switched on the 'clean my room' light. One and a half hours later, when I returned to my room, it was indeed cleaned. Perfect service. Location is next to the Raffles shopping center, where also the MTR is. Perfect when working in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: CaTiLo
Reviews.Content: The best of this hotel is its location, as it's walking distance to many of the main attractions in Singapore, shopping malls and restaurants. It's comfortable in general, but you could expect more for a 4-5 star hotel. The room is just standard, with the usual facilities for this kind of hotels, bed is average in quality but the bathrooms look over-used and not attractive. The view from the upper rooms is awesome. The room service is average, regarding the variety of the menu (if you stay more than 2 days your choices will be over). It's not my first time in this hotel and although it's a silly subject, I can say the amenities are losing its quality (no slippers offered last time, the smell of the soap and shampoo is not nice anymore). The tv channels are very poor, I watched Natgeo and Discovery at the end. The staff in general is very polite and professional, except one chinese lady at the reception that almost bark when you talk to her

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: akhan11
Reviews.Content: Its a very good hotel in a even better centrally placed location in a very organized city. Service was great with room cleaning very efficient and prompt. Cant comment on food as i didnt experience any meal in the hotel (no halal options)

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: amysa
Reviews.Content: The not-so-good: 1. Supervisor NOT trained in customer service. Rude, unfriendly behavior that met us as we checked in at midnight! ( Knowing i had mistakenly booked the room through their website (higher rate!), i suggested to the supervisor that Carlton Hotel should consider offering a best rate guarantee, and graciously requested the supervisor to place me in the new wing upon check in. Supervisor just stared at me and ignored my request. He gave me the room cards WITHOUT telling me where my room was, what time breakfast was, which way to the lifts etc -- nothing. I dont mind for my request to be declined. But i think its basic proper manner to respond when someone talks to you. ) 2. Lobby may be impressive but dont get fooled by that. The shabby rooms are not at par with the lobby. Seems like the lobby was revamped but the renovations were not extended to the rooms. 3. Do not book through the hotel website, they do not offer a best rate guarantee policy. The hotel website does not offer the best rates out there, so better check other booking websites if you intend to stay here. 4. Bed not comfortable. It was lumpy with poor back support. Overall, not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid, so not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: GymnastAlex
Reviews.Content: I was put up at the Carlton Hotel by my company whilst on a business trip to Singapore. The room was nice - but the major problem was that I got a room facing Victoria Street - a very busy street and I wasn't on a very high floor. So the noise of the traffic continued throughout the night and it was rather loud. OK, I know some of you can sleep through an earthquake and it wouldn't disturb you, but it certainly bothered me and I was awoken several times at night. The air-conditioning and thick curtains did not help - and this is Singapore, it's an extremely hot tropical country, they don't do double glazing like we do back in Europe - so the noise literally travels into the building and it's just unreal how noisy it can be. The pool is tiny and the restaurants are hideously overpriced. Even with a corporate rate - it was still ridiculously expensive. If I had a choice, I certainly would NEVER pick this hotel, no way. I am telling my boss never to stay there again as there are better hotels which offer better value for money in Singapore. The only good thing I can say is the location, apart from that, it was a massive disappointment. As for the staff, some of them are extremely helpful and polite - but some are totally useless. I met a woman who barely spoke English and I was shocked - how can you work as a receptionist in such a hotel and not speak much English?

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: speaktruly
Reviews.Content: Just a short drive from the Cruise ship terminal that we had just come from , our 2 night stay was very pleasant and we would gladly stay there again. Impressive massive check in area, plenty of fast lifts, our room was very comfortable and quiet , with bathroom and everything very clean. Excellent breakfast in the spacious restaurant with great service. Just a great location opposite Raffles Hotel, & Newish Raffles City Mall with great food courts and specialty shops. Short walk to Orchard Road and Bugis Street Markets. Cheap taxi ride to Clark Quay and China town and only 20 minutes to Changi Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMMatlin
Reviews.Content: This modern high rise hotel is in a great location in the middle of Singapore (well the middle to me anyway). - Across the road from Raffles - Across the road from Raffles City - Across (and above) City Hall MRT - Short walk to Clarke and Boar Quay's for tourist restaurants There are 2 distinct wings to the hotel, the standard and the premier. I've stayed in both wing over numerous Singapore trips. The Standard wing is the original tower of the hotel, I'm guessing built in the late 70's early 80's. The rooms are good, though maybe a little dated. For Singapore (or Asia in general) the rooms are very good in size. The Premier wing is the new tower, I think opened in 2009 or 2010 and it is very modern and exceptionally well fitted out. Not sure that the premium in rate for this wing is really worth the extra, but certainly a very nice hotel experience. I think the rooms are even a little smaller in this wing, but have nice fittings. If you want a clean, professionally run, busy modern 4-5 star hotel in Singapore - this ones pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Great location”
Reviews.Author: abhijitsengupta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across Raffles hotel and Raffles city Mall. CJIMES is across the corner. One will find 24 hrs convenient stores around. Suntec city mall is just walking distance and is connected through underground walk way. Good Neat and clean property. Spacious and comfortable room however house keeping needs huge improvement. The staff needs to be trained in English as well as how to interact with guest, house keeping staff both at the top end and lowest level lacks training in handling guest, lacking in both courtesy and warmth. Front office and concierge were in contrast exceptional and were outstanding. Room service order taking staffs were forgetful on several occasion when orders were placed from room for in room dining. However its still a great property as you will come across several airlines patronizing the the hotel. Restaurant was great and very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel with and Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ikes_Reviews
Reviews.Content: The Carlton is a large hotel built in many stages. I stayed in the "Premier" wing which I believe is the most recent addition. The rooms are modest size with contemporary furnishings and an interesting window into the bathroom from the bedroom. At first this seems odd but it lets natural light from the outside into the bathroom. Something rare in modern high rise hotels. I had a room on the 11th floor overlooking the grand old Raffles Hotel south to the Marina Sands Resort. The hotel is located adjacent to the Raffles City Mall and lots of local (expensive) shopping and restaurants. The hotel is expensive and there are 2 taxes added to the rate. The buffet breakfast cost S$38. Choice was extensive and the best part was all you can drink cappucino on demand. You can go to Starbucks in Raffles City for 1/3 the price! The gym and pool were nice but not spectacular. The gym didn't open till 5:30am. You can even get to the Gym floor until then as there is an electronic elevator lock out of the 5th floor. Overall this hotel is on par with other Singapore fine hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: lichin
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a good location. Raffles City shopping mall is just 2 mins walk away and also the MRT station, hence it is very convenient to get to a lot of places. If you are too tired to walk too far, Raffles City mall has a lot of eateris, but the food is nothing to shout about.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but price is high”
Reviews.Author: richarajanya
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was average. No good food for vegetarians. The carpet outside the room was dorty and wornout - seemed pretty old. The rooms were good and spacious but the carpet in rooms was also worn out. Staff was very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: bathla_dinesh
Reviews.Content: all good except quality and variety of breakfast (quite below standards) nice outdoor swimming pool, room a bit small but well designed. overall the hotel was good, night scene was ok and in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location inSingpore”
Reviews.Author: noosabird
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Singpore on three separate occasions ( over six nights) before and after trips to Myanmar, China, and Thailand. The accommodation in the Carlton Hotel in Singapore was very good. The Carlton now has a 'new wing' and an 'older wing'. On each occasion we had either a double room or a suite in the 'older wing'. Would have loved to have inspected the 'new wing'. The carpets in the 'old wing' appeared tired, musty( in the corridor) and in need of replacement. However, the rooms were well appointed and the suites were excellent. Reception was always busy, but the service was very good and efficient. Breakfasts in the Mosaic Cafe were excellent with plenty of good choices and plates cleared away immediatley they were emptied. Walk out the front door of the Carlton and you are right in the middle of the city. Raffles Hotel is right across the road , as is the excellent Raffles Shopping Mall. Buses and the excellent train service are only 100 metres away. A negative is the charge for wireless internet service. There is now the most modern Marina Bay Sands Hotel in Singapore, but you could not beat the Carlton for location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, MRT, shopping centre and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: kappa15
Reviews.Content: Stayed a Carlton Hotel for 2 nights and was satisfied with my stay. Comfortable bed and room with a nice view of the city, chose the new wing. Hotel is well located with easy access to the MRT across the road, lots of eating places along the street. A good way to guage the quality of the food is the number of people in the restaurant. Did not try the breakfast as there are lots of local titbits nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great location - unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: nickthetraveller1
Reviews.Content: PROS: - great location: just next to City Hall MRT station; popular nightlife area Clarke Quay is about 15min walking distance; Raffless City is just across the street with probably the best food outlets in Singapore. - we had a huge superior room with a beautiful view of city - very nice and modern lobby - nice pool area CONS: - staff not quite professional as you would expect from a 4 star hotel: the receptionist trying to convience us to get a breakfast arranged; completely unhelpful lady at the business center (not to mention that her unprofessionalism ruined our stay at this hotel!) - no wi-fi in rooms! do not use internet service at business center - it's a rip off!! - loud a/c - bathroom - i wouldn't expect from a 2 star hotel to have the same one! sink blocked, noise from pipes, quite old.. - poor selection of international TV channels, no video on demand - room service - we kindly asked for additional cutlery and a plate: it took more than one hour to be delivered All in all, we decided to stay one more night in Singapore, but we were disappointed by hotel and we booked another one. I have to say that we have stayed at the old wing, but at the time of booking we were not aware of that fact. It better be that executive rooms that are in new wing offer much much more comfort and luxury than these below average ''superior'' rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel; good value”
Reviews.Author: SanderNorman
Reviews.Content: Great room with high quality matrass. Beautiful bathroom. Clean. Comfortable room climate. Airco bit noisy. Lot of choice for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay, Loved the Location!”
Reviews.Author: mazmartini
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton from Apr 28-May 7th 2011. My sister was there for work so my niece and I decided to join her. The hotel was great. We had a problem with electric outlets, their website indicated "international" plug ins. I ended up frying a clock radio as well as my curling iron as from Canada as we use 110 volts. We did ask at the desk and they ensured us it was ok...not! However, they were kind enough to bring us a voltage converter and also compensated us with free internet for the remainder of our stay, which is quite expensive in Singapore. Over $20.00 per day at the hotel. Next time I will bring my own converter and be prepared. There is an internet cafe around the corner for $8.00 for 3 hours. The beds are smaller that a double but a tad larger than a twin, perhaps a 3/4 bed? We asked for a cot for my niece and it would have cost $80.00 per night plus their taxes extra, so we did without. Our house keeper was very good, she had 2 days off and we certainly noticed it... The hotel location is excellent. We walked and took their MRT system every where. In 8 days we did over 200,000 steps, so we saw and did a lot! I would recommend light "quick dry" clothing. It was very warm and humid while we were there. Over 90 degrees with 90 percent humidity. We also had a light rain everyday, just enough to cool us off for a few minutes. We drank lots of water..so plan on spending about $15-20 per day just for water. We also carried a change of shoes, so that our tired feet could get some relief during the day. I didn't bring any local currency, but next time I would bring US$ cash and exchange them at the currency booths. The hotel also exchanged different currencies. But usually the rate is better at an "exchange booth". The Singapore $ is about 80% of our cdn dollar. They are known as the 10th most expensive city in the world..and it is quite costly. Some of our favourite places to shop were Bugis Village (10 mins from our hotel) and Chinatown..a quick MRT ride away. There is also Mustafa Market in Little India. We did a very quick tour. We enjoyed eating mostly at the "hawkers" and tasted all the "unusual" foods we could find. The food is delicious...you must try the Laksa and the fried carrot cake..as well as their national dish chicken rice. We even ate durian...a very strange looking and tasting fruit. All in all we had a great time, the hotel was great as were the staff. I would definitely sat there again. .

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again - very poor”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_H_042011
Reviews.Content: Was not impressed with this hotel at all. Stayed for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon. The receptionist who booked us in didn't have a clue what she was doing so the whole process took an age and she had to call a colleague for assistance. Her english wasn't brilliant either. We arrived after 9pm and had maid service knocking on our door at 8.45am the following morning. Not impressed by that. Had to use the do not disturb sign all the time to get some peace. Even had workmen turning up to check and repair the bathroom telephone! Maid service was generally poor. Failed to replace coffee, sugar, milk and water properly every day - it was very hit and miss. Also had to manage with one towel on one occassion as she didn't leave one for each of us. Concierge was generally helpful although they damaged our luggage when we left it with them on our last day. They obviously denied doing it and the Manager accused us of being liars by saying that the damage wasn't new and was not done by them (the luggage was newly purchased before our trip). I was furious at this as I am a very honest and straight person. I have never been so insulted and was extremely offended by his arrogant attitude. We weren't even seeking compensation, just acknowledgement and an apology. A shame that the man had no grace or manners about him and he's obviously never heard of customer care! We stayed here as the last leg of our weddingmoon and it left a very sour taste. It was a terrible way to end what had been the most fabulous 3 weeks. Our experience in Bangkok was far superior to the service and attitudes we encountered here. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone due to the poor level of service across all areas. There are plenty of better hotels in the locality and as Singapore is so compact they are all equally well situated for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL AND GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: jbg7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent a wonderful 10 day break in Singapore. We split our time between the Swissotel Merchant Court and the Carlton. We were in a Premier Club Room on the 13th floor. We had a great view looking out towards the Marina and over Raffles Hotel. The room was large, clean and spacious. The bed was large and very comfy. The best part of the room was the bathroom. There was a separate bath and shower with a large window looking through to the living area. We used the gym each day, which was great. It had a good selection of cardio machines and a good selection of machine and free weights. The pool was great but the one down side is it gets little or no mid or late afternoon sun, so if you're wanting to relax in the sun by the pool after a busy day you're out of luck. We only used the Club Room twice. We couldn't be bothered getting dressed up all the time so chose not to use it that often. If we were to stay at the Carlton again we probably wouldn't go for a Club Room again as we hardly used the facilities. I would definitely recommend the premier rooms over the standard rooms in the original Carlton building. Raffles Shopping Complex is opposite where there is a good selection of food outlets in the basement and a supermarket where you can get food and drink from. The MRT is also in the shopping complex. The staff were mixed. The majority were great but there were the odd few who were flat out rude and unwilling to help. Overall we found the Carlton was excellent and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lisawPerth
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with ideal location close to Chijmes restaurants and bars, across the road from MRT station and Raffles hotel and shopping plaza. Great food on the bottom and top floor of the plaza

Reviews.Title: “Carlton Hotel - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: SCTaz68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton at the end of April, as a part of a Singapore Stopover Holiday (SSH). We really loved the hotel, especially for its location. We wanted somewhere near the Marina, the Quays and Orchard Rd, and this was perfect (have stayed in the York and Peninsula before). The City Hall MRT was across the road in Raffles City Shopping Centre, but we did a lot of walking from the hotel. 15 mins to Helix Bridge, about 20 min to one end of Orchard Rd (Singapura Centre) and 15-20 min to Clarke Quay. Lots of shops around. We usually got breakfast at ‘Breadtalk’ in the basement of Raffles City. Fantastic sweet and savoury pastries and very cheap. Jason’s Marketplace was also located in the basement which was great. We bought fruit, juice, Pringles, etc! The Chijmes Complex of restaurants and nightclubs was an amazing find on one corner opposite to the hotel. Big variety of food types and a great ambience (fairy lights, etc). Hotel breakfast buffet was about S$38/person which we thought was quite expensive but it did look good. We didn’t eat in the hotel at all. The room was very spacious (just a superior room we think) and well appointed. We had no problems with the room or bathroom. However, our 1 complaint was that we asked for a non-smoking room and it seemed that this room had been used as one before, but not now. As each night past, the smell got stronge but we chose to wait out the last night. We would’ve asked for a room change if it was that bad on the first couple of days. Hotel has a great pool area(which we used), including an outdoor pool bar (but didn’t get to try it). We had an amazing harbour view on thew 16th floor, direct down to the Marina and Singapore Flyer, The staff was great; very helpful and friendly with any questions that we had. We were disappointed to find out that we had to pay for internet usage (about S$45 for 15 min we think) but the guest relations manager told us that we could use the internet cafe just 1 block away. We did this – it was called ‘Cyber House’ #01-27, 231 Bain St, Bras Basah Complex. Entry is actually on North Bridge Rd. Costs S$2/30 minutes!!! (and they print). We confirmed our seats to HK here. We would certainly recommend this hotel but would probably book it ourselves online rather than do it as a part of a SSH. It was about $$228/ngt but we have noticed how much more expensive hotels have got over the past 6 years.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, not sure on the value for money :(”
Reviews.Author: nekomancy
Reviews.Content: The location is quite good. 2 close by MRT stations (2 different lines). Pop around the corner to SAM, Raffles, Raffle City and a close by 24hr kopitiam. Walking distance to Bugis Junction, the "open air" market - it's tented and can get quite hot. If you really wanted to you can walk to DigitalLife mall. Rooms are not as cramped as some boutique hotels can be but there is the difference between the "new" section and "old". The small bathroom of our deluxe room was un-renovated 1980s style: small bathtub, shower curtain and a drainage area that didn't really work well. The water pressure was very low on the 16th floor. The beds were comfortable. Room service was around 15-20mins wait, which is the norm for food. Food quality is not fantastic, but it's hotel room service. I recommend you walk out for 5 mins away from Raffles / Chijmes and head out for the 24hr kopitiam for hawker food in a bright and clean environment. Service was ok, but could have been better for a hotel of 4* repute. Front desk was not always very helpful and concierge seemed to be pre-occupied. I have to admit, I like new hotels, 5* luxury and even try some of the boutique places. So this hotel didn't really hit the spot. The cost per night was also not of the equivalent return value. $50 more and you could be at a 5* closer to Orchard. Oh and Internet was S$20 a day :( for someone who loves her wi-fi connection this was disastrous.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect because there are not perfect hotels”
Reviews.Author: KMiddleton7
Reviews.Content: 5* . All I can say. The service is great, the staff is very friendly and the rooms are just amazing. The bed and pillows are very comfortable, the view is very good and the location is good, with two MRT stations not further than a 3 minute walk. The gym is also very good and the pool is just delicious. Not perfect because, among other things, there is not free internet for anyone. You have to bring your laptop, and then it's free. But if you don't, you have to use the business centre and pay for Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisEssex456
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on stopover back to London from Australia. The hotel is very plush, rooms were very roomy and comfortable. Did not use the restuarants or the bars, but did use the swimming pool which was great after a days sightseeing. The MTR is very central and easy, and cheap to use, ideal for China Town, Little India as well as the Quays. The hotel is next door to Raffles so be sure and have a visit, be warned very expensive. I have never seen so many shopping malls, come out of one and straight into the next one. Quite expensive, but the markets are a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: ar0und_d_w0rld
Reviews.Content: Just 1 word...FABULOUS..The staff was very friendly. The rooms were tidy. The view outside was just amazing. The hotel is located in the heart of city. The MRT station is just a minute walk from the hotel. Very convenient in terms of location. The daily breakfast had a lot of options. The ambiance is also very good. I would give a 5 star rating to this hotel. Highly recommended..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, the new section is worth 4 stars, the old part is not.”
Reviews.Author: Steve_of_N21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights stop over at the end of February whist on our way down to Australia.. As several reviewers have already pointed out there’s currently two sides to this hotel accommodation in that there is the recently renovated and decorated premier wing (which befits the hotels 4 star status) and then the standard / delux rooms in the original part of the hotel which do not. We actually stayed in the older part of the hotel as my stay was organised by my company’s local office in Singapore and I got the very good business rate for a standard room that includes breakfast and internet. Yes the décor, especially the carpets in this section of the hotel are tired and worn and the room décor and facilities is a bit on the old fashioned side, but it was large enough and had all the things you want from a hotel bedroom. The air con was quiet and efficient and it was quiet at night. The arrival at the hotel is befitting 4 stars, as its very large and airy, a fair bit of comfortable seating and a wonderful showcase glass structure hanging from the ceiling that looks like it could be an original Dale Chihuly piece (if you are familiar with this American glass artists work ). The pool area is not befitting of a 4 star hotel. The pool itself is small and the changing facilities are basic and with some of the shower facilities broken. But it does provide a facility to allow you to change for a late evening flight if you have checked out the hotel in the morning and been sightseeing all day, which is what we used it for, and for this it was fit for purpose. I found the hotel staff , from the reception desk, concierge and front door staff all to be very helpful and friendly. Especially the concierge who looked after our bags safely on the last day and was forthcoming with maps and local information on how to get to places, and the doormen who organized taxi’s efficiently and managed the sometimes queue of waiting guests in an orderly way. The breakfast was excellent in quality and included both Eastern and Western options. But get it included in your hotel deal because the price of this and the lunch time restaurants are quite jaw dropping. Hence we didn’t eat here except for the breakfast, as there are much better eating options around the hotel. And now we come to the real plus of this hotel, which is its location. Firstly it’s next door to Raffles Hotel and you actually have a shorter walk to the Long Bar than if you were staying in Raffles hotel itself. Then the Raffles shopping centre complex is diagonally opposite and as well as high class shops, has a food hall which provides a wonderful low cost option. Coming from the UK where eating in the food halls of shopping centres is the last resort of the desperate, I was blown away by the choice and quality of the food on offer at a jaw droppingly low price in this case. The available ‘Pig Organ stew’ is a tasty local dish and the name is just a bit lost in translation. And then the excellent Chimes restaurant and bar centre in an old converted monastery is dead opposite the hotel, giving a great choice of different cuisine restaurant and bars and I strongly recommend you to explore this out in the evening rather than eating in the hotel. And finally there are two MRT stations within 3-4 minutes walk from the hotel, and a leisurely 15 minute stroll will see you at Raffles Landing stage on the river with its new bars and restaurants.. So in conclusion, a hotel with a great location. The new section is worth the money, but only stay in the old section if you can get a good deal with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, slightly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: traveller_au97
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel's premier room back in October 2010. All I can say is, great looking room, very comfortable, very clean, nice bathroom and shower, great location of the hotel. Service staff were fantastic. The only negative I could say is that it was slightly too expensive, I'd question value for money somewhat. If the price was better, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have picked better”
Reviews.Author: Lethhaly25
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Carlton hotel was okay. We were in the old dated part of the hotel and the accommodation was nice enough but was below par for the price. In particular, we booked a triple room as our 3 year old was with us, but we then had to pay extra for a bed for him to be wheeled in which was annoying. We did not dine there, but the shopping mall across the road was surperb for food. We did have a light meal at the bar, and found it overpriced as expected. Overall service and staff were very good. Location was okay, next to Raffles and medium walk to start of orchard road shopping or short MRT ride to the main part. However, like we did on our return from Europe, you will find better accomodation at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: leto1972
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great on the other side of the road of the famous Raffle hotel, next to 2 MRT stations (3 min). The raffle city mall is in front of the hotel for shopping and food court. There is also a very nice restaurants and bar area in front. The hotel room is large. the first one I was given (not renovated tower) had a bathroom a little outdated but I was later upgraded to executive room with a much nicer bathroom with shower and bath The bed is confortable but the air conditionning is slightly noisy (to my standard) Hotel staff always ready to help (reservation ....)

Reviews.Title: “Superbly located with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sookee
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at so many negative reviews of this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights and were upgraded to the 22nd floor, having paid the basic price. Couldn't really fault it. The room was quite large and comfortable with an amazing view, though I admit that the bathroom was a little dated. Lots of bottled drinking water was provided free. The staff were always courteous and professional and the location was perfect for us, being only a few minutes walk from City Hall and Bras Basah MRT stations thereby giving access to 3 MRT lines. We often walked about 30 minutes back to the hotel quite late at night and never felt at all unsafe. Hotel service could not be faulted, for example, we had a problem operating our room safe and within 5 minutes of our phone call, staff arrived with full tool box to help us. Similarly, our request for more tea and coffee sachets had an almost immediate response. We never ate in the hotel so can't comment on that, but would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Anandspeaks
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in Feb. This is a centrally located hotel but I found it average. Rooms were small sized. Toilets were also of average quality. Overall experience was not too great.

Reviews.Title: “not such good value any more”
Reviews.Author: jmwb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here in the past, due to good deals and convenient location, but it's no longer good value. Standard rooms (superior or deluxe? confusing names) are a bit dingy, the newer ones are nicer but not really bigger. It's really handy for everything, staff are very helpful. Beware of breakfast. S$38 for American breakfast is nuts. Even the continental buffet is not cheap (and they'll charge you the higher price automatically). It would not be so bad if the service was not indifferent; attendants forget about you and if you are near the end of the morning opening hours, most stuff is gone, don't bother asking for any more!

Reviews.Title: “Premier rooms in new wing offer a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Paris
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a premier room because the standard rooms in all hotels of our corporate hotel list were booked out. I think this means that you get a room in a brand new wing that was recently renovated. The room was spacious, modern and featured all the amenities you would expect from a recent hotel of class. It was very clean. As usual in Singapore, the default setting of the air conditioning is quite cold and has to be adjusted if you don't like living in a fridge. I didn't get to chance to try the hotel restaurant. But in Singapore I wouldn't advise anyone to dine in a hotel. I prefer trying one the many food courts or hawker stalls in the island that can deliver outstanding food at bargain prices. The hotel's breakfast buffet is standard fare. The location of this hotel is great. While it is not right on Orchard road but on the road that Orchard leads into, it is just next to the City Hall MRT (subway). That's right in the city center from where you can go anywhere in the island. There is big commercial mall on top of the MRT: Raffles City. Just in front of the hotel there is an entertainment venue called Chijmes. It is a former convent that was reconverted into a collection of bars and restaurants. The historic buildings make this quite a beautiful venue. A big commercial mall dedicated to IT (cameras, mobile phones, computers, video games) called Funan Digital Mall is within walking distance for those who are interested. Overall the Carlton provided me with a very pleasant and comfortable stay for my business trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A rip off!!!!”
Reviews.Author: davebeck
Reviews.Content: 1 side of the hotel is brand new, the other side is old. The old side is very run down and no way do you feel like your staying in a 4 star hotel. The views are rubbish even on the top floor, the rooms look like they've not been updated for about 20 years, the bathroom feels like something from a hostel. We asked to be moved as we paid nearly 250sing dollars for each night (and that was pre-booked), we were charged an extra 50sig dollars per night to stay in the posher part. I have to say that the newer part of the hotel is very nice, and probably worth the 4 stars given to the hotel, but the original half is most definatly not! The staff at this hotel are stuck up, ignorant and very unpleasant. Be prepared to be lied to, and also be ripped off by them. I would really recommmend you do not stay at this hotel unless you are getting it paid for by your company. This is most certainly a business hotel, not for pleasure at all! When we were there they were renovating 3 floors above us and the noise was dreadful, we were woken up at 8am every morning and the noise carried on until night time. The hotel refused to move us to another room, they refused to give us any kind of an apology at all. This hotel is a joke! I would not recommend it in the slightest!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: 2010travellers_10
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 5 nights at the Carlton Hotel, what a location...central to everything and all within walking distance. Taxi's are right there and the hotel staff are more than willing to assist with information, directions or just a chat. Highly recommend this hotel. SIngapore in general is a very clean city but incredibly expensive, small beer $9-18 singapore dollars, hot dog $25 Singapore dollars, shopping is more expensive than Sydney be aware....no budget food places or pubs etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daveo_1978
Reviews.Content: Nice New hotel, beautiful rooms. Only stayed here because Qantas flight was cancelled (So Qantas paid) Buffet Lunch is the same as Buffet Dinner. Breakfast was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Better values elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Timelyreport
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a more elegant & refined hotel. Maybe long ago this was true. The hallways have pealing wallpaper, and old carpet. A easy fix, but the cheap mgmt has decided your not worth it. It is however a good flop-house for many pilots, and stewardess types who stay here. A much better value, with better location, and rates is the Novatel, located in Clarke-Quay. Singapore is a very much overpriced city. I suggest other asian countries. Singapore has tons of malls, but prices are better in U.S. They do have a great MTR subway system however, and lots, and lots of cameras to watch you all over town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: axxTn
Reviews.Content: Was worth the money. Near By was Fundas shoping mall/ with eletronic supermarket on 5 floor. Had meeting in convention centre , which was walkable distance. Fitness centre was good. Great eletronic shoping at Slimlim square.Fitness equipment at mustafas. Food at Little india.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed with their service!!!”
Reviews.Author: fizmie
Reviews.Content: Room: Premier Club King (Premier Wing) Stay: 1 night only (due to dinner & dance held at the same hotel) Features: ● In-room high-speed wireless internet (chargeable at $0.60/10kb) ● Herman Miller ergonomic desk chair (nice) ● Adjustable work desk (not sure how to adjust) ● Designer red arm chair (nice) ● Sealy Posturepedic mattress with soft duvet covers (superb!!!) ● Molton Brown bathroom amenities (one of the reason why we chose premier) ● Plush down pillows (nice) ● Sheets with elegant design accents (nice) ● Rain shower (fixtures all by Grohe) ● Full size bathtub (nice, wifey really enjoy her bath) ● Bay windows (a little upset as our room got no city view) Staff: (easily distracted by other staff asking questions now & then. both during check-in & check out.) Breakfast: (the usual international buffet with couple of local spread) Room service: (ordered Mee Goreng & Nasi Goreng. food arrived still hot & taste good) As quoted in their website: For guests staying in the Premier Club rooms, we offer personalised check-in and check-out services (same with any other guest... no difference) with exclusive access to the Premier Club Lounge located on the top floor with a panoramic view of the city and harbour. Premier Club guests enjoy complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails with hors d’oeuvres in total privacy and comfort of the lounge. (we had breakfast at The Mosaic... just like the rest of the guest & was unable to access to Club Lounge... when asked about it, staff tried to be evasive but later inform that we are not entitled!!!) my comments are in (brackets)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: I knew what to expect having stayed here before and would have given it a rating of 3.5 on this review if that had been an option. Paid almost £100 per night which seems poor value, but that's Singapore prices. This place gives you a bog standard 3.5 to 4 star experience. The rooms are soul-less and the staff are pleasant enough without being overly warm. I had to move rooms just after checking in due to problems with the room's power supply. These things happen I suppose and they dealt with my move quickly and efficiently. Neither of the channels covering UK premier league football were available on the TV which was a shame. It makes me laugh when other reviewers say this hotel is a long way from shops and places to eat as I don't see how it could be closer! Would probably stay here again if the price was competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Crap”
Reviews.Author: haikal5966
Reviews.Content: If you're with family with young kids - stay away. You are not welcomed. Central location? don't kid yourself. central yes, for business!! but miles from good place to eat, shop etc. Typical Singapore. Neat, tidy, clean. But no soul. Got less atmosphere than mars. Hate it. Will never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- In the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: Everywheretraveler
Reviews.Content: My stay at Carlton was wonderful. I was at the new wing and the room was spacious, the amenities were great, the staff was friendly, and the view from my room was amazing. Carlton was not a big hotel and so I did not have to walk a mile to get to the café, the gym or other places. Everything was very accessible. The best feature of Carlton was its location – right in the middle of everything. If I came back to Singapore again, I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my most hated hotels.”
Reviews.Author: giodxb
Reviews.Content: My views are of the standard guest rooms, not the rooms in the new wing. The rooms are very old, newly renovated ? I stayed here before and after this date and it is just not true. The rooms have not been touched in 15 years, shabby furnishings, worn carpet, old style beds with cheap linen. The bathrooms are mouldy and smelly with cracked tiles and stained lavatories. Not comfortable and not elegant. The staff are a mix of bumbling incompetents or agressive rude chinese. The room service is prompt but of a very low standard. The best points are the impressive lobby, bar with unintentionally hilarious live entertaiment and location to shopping and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Location trumps all imperfections”
Reviews.Author: hotelanatomist
Reviews.Content: I have lived for many years in Singapore in the past, and have travelled to Singapore frequently in the past and stayed in a variety of hotels included Rasa Sentosa, York Hotel, Pan Pacific etc. Hence, my expectations are realistic for Singapore. I did make my choice of this hotel based on guest reviews on TripAdvisor. The single overwhelming reason for picking Carlton was its location. Location, location, location....which overrides any other imperfections. Walking distance to multiple MRT (subway) stations, food courts, restaurents and shopping. The staff were reasonably pleasant and mostly efficient. Check in was quick, although there was some confusion about my prepaid on-line booking and the charging of my credit card, the accuracy of which was clarified only after my return from Singapore. No big deal really. A very busy hotel...... was house full on two of my 7 days stay.... remarkable for a 900+ room hotel. It is also the hotel for airline crew including Emirates and crew members frequent the lobby. I stayed in a Premier Supreme Double (translates into = a room in the new 2010 wing, with a city view). The room matters, both in price and experience (read the conflicting opinions of other guests below and you will understand!).
