In retrospect, I do not think that the "city view" of the "Supreme" double was worth the extra $30+. The hotel also has the original tower, which guests have reviewed poorly, and an Executive wing, built somewhere in 2005 -2006. The executive wing rooms are priced less than the premier rooms, and I would think it would be worth the while to ask about this. I didn't get a chance to see these rooms - pity, it may have been useful for a future visit. Room size appeared somewhat small. Partly because the bathroom was large. ....I guess. Something's gotta give. Excellent bathroom though, although not very child safe - granite floor tiles are slippery when wet. The Molton Brown amneties in the premier rooms are nice, although they are only sparingly refreshed. This is very evident when you stay longer than the average. The "window" between the bathroom and room (in the premier rooms) with a Roman blind on the exterior of the bathroom, does not offer much privacy unless your room-mates are intimate or else trustworthy!! Although the rooms appeared "clean" because they are barely an year old, the room cleaning service was poor. Amneties, stationery, bath-robes etc are not regularly replaced and dusting of table tops and vacuuming of floors leaves much to be desired. I had to pick up cereal from the floor (my toddler wasn't the most conscientious in-room diners) when I returned to the room each evening after it had been cleaned. On the first day, our toddler found a used pair of slippers and a hair spray can under the bed. The TV and telephone had a consistent film of dust on them. However, the cleaning staff we encountered seemed very pleasant and courteous. If that helps their cause! Carlton needs to take a look into this. For a hotel priced as it is, the coffee making facility is pathetic. There were two single, out-dated satchets of coffee which never got refilled during our entire 7 days of stay. You would do well to buy your own nescafe and tea and indulge in caffeine as much as you want. We never made use of room service given that the hotel is less than a block away from excellent (and need I say, cheaper) food. BreadTalk at the basement of Raffles City used to be a favourite for breakfast in my student days in Singapore...and it still is. We have dined at the Cafe Mosaic, but were not particularly overwhelmed. Still, for the record there is 24 hours room service which is convenient, at a price. Internet access is available but horrendously expensive, especially given that much of Singapore is wired. I believe you can take your laptop or iPad and walk to Raffles City or any mall and get free internet access. I had the luxury of a friend's mobile broadband service. A good flat screen TV in premier rooms. It would help to include at least one kid's channel like Playhouse Disney / Disney / Nick Jr....it was hard to keep a toddler entertained. The TV reception was not of great quality, poor.......even for some of the local channels. This is something not uncommon to many hotels that I have stayed in. Again, I believe that this can be rectified by Carlton easily. The bed had a Sealy posturepedic mattress, which was a bit too hard for my personal taste, but probably good for your spine! The queen bed was just about enough for two adults and a 4-year old. Beware, the premier rooms CAN NOT fit an additional bed. A baby cot is possible but that would certainly make the room very, very crammed. The Herman Miller ergonomic chair comes as good as advertised. A positive for the premier room. Other trivial details - adjustable air conditioning was welcome. I am not certain that the older wing rooms have this. The premier rooms need a clock...hard to tell the time. The bedside tables are bare, devoid of drawers. Probably part of the "modern" decor. We didn't get to use the pool (located on the 5th floor between the premier and old wings) or gym. The lobby is large......cavernous! spacious and appealing. The doormen and bell hops are very courteous. Plenty of taxis at the door (although, there is a queue in the peak hours, especially mornings...consider this if cutting it fine for an appointment). In summary, this is a 3.5 - 4 star hotel and is most conveniently located in the heart of City Hall area. Possibly, one of the more economical hotels of its class in this area. Check out the 14-day prepaid and the 3-days or more 20% off package if planning a trip in advance or for a longer duration.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed here was 4 years ago. I had booked the hotel on short-notice, had to pay S$300 for 1 night and was not happy with the room in the old wing. The new wing was being built at the time. I wrote in my review then that the Carlton was not interested in impressing new guests. 4 years later, I booked the room 3 months before arriving and got a rate of S$200 a night. My flight to Singapore was delayed by 2 hours, so did not arrive at the Carlton till 2 a.m. The front desk person told me I would be upgraded at no extra charge to a room in the new Premier wing. I really wasn't expecting anything after my last stay, the only thing I was happy about was getting a low rate, I certainly did not expect an upgrade. I was really impressed with the room in the new wing. Everything was new. The view from my room was nice. I could see the rooftops of the Raffles Hotel. The Carlton has gone from being one of my 10 or more choices to stay in Singapore to one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, CONVENIENTLY LOCATED”
Reviews.Author: WickedHolzzz
Reviews.Content: The reception area of the hotel is grande and very posh. Gives a very good first impression. Rooms are good sized, with good ammenities. Pool area was good but due to it being located between two towers it doesnt get too much sunshine. Gym is Excellent. Its very close to some very good restaurants and a shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Unable to sleep due to noise”
Reviews.Author: dcp1610
Reviews.Content: Good: - Location, close to MRT Raffles city station - spacious room - clean - reasonable view Bad: - Unable to sleep due to noise - Noise from showers and taps from room above. - Noise from the street even though we were on level 11

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again even if they paid me.”
Reviews.Author: Lucyl32
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I've EVER endured. NEVER in my life have I been so disappointed in a hotel. This is a 4-star hotel, but I would give it one star. They did not clean our rooms on the first day by 4pm, so we requested it for the next day. We are charged for this service, so it doesn't make sense to have them not do it! After the request, the next day, they STILL didn't clean the room by 3pm. this is getting rediculous. We didn't want to pay S$90 for NOTHING (room service)! They were super un-friendly as well; they hung up once when we told them about the problem. Their workers are also challenged in English, which makes communication with them extremely frustrating. They also are UNTRUSTWORTHY - the manager finally agreed to letting us check out late at 4pm. However, we find out that they disabled our cards at 2pm instead. I was appalled at the fact that they would so easily lie to us. NEVER have I been treated this way by the hotel, let alone one that I have to pay S$200 a night for! This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, and I refuse to ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: asensiblechic
Reviews.Content: Ive been quite apprehensive when my sister in law made the booking at this hotel for i have read the reviews here at TA. This will be our NYE holiday with the whole family (plus extended) and i was really thinking of a very nice comfortable hotel. And to our much delight, upon arrival, we were checked in with no hassle and we all got a free upgrade to the Premier A wing. The room was big enough for my hubby and 2 kids (10 and 7)The down part was we got a double room with 1 queen bed instead of 2 twin beds. But that was alright considering the nice ambience, the super clean room and bathroom. The bed was comfortable enough, the only downside again were the pillows. We had 4 pillows but 3 of which were kinda bulky and too big for my liking. The bathroom was also big and the toiletries were tastely packed. I also found out that there was no free wifi in the lobby. And the room internet costs too much. I visited and used the gym . Theyre open till 11pm. Free use of towel and free water. Dont forget to bring your room key to get inside the gym. My kids took a dip in the pool. We didnt get to see a toilet though or a changing area on the poolside. So if you want to go to the toilet, i guess u either have to go back to your room. The location of the hotel is very convenient to Raffles Hotel for it is just across the street. Shopping malls are within walking distance also Bugis street or junction (for those who want to visit the said shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eilsonhols
Reviews.Content: The Carlton Hotel has a great location! It's clean, walking distance to everything and if not there are close train stations galore. If you want somewhere convenient and affordable this is the place for you. I did not eat on site as there was no need when you are so close to the culinary delight that is Singapore. The pool is a welcome site after a busy day of shopping, and not very well utilised by other customes - a bonus! Internet is very expensive - there is a cyber cafe just down the road so save your pennies.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevinwithluv
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, excellent hospitality and awesoem. My experience is unforgettable

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dontspamjunk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks for a business trip in the new wing. I would say this hotel is more of a 3.5 stars rating, but since it's the holidays, I am feeling generous and rounded it up. Pros: -Upgraded to the 18th floor in the new wing. I was booked in the old wing for the first 5 days of my trip (the new wing was fully booked, and i booked very late). However, when I checked in, they managed to get me in the new wing, and upgraded me to one of the highest floors. They still gave me the cheaper rate for the first 5 days. This probably had more to do with the fact that I was staying with them for 2 entire weeks. -Rooms are very clean and very new. Rooms are slightly small, but as a solo person in the room, it was plenty of space for me. The rooms would be crowded for a family. -The rain shower head. It was awesome, and I definitely took longer showers than I normally do because of the shower head! -Location. Within 5 minutes walking distance to both the circle line and the red line. Very convenient to get to most places. Cons: -Hallways and elevators are not air conditioned! For a "luxury" hotel, you'd think they'd air condition everything, especially considering Singapore's hot & humid weather year-round. Very odd. -Breakfast buffet. It was included in my room rate, but the selection is very limited and NEVER changes. For someone who stays at the hotel for a few days, it's fine. But I was there for two weeks and was completely sick of the food by the end. I skipped breakfasts at the hotel at the end and picked up some pastries at Breadtalk in Raffles City Mall across the street. -Gym was slightly small. The cardio machines fill up pretty quickly in the early mornings, and they kept the gym at a fairly warm temperature, so after you got your heart pumping, it was very hot. I guess you could consider that a pro if you wanted to sweat a lot during your workout :) However, this also resulted in other people completely drenching the machines & floors with their sweat, with nothing other than a towel to wipe (aka spread around the sweat) off the machines. It *really* grossed me out, and it made me not want to use the gym. -Internet connection. Also included in my room rate, but the wireless connection in my room was spotty at best. I constantly got kicked off the internet, which was irritating when I was trying to do work. -The room had an odd setup where there was a GIANT window in between the bathroom and the bed. On top of that, the curtain the cover the window was on the outside of the bathroom, so you couldn't lower it once you were in the shower. I'm not sure why anyone would want a giant window between the shower/tub/toilet and the bed?? This hotel also is where all the Emirates flight attendants and pilots stay. I saw throngs of them every day. All in all, it was a decent hotel. There were definitely pros and cons, but the location was super convenient. I never saw the old wing, so I can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but no value for money and don't expect any service”
Reviews.Author: swetankj
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our first anniversary and stayed at Carlton hotel Singapore for 3 days on our way to Indonesia. Let me tell you the only good thing about the hotel first. Location: Great location situated bang opposite to Raffles and next to Bugis village and orchard road. bras Basah and Esplande MRT stations are within 2-3 mins walking. Now lets get to the things which were not so good about this hotel. Food: If you are a vegetarian from India this hotel is a sheer waste of money. They hardly have any veg options in the menu. and no place nearby in 1-2 kilometers offers anything veg. we wasted 3 hours one evening hunting for some veg food in near vicinity. Nearest option for veg food is little India which is about 2-2.5 kilometeres. Service: As good as a self help budget hotel at the price of an upper end 4 star hotel. they are hardly interested in service. except for check in and check ourt i hardly had any interaction with the staff. Not much helpful in terms of carrying ur luggage or calling a cab for you or giving you some information about the city or even a friendly advice. Value for money: Really BAD. at a rate of over 11000 Rs per night this hotel is a sheer waste of money. very small rooms, not much amenities, very small bathroom. just 2 restaurants that too they shut at 10 pm. There are many other hotels in the vicinity with better facilities and less price. Would suggest you look at them. and if you are an Indian I would suggest take a hotel within walking distance from little India.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maremtovi
Reviews.Content: Very good overall impression of this hotel. We've got an upgrade to the executive floor when we arrived. The room we've got starts looking a little bit out dated, although it was well maintained and spotlessly clean. Very good service, the hotel employees were always ready to help, and were specially kind with the kids. The location is great, just across the street to Chijmes, were you can find a nice selection of restaurants, and equally close to Raffles Place, a good mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very disappointed with Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GAMR
Reviews.Content: I was totally disgusted - almost a complete disaster. Booked Carlton Club and didnt receive Carlton Club facilities; provided with double beds in an extremely substandard room even though we had our written confirmation that twin singles would be provided; arrived at 5.30pm and never got to our new room until 12 mdinight. Their attitude left a lot to be desired. Told us they didnt have rooms we requested even though we had booked 12 months prior. I am a regular visitor to Singapore and was hoping this hotel would be suitable for future visits however after the total disorganisation displayed on my last visit I would not recommend this hotel. I contacted the hotel on my return to Australia advising them of my disappointment with their attitude and service and was extremely disappointed with their response.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, efficient, value for money”
Reviews.Author: babagul
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been renovated in the past year and has added a new, luxury wing (higher tariffs here!). This hotel is very well located in downtown Singapore and in the vicinity of many big names in the hotel trade, but it is more economical and offers excellent value for money. This hotel also has room for hosting large gatherings, conferences and meetings. It is quietly efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay.”
Reviews.Author: T0mL1n
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights en route to Taiwan. Excellent location - just one block from Raffles with plenty of eating places nearby. Was very impressed by the service we were offered during our stay. All the staff could not have been more helpful. We stayed in a refurbished room, decent size and well equiped. Breakfast was plentiful with efficient service. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again. The only let down for us was the tour company within the hotel. I would not recommend anyone uses this company for their local tours. The transport was shabby and very dirty. We considered getting off the bus and losing our money - it was that bad. The tour guide made up for it though and was very informative. Considering the high standards within the hotel I was surprised they would allow this company to operate on their premises.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: 23angeles
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my wife and 15 year old daughter. At the very onset, let me state that this is not part of the Ritz-Carlton chain! Hotel is undergoing a refurbishing. And it looks like they started with the Lobby which is very interesting. It had a fairly modern feel to it. Check-in was uneventful. We were told we got an upgrade but this being our first time in this Hotel, we wouldn't know the difference since we did not take the time to check out what was supposed to be our room. Hotel was doing some work on one side of the elevator banks on the ground floor. So from the lobby going up to our room, you'd have less than 1.5 meters of space between the board up and the elevator doors. Worse, if you get on the wrong side of the elevators from your floor, you'd have to exit on the 2nd floor and either take the stairs to the ground floor or transfer to the opposite set of elevators to the ground floor. Hopefully they'll have it all sorted it in a few weeks. We were placed in the old wing. The corridor on our floor needs new carpets. Doors to service areas along our floor really need to be replaced as well. Our room though was newly refurbished. A lot of wood veneer was used, so to me it looked like start-up office furniture. It was clean though. The two beds hardly qualified as double beds but it was new and as such comfortable enough. The t&b was really very basic. The toilet was new but looked it was 2 notches above the manufacturer's cheapest model. Internet and 2 water bottles a day were free. Breakfast Buffet was part of the package. It was fine but very basic. However, what makes me recommend this Hotel would be the great service and the location. Service -- Everyone at the Concierge Desk, whoever was on duty, went out of their way to make sure that all our queries were answered and our needs met. From recommendations on where to go, where to eat, how to go, to directions and reservations to places and restaurants, to getting tickets to Universal Studio, to rebooking our flights, the Concierge Desk took care of us. The waitresses at the restaurant where we had our breakfast were all very nice and helpful as well. Location -- Across the street is Chijmes, across the other street is the Raffles Hotel, and on the other is an entire complex full of bookstores (forgot the name). Their is also a Catholic Church across the street on yet another side of the Hotel. The nearest MRT station is less than 10 minutes walk (access is via the Mall which is also right across the street). Since we were in Singapore for leisure, we spent most of our time away from the Hotel. As such, if all you need is a clean, safe and accessible place to stay in with great service, I'd gladly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BARJ_10
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore for vacation in October 2010 and had chosen Carlton after reading reviews about it here on TripAdvisor and other travel websites. We found the hotel very good. Their staff is very friendly and helpful, room service is excellent, food was very good, the location perfect as it is close to SunTec, Raffles and other interesting city attractions. We had requested for a early check-in when we arrived in Singapore, but they were not able to provide the same. Even then they made us comfortable and helped us in every way till our room became available. The only bad thing for me they don't have free wifi. Accessing wifi was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: April162008
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Carlton was really great. The hotel is in a very good location. It is near the MRT, Chijmes, Bugis, Esplanade. The wing that we got was not a new wing and was a little old. However, our room has been renovated and it was sufficient for our purposes. Best of all, the service was very good. The concierge, especially Sam Siow helped us rebook our flight. They also helped us reserve at the Jumbo restaurant which was very full and we would not have gotten a table if we did not have early reservation. Overall, it was a wonderful stay, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ednib
Reviews.Content: The Carlton Hotel was great. My job has me traveling alot of work and this hotel was great. The staff was friendly, the room was nice and the location of the hotel was perfect! If you're going to Singapore, definately check out the Carlton Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location. But disappointing service.”
Reviews.Author: tangyoo
Reviews.Content: Acco booked thru Yatra.com for wife+self and 17yr old son, When we landed up at 11.30pm, we were told that only two SINGLE beds were provided and that we had to pay for extra bed. We had to show the booking voucher to convince them, after which they agreed. Room was quite good. However, no service at all practically but for change of towels and making the bed. Even when we tried to reach thru intercom, there was poor response.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Needs Refurbishing, Reasonable value for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Taddles6
Reviews.Content: Well located, spacious lobby, agreeable staff. Room standard was 3 star, bathroom 2 star, foyer 4 star. Nice pool. I would recommend but just remember the bathroom is basic.

Reviews.Title: “Ripper of a hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this one for terrific location close to orchard road shopping, Suntec and all you want. New wing is lovely with great beds, wonderful well thought out bathrooms with rainshower, Milton brown toiletries. Only downside is slowwwwww Internet and crappy old machines in the business centre. It's a shame they don't have free wifi. Otherwise unbeatable hotel for the price. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2nd-3rd choice hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: liptonst
Reviews.Content: Carlton Hotel Singapore stands out as unique in Singapore for me due to the up front, anything is possible to earn your business & assure your comfort attitude from all of the staff. The reception team of the Carlton Hotel Singapore at 2:00 AM arranged a limousine to pick me up from a hotel which was fully booked (my fault, late flight arrival, no hotel booking) and brought me to the Carlton Hotel "without charge or reservation" and placed me in a spacious, clean, very comfortable room without fully checking me in, stating check in could be completed in the morning, what was more important to the Carlton Team was that their new guest was comfortable and in his room at such a late hour, with out fuss. The rooms are larger than standard sized hotel rooms, everything is clean, and the textures and colors of the standard hotel fixtures, increase the value of the rooms. A very guest welcoming hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Globalgoddess1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when attending a trade show at Suntec which is less than a 10 min stroll away. The Carlton is a great four star on a great location opp raffles and 2 mins walk to the swissotel which has the Equinox bar on level 70 with amazing views - go at happy hour for $79 botlles of moet. ( cheap for singas). Staff at Carlton are lovely but brekky service was diabolical and I ended up going elsewhere most mornings. Business centre is not great two very old monitors and the link is sooooo slow and st a $1 per Mmnute I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Sound hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: honkiehoteler
Reviews.Content: It was the first time for me to stay here. The location in combination with the high quality makes this one of my favorites to stay in in Singapore. I had a club room. Breakfast was ok on the club floor, but is better downstairs (basically, as almost always with club rooms...). My room was a bit noisy (e.g. I could clearly hear the next room noises). I stayed in the old part (they added a new wing). The gym was adequate, although missed a few 'essentials'.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ParksyMelb
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully situated luxury hotel with new and modern facilities. Stroll across the road for a Singapore Slinger at Raffles, catch the MRT or walk to Orchard Rd for a spot of shopping or strolling. Clarke Quay is nearby, as is the CBD, and other delights of Singapore. At the end of a long and hot day of sightseeing, retreat to the Carlton Hotel, have a rest, catch a movie on the TV, and indulge in Singaporean or Western cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Carlton as in compact”
Reviews.Author: travelingmadam
Reviews.Content: stayed for two nights at Carlton for business purpose last May. booked the standard room and got on the 10th floor (forgot the exact room number). facing the SMU building and the view of Bras basah road nearby. all I could say is that Carlton is definitely a compact hotel and that's all about it. for me, since I was out all day and did not come back till 9pm so I did not find any trouble at all. check in was fast (3.00pm) and the staffs were friendly and nice. the room was okay, in my words, acceptable for a standard room consider it was much spacious although I admit most of it was a bit out dated especially the bathroom (which i found a bit small also and uncomfortable). bed was so/so but at least the housekeeper changed my linen daily. did not try the breakfast buffet so I could not comment on that. the pool was somewhat okay but did not swim in there as well, just spent a couple hour before check out beside the pool. location was definitely very okay. took me across the street for Chijmes, catholic church nearby, money changer just a walk nearby, 7eleven beside money changer and also next to Bras basah complex where you could find cheap bargain stuff and books. also nearby to MRT. very handy for me who relied on public transport. also 10min walk to Suntec and Raffles hotel. overall it was a nice decent 4* hotel even though i found it a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Notrub57
Reviews.Content: A two-night stopover. Room comfortable and large, well appointed. Bathroom clean and modern. Had a ironing board but no iron. Room smelt of smoke on first entering but smell went after aircon turned up. Mini bar, pay as you go internet access. Very nice restaurant with excellent buffet breakfast. Hotel located next door to Raffles Hotel and Raffles Plaza, an ideal location to most attractions. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: chengdu-resident
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel prior to the Singapore Grand Prix and was greatly disappointed. We booked a room which was not made known to us at the time but was part of the 'old' part of the Carlton hotel and the room was extremely basic for a 5 star hotel. It literally had a double bed, a basic bathroom, two chairs and other basic amenties. Don't get me wrong the location is good and the room was generally clean. One advice is to check which building you are put in prior to your booking and that there are better 5 star hotels in Singapore for the price that we had paid.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sreyashi
Reviews.Content: Best value in a great location, located across the street from the ultra-expensive Raffles Hotel, City Hall MRT station, 2 blocks away, 1/2 hour walk to the Singapore River, Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and Merlion.The location of the hotel is very nice as it keeps you away from the touristy crowds, yet you are not too far away from anything. The nearby shopping complexes like the Raffles mall, Suntec city mall and Bugis junction...give you a range of shopping. Changi International Airport is a 20-minute drive away. The staff was extremely courteous, polite and responsive to all of my needs. Tip Try eating at the Hawker Markets at Buggis Junction. They have the most local food, and are pretty cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: shiv1Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Oh! I loved this hotel. Get it if you can for sure u won't be disappointed. Why I liked it ok 1 very good location, very central n close to city hall station ,raffels esplande station, suntec towers. U r basically living in the downtown with everything at ur door steps. 2 very clean 3service , amazing 4 linens,bed high quality Would live here second time fit sure but latest craze is marina sands hotel. It is where everyone wants to stay because of it's new building, casino n no matter where u go in Singapore u will see this unique building with one boat like  thing sitting on top of three buildings but for sure it is not located at as convientent location as Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff, Superb location”
Reviews.Author: alant1955
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of the city the Carlton Hotel is next to the world famous Raffles Hotel, the Raffles mall, Chijmes for food and drink an the city hall MRT. This makes getting to and from your base to virtually anywhere in Singapore easy to do. The staff are pleasant, polite and extremely helpful. We arrived before 10am, way before check in time yet we were met with a smile and given our room immediately. The bar is a pleasant place to spend some time if you are unable to leave the hotel although Chijmes with its many bars and restaurants is just across the road. I have read reviews commenting on the rooms being a little old and for some rooms this may be true but importantly everything works well and is spotlessly clean. Yes I will use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - excellent location but pool ice cold... :-(”
Reviews.Author: Babetoo
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay in Singapore in connection with a trip to Borneo. Carlton Hotel is excellent situated just opposite the Raffles Hotel and Metro station. Nice and well-functioning hotel. Breakfast buffet contained everything one could wish for + a little extra! Only complaint was the pool. Even on a hot summer day with an outside temperature of above 30 degrees celcius not even my most eager child could overcome the freezing temperature of the water and get in. As we chose this particular hotel partly because it had a large pool it was a real disappointment. Everything else lived up to expectations including a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: barbados00503
Reviews.Content: It is one of the older hotels in Singapore and it has seen its best years in the past. The locaation is convenient with a pleasant roof top bar "Loop" just around the corner, just as the Rafles hotel and a big shopping mall. As I had booked last minute through an alternative internet site, this lead to confusion and resulted in double charging my credit card at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again and again!”
Reviews.Author: PublicDisplay
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in at around 11am. We were advised to get the premiere room insted of just the ordinary ones and we made the right choice! The room was homey and elegant at the same time. Everything we need is there. The bathroom was big, clean, and elegant and the price diff is just small if u get the ordinary one. You actually get a lot! Chijmes is just infront of the hotel and kopitiam and 711 is just a few blocks away. raffles city mall is also infront. I love this hotel. Its reasonable but u get more of what u paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for some meetings as I was passing through on my way back from the US. My flight arrived at 5.30am and so I had requested an early check in on that morning. I arrived at the hotel at around 6am, but was told they were fully booked. I tried to request a refund so that i could go find another hotel to stay at..as I wasn't about to sit around the lobby for 6-7 hours...but they told me that the room was prepaid and that there was no refund. However, they were very friendly and told me that they will give me the first room that came available. I ended up sitting in the lobby for 3 hours before they managed to give me a room that someone had just checked out of. Ok, I won't fault them on this....if there are no rooms then there are no rooms. I just wished they would've contacted me a day or two before to tell me what my chances were of getting an early check in on the day of my arrival. The rooms were pretty nice and comfortable....not a huge room, but about average. However, the bathrooms looked as though you had just stepped into a 3 star hotel. Definitely in need of a redo as the tiles were getting old and everything looking a bit dated. Managed to catch a swim in their pool....pretty nice and decent size to get some laps, and thank goodness it wasn't too crowded. Probably because it's the rainy season. I guess the best thing about this hotel is it's location. Just across the road from Chijmes, the mall, etc. Very convenient without having the hussle and bussle of Orchard road. I paid a pretty high rate for this hotel, but I heard that the rates were high at all Singapore hotels, and that they were all fully booked due to some Asian Conference....so not much of a choice. I guess if I could get cheap rates at this hotel in the future, then I wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Asinvari
Reviews.Content: I'm trying really hard to think of anything to fault the Carlton on, but I really can't. Its reasonably price, clean, tidy, nice swimming pool, staff were friendly & helpful, & the location is just excellent, practically everything is within walking distance, & anything that isn't is acessible from the MRT station that's 3 minutes away. Chijmes with its range of restaurants is next door & Clarke Quay with dozens more is only about 10 minutes walk away. Raffles, Arab St, Little India, the Singapore Flyer, the Fountain of Wealth, the CBD...everything is nearby. Really enjoyed our 5 nights there, & would definitely book with them again if we return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, good location, not perfect by any means”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the older rooms, in the previous "new wing". It was a reasonable size, good wired internet, bright, clean with decent bathroom and shower. It reminded me of the Swissotel a bit of 5 years ago. Staff were plesant if not leaping over themselves to do anything for you, and the hotle felt like it had space. Around it there are good shopping, drinking and eating with Raffles Plaza, Raffles and Chimes on the other corners of this junction. THe new wing does look good and I'd be happy to stay there again. The downside on my wing could be security. The is no card control access on the lfit and the junction is, annoyingly, getting to be quite well used by the local prostitutes. They're a minor hassle but I did see two of them leave the hotel, which begs the question on security. It does seem quite open and something the management need to work on.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Magnus-Maximus
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with the location of the Carlton. It is across the street from 'Chijmes' (good restaurants and bars), close to a MRT station, within walking distance of Raffles, not far from attractions. We took a cab to the Zoo for $15. There is nothing special about the hotel, but nothing bad either. We booked in advance through a travel agent and got a decent rate which included breakfast. The breakfast buffet has a huge range of food but I wouldn't have paid the $22 per person the Carlton charges. Our room was large with a king size bed, robes, weighing scales, a safe, tea and coffee making facilities, minibar, flat screen TV, iron and ironing board. The bathroom was beautiful with a large bath and a separate walk-in shower. No wireless internet access in the room. There is a small fitness room (we didn't use it) and a decent sized outdoor pool, we had it to ourselves the few times we were there. Unlike previous reviewers we were not affected by any renovations. We found the staff to be helpful and couteous and the hotel/rooms to be clean and tidy. No complaints but nothing "wowed" us either.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Deepluscee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located. Close to public transportation. There's money changer near by, which makes it a lot handy. Hotel lobby looks very classy. Big and nice. In general, the hotel is very appealing. We got the hotel accommodation cheaper than what it is actually priced. Probably, it's because we reserved just a day before our arrival. The room is big enough. Comfortable bed. But they forgot to put the inclusions written on our reservation. No bath robes and weighing scale, needed to follow it up with the receptionist. When we came back, they only left one bath robe. Reservation states 2 robes. All in all, it was a good experience. No included breakfast though. Hotel price is quite expensive. Might come back again if they will have a reasonable priced promo.

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: sidhantjatia
Reviews.Content: good hotel clean but very old, refurnishing was going on when i stayed and rooms though spacious not upto standard.... for the same price you can get better hotels but was a last min booking done through business associates..

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRDARYANI
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 days in Feb 2010. The ambience is nice, however, the quality of service is not good. We had to wait for long to get the things. Besides, the hotel was under renovation, hence we faced inconvenience. Surprisingly, the reception was moved to 6th floor, which was not a good idea. Food was OK. It has provision for even providing Indian food, though with limited variety. The fitness centre was very small in size with limited equipment.

Reviews.Title: “True Value for Your leisure and business trip”
Reviews.Author: anil4221
Reviews.Content: its a neat clean , well connected hotel with a very good service by the courteous staff

Reviews.Title: “Not Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Abhi1984
Reviews.Content: Carlton Hotel Singapore is not one of the finest business hotels to stay at as the quality of overall service is not at par with its peers in the same category.The staff is also not very polite and cooperative .The rooms are just ok. So one should not be expecting much from this hotel in terms of quality experience . Not really value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good standard everythign to be as expected”
Reviews.Author: Cassiepod
Reviews.Content: Handy location in singapore. Good shops and tourist sites nearby. Hotel was lovely very clean and tidy, attentive staff. Lovely comfy, firm bed. Clean bathroom. enough space but not huge and wasteful! Wide ranging breakfast buffet choices - you can choose a different style every day for nearly a week I reckon.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: IshDewyn
Reviews.Content: Having to be in Singapore for 4 days for a convention at Suntec Convention Centre, the Carlton was the hotel closest to my venue, available on last-minute booking, that met my SGD300 per night business budget. I looked online for rates, and when I found that the Carlton was available for SGD256++ per night, I called the hotel's reservations desk to book. However, I was told that the rates and room I had looked up were no longer available, and they offered me one at SGD340++, with no corporate rates. Unconvinced, I went back online and finally booked thorough a booking site, which gave me a rate of SGD299 and a bit (nett) for room + broadband, without breakfast (additional SGD20++). I opted out for breakfast as I am more the sort to grab brekkie on-the-go. It was also fortunate that I hadn't bothered, as upon walking out to the convention centre the next morning, I found the breakfast service full, with guests queued up waiting for tables. As a single, female traveller, I was extremely surprised to see that they had given me a room at the very end of the corridor! Perhaps this was a result of booking through external online sites, but I must say I have never encountered this with other hotels I've booked via the same site. I've always been given rooms closer to the elevator lobbies. The hotel was very clean. The hotel itself is rather old, I think, as evidenced by the fixed ID (eg. the bathroom, marble in the common areas, overall design, etc.) but effort certainly has been made to keep the hotel updated. It felt light, clean & fresh. The bed was comfortable, the linen and draperies were clean & dust-free, and despite what was obviously an "old" bathroom, I have never seen a cleaner one. The grouting was spotlessly white. For strictly business travelling purposes, the hotel was adequate. It was a clean, comfortable, quiet place to return to and rest at the end of a busy day. However, I was rather upset with their front desk staff, and judging from the number of other guests talking rather forcefully at the front desk, I wasn't the only one. Upon check-in, I REPEATEDLY advised the clerk that I wished to pay the bill by cash, and NOT via the credit card I used to secure the room, so that it would be quicker for me to process my own accounts later. I asked if they wanted it paid up in full up-front, or later upon check-out. They advised me that payment only needed to be made upon check-out, but that they needed a deposit from me upon check-in, against accidental damages, which I thought was fair. However, upon check-out, they happily returned the cash to me and smiled me away. It turns out that despite my bugging them repeatedly about remembering that it was to be a CASH payment, they had charged it to the credit card UPON CHECK-IN anyway. I was quite upset with that, and had words with the duty manager. However, they insisted that nothing could be done to reverse the charges. The problem is that despite being an English-speaking nation, the front desk staff seem to have a poor grasp for UNDERSTANDING what was being said to them in English. Upon check-in, I spoke to no less that THREE people, the final one being the senior personnel in charge, who, as it turns out, STILL had not understood my request for cash payment! How difficult can that instruction be? Similarly, upon check-out, I also had to speak to THREE people before I received a clear explaination, ending with an irate conversation with the duty manager. I suppose if you do not intend to come into contact at all with the service staff, then you shouldn't have many problems with staying at the Carlton. Location-wise, it is two blocks down (7 minutes walk) to Suntec, and pretty much 10 mins by cab to the CDB, Orchard Road or Clarke Quay. It is directly opposite Chjimes, and a short walk away from the Raffles City mall and City Hall MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Just good enough”
Reviews.Author: upita_blog
Reviews.Content: The biggest value for me was the excellent location. Right across the road from Chijmes, a stone throw away from an MRT station, walking distance to Raffles Shopping Centre, Cathay Cineplex movie theatre, restaurants and a few sightseeing attractions. The hotel itself is quite plain, nothing much to compliment and nothing much to complain about. But then again, not much is needed from a city hotel except for cleanliness, staff efficiency and good location. As a business traveler I was leaving the hotel after breakfast and coming back late at night. Breakfast selection was generous. The gym could do better with a few more exercise and cardio machines. I stayed in Carlton 5-6 times which is about half of all my trips to Singapore. And will continue coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Shreksmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Carlton for 5 nights. It is not an expensive hotel for the area in which it stands and we found it to be good value. It is in a good location with ease of access to transport links and is near many of the sites of Singapore. We stayed in a Premier Club Room which meant we had access to the Executive Lounge. It also meant we had breakfast, drinks during the day and evening cocktails included, together with a limited amount of free laundry. It seemed that rather a lot of people stayed in a Premier Club Room as the executive lounge could get quite crowded. The service did not seem as good in the executive lounge as in the rest of the hotel. Also, there were a lot of people there on business and they tended to sit in the lounge in the evening with their laptops or had meetings in there. This meant that those of us there on holiday often found it difficult to find somewhere to sit. If the hotel wants to promote their Club Rooms they definitely need a bigger executive lounge. As we had a choice of where to have breakfast, we opted for the main restaurant on the ground floor after the first morning. We were glad we did as it was a much more pleasant atmosphere and the choice of food was much better, quite exceptional in fact. The rooms were good and the service in the rest of the hotel was excellent. The food was also of a high standard. We would stay at the Carlton again and despite the problems in the executive lounge we would still choose a Club Room as it did represent good value because of the extras.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, but bland”
Reviews.Author: Marco_PoloHongKong
Reviews.Content: The Carlton Hotels great strength is location. It is next door to Raffles Hotel (but much cheaper than Raffles), 3 mins walk away from Raffles City Shopping and Conference Centre, and directly opposite the Chimes restaurant and bar complex. This puts you right in the centre of Singapore – close enough to walk anywhere that you need to go in the CBD. The hotel is clean, quiet and well appointed. The rooms have all standard 4*/5* amenities (e.g. iron & ironing board, coffee/tea making stuff, good aircon etc. It was all just rather bland, the hotel does everything efficiently, but it has little character. My only real gripe is having to pay for the internet. The internet is not expensive in Singapore. The Carlton is clearly marketing itself as a 4, or 5* Business Hotel. Why do they charge extra for the net ? Breakfast was particularly good (the ony ‘non-bland’ part of my visit), a huge range of foods were available – very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Geamz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a stopover to Brisbane. Staff friendly, large room but bit dated, could do with a freshening up. Great location with nice views over the city. We both had a full body massage in the spa- very reasonable price and very relaxing massage, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NigelHa
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my visit was courtesy of Qantas as the plane was delayed at Singapore but the hotel seemed very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: Gone~Walkabout~Man
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights, February 9th & 10th, 2010. I booked directly with the hotel's own web site. I paid a rate of 191 Singapore dollars per night, or, $ 170 USD per night. I stayed in room # 1323. Yes, they actually have a 13th floor in this hotel. The hotel is under renovation, you get a hint of this, when they send you up to the 5th floor, to check-in, there, they have set up their front desk operation in a broom closet. When you finally get to your room, there is a letter on your bed, telling you about the renovations, and, the expected down times for the telephone system. Their television stations, are unbelievable, you can get news channels in 16 different languages. News channels from Germany, Italy, Japan, China...etc...etc....They must think that people live on news. There was hardly any entertainment channels available at all. The room itself was clean and comfortable. There was an antiquiated security safe in the room, good enough for your passport, airline tickets, jewlery...etc...etc...but, I couldn't lock up my 15" inch lap-top computer inside it. No WiFi, but, they do have an outrageously priced LAN in-room internet hook-up cable, you have to pay $ 27 USD per day for this internet service. Like I said Outrageous ! Especially for what you pay, just for their basic room rate. I ordered room service one night during my stay. The food was warm and tasteless and just bland. The second night I went to their in-house, supposedly famous, Chinese (Cantonese)restaurant, "Wah Lok". Please, stay away from this place, go find yourself a street vendor, with a push cart, down in China-town or Geylang, you'll get better food, AND, better service too ! Upon check-out...I had to practically hail my own taxi at the front entrance, because, they had the bell captain and his bell boys helping out, sorting floor tiles with the construction crews doing the renovations. I have been coming to Singapore for 25 years, since 1984. This was my first time at this hotel, and, I can tell you, it is my last time. I like to try different hotels in town from time-to-time, but, this was one of my worst experiences in Singapore. I'll never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great accessibility hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LOLA_BLISS
Reviews.Content: Myself and my parents were there end of November for 3days. At that time, the lobby was undergoing refurbishment so they had to move their reception to another floor. When we arrived, the staff was waiting for us at the entrance and brought us to the new designated reception. As for breakfast, there is a wide range of local and western cuisine for us to choose from. Best of all, it is located just a stone throw away from Raffles City and about 5 minutes walk to Bugis Junction! It is so easy to move around if you stay here and less busy than Orchard! I will definitely recommend this hotel to everyone, especially to those visiting Singapore for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I wasn't paying!”
Reviews.Author: brulynn
Reviews.Content: Due to our onward flight being delayed by 24 hours the airline booked us into the Carlton. We had been staying in the Grand Central at our expense. Huge clean room with a view but to be honest the bed was no more comfy than that at the Grand Central, plenty of knobs and switches to keep most geeks amused for 10 minutes. The food was better than the GC but at the price it should be. The staff were cool and aloof but did the job. Fine if you are on expenses and not too worried about value for money.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ellenbrookPerth
Reviews.Content: * * * XMAS 2009 * * * BOOKED IN AUG 2009: When we booked & paid in full hotel we were told we had to upgrade to a Delux room (1 double & 1 fold-away) because 2 adults & 1 child couldn't stay in a standard room "fire & saftety reasons" they stated. Our family arrived @ Carlton hotel @ 0400 after a 5hr flight - room given had 2 single beds only!!!! Very, very tired we went back down to front desk to show our booking papers to be told "double bed & fold - away was just a request". Where was my 10 year old to sleep??? What had we paid for??? Exhausting !!! A fold-away was given & NIL apology. Xmas breakfast was very average. Location good but, many other hotels to choose from in the heart of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, that's it”
Reviews.Author: CHM1
Reviews.Content: Did not expect much as it's the only hotel with rooms available in our package. Location is very good: right across from Raffles Hotel, Raffles City (the Fairmont and Swisshotel), Chymes, National Library, etc. The property itself is under a big renovation as a new Annex is being built in front of it. I can see that the renovation is much needed as the interior is very dated. Gym has adequate equipment, but the pool is a bit sad, though still good enough for some sun tanning. Check-in staff was a mess... not sure if it was because the staff was new or if the renovation was affecting its efficiency (reception had to be moved into a meeting room because construction work was being done at the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “NO chewing gum, NO spitting, YES to stains on the bed sheet at the Carlton Hotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ie_de
Reviews.Content: Recently because of work I (and my wife/ colleague) had to stay at the Carlton Hotel in Singapore. We arrived around midnight, and about 1:30am just as we were getting ready to go to sleep. I pull back the sheet to get in to bed instead we find blood stains on the bed sheet. They were not fresh stains, and the sheets were washed, however they were blood stains. Someone else's blood stains. Luckily since my wife and I were traveling together, the company we work for, provide us with our own room. Having 2 room allow us the opportunity to change rooms incase either one of us snores to loud. lol. Back to the stain. We immediately called the front desk and asked to have our bed sheets changed due to the bloodstain. We received a not so sympathetic apology and a will send someone to change the bed sheet. Since we had another room, and from previous experience on waiting for service we decided to just change room and use the room as a snores escape. As we were moving our luggage and belonging to the other room, we noticed the chambermaid coming in our originally room with 1 bed sheet. As we get settled in to our second room, and we start to get ready for bed....dejavu now the second room bed sheet also has a whitish/cream dry/crusty stain. Needless to say we immediately contacted the front desk and requested a different room on the same floor. However instead of an apology we received a "I am sorry we have no other rooms available on the same floor". At this point since we just wanted to go to bed, we asked to have the key brought up right away. A few minutes later we received the key to a room across the hall from our original room. Our new room had clean sheets and finally we were able to go to sleep by 2:45am. Leaving our room about 10am, we noticed the chambermaid cleaning the rooms on our floor. Arriving to the hotel by 4pm we checked our second room to see if they had changed the bed sheet and much to our surprise they had not. They did made up the bed, but they did not change the stained sheet. I wish I could say this was the first time this had happened to me at this hotel, but unfortunately the same issue had happened about 3 years ago. In that instance it took about :45 minutes for the chambermaid to come change my bed sheet. I've stayed in many hotels, and in most (if not all hotels), when you have an issue at the hotels the staff goes out of their way to try to makeup for the inconvenience, at the Carlton Hotel they do not. If I had a choice I would not stay at the Carlton Hotel, hence I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, overpriced rooms”
Reviews.Author: Vidooshak
Reviews.Content: Given the number of excellent hotels and great deals in Singapore, one cannot say Carlton is value for money. It shows signs of aging and the management has done an OK job of refurbishing. The rooms are large but not as contemporary as similar category hotels like, say, the Grand Copthorne. The TV has only local channels with poor reception and scheduled English movies. Even the breakfast spread is nothing exemplary. At S$350, it must be one of the most over-priced deals in CBD. The only reason I loved my stay there and would still recommend it to people, is the excellent staff. The people were so friendly, accommodating and always smiling and wishing you well-- even at 2AM. Finally, a memorable stay is all about the vibes and this hotel had loads of positive ones!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Oklahoma City, OK and Chennai, India
Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice staff, clean hotel, and nice location, but overinflated prices.”
Reviews.Author: JusticeSeeker4
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a friend for Christmas Vacation 2009 in Singapore. We're American ex-pats living in India. We found the cheapest price for the Carlton on Orbitz and as she wanted a higher ranked/starred hotel, but I wanted cheaper prices we decided on the Carlton. It was a nice place and I've definitely stayed in much much worse as I tend to go cheap, but I do not think it was worth it for the price. Don't get me wrong, it was nice, just not nice enough for what they charge, although Singapore as a whole is overly inflated in prices. I would say it is comparable to an a Ramada Inn back or a little higher hotel, but where I would pay about $80 a night for something like that in the U.S., we paid $110 a night with a double discount. Add in that there was no meal included, not even a bad continental breakfast, and no free internet or business center, it was quite expensive for what it was. Having said that, the staff was super friendly and helpful, and even advised us against using the business center and instead directed us to the much cheaper internet cafe around the corner. It is a great location though, within walking distance of Orchard Road shopping, yet allowing you to not be in the massive hub-bub of it all, and the restaurants around it are cheaper (even McDonald's) than the ones on Orchard Road. Overall, a very nice basic place to stay that has ambitions as well as pricing of being so much more. The only real complaint was the price, but I would definitely stay again, especially if I could get it even cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Painful experience in getting Carlton Hotel to finally refund overcharge”
Reviews.Author: jcmhwang
Reviews.Content: On 1 Sep 2009, I booked on-line for a six-night stay of 6-12 DEc 2009 for a total of S$1,341.78. Both the web site and the reservation confirmation say "a non-refundable deposit of S$223.63 is charged at the time of booking." However, Carlton immediately charged my credit card for the entire S$1,341.78 and would not admit the mistake. I didn't like the attitube of Carlton, so I cancelled the reservation in early September thinking I'd rather forfeit the S$223.63 to stay in another more likable hotel. Since then, I have not been able to get Carlton to refund the overcharge of S$1,118.15 despite numerous phone calls. I even stopped by the hotel when I finally attended the conference in Singapore in December and patiently presented all facts to the front desk manager. Eventually, Carlton refunded the S$1,118.15 only after I complained to the Singapore Tourism Board. What a pain!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssmmiittaa
Reviews.Content: Close to Raffles City, Chijmes, CityHall MRT, the Merlion, Suntec City, Esplanade Theatres and Marina square and a short taxi ride from everywhere else (especially Clarke Quey – must visit!) , this huge hotel offers clean, basic comforts at an excellent location. Due to renovation, the reception has temporarily been shifted to the 6th floor but other than the check-in/out (quite efficient), the renovation did not affect our stay in any way. The rooms were a good size and the large windows gave a feeling of bigger space. We stayed 4 nights and had a good time, I would definitely choose the Carlton again - just for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Broadway Beng”
Reviews.Author: ChutimaT
Reviews.Content: Close to Raffles City, CityHall MRT, National Library, Bugis Village. You can walk to Suntec City, Esplanade Theatres and Marina square and many places.

Reviews.Title: “All you Need”
Reviews.Author: PackingQueen
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel; does all the basics well. Very good location; this hotel is in a main hotel area. Minuses are the laundry service which is horrendously expensive (and they shrunk a much beloved pair of travel trousers) and the restaurant downstairs which should only be used as a last resort for breakfast. That is, unless cold eggs and watery lukewarm coffee are your thing. Room service is expensive, but far superior to the downstairs dining. I had the best fillet steak of my life from the room service menu... Finally thumbs up for the swimming pool - a life saver if you are travelling with children and teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for a long-term stay, but totally fine”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromJC
Reviews.Content: My company put me up at the Carlton for a month. pros: - The room was quite spacious and I did not mind living out of it for the month. - Long-term stays receive a plate of fruit every Monday - Wireless works at the outdoor pool. Pool is nice and is open until 10pm. Pool bar is open til 8pm and food is available there as well. - Bed was large and comfy. - Room came equipped with a converter plug. - Staff working front door and lobby are very polite. cons: - For the first week, every day I moved the comfy chair by the desk where I used the internet and every day the cleaning staff moved it back across the room. She finally caught on after a week and stopped moving it. - On Mondays I would receive a plate, a knife, a fork, a napkin. I would eat some bread off of the plate on Tuesday mornings and then the plate and cutlery would be taken away, not to reappear until the following Monday. - The business center is a racket. I am paying for the internet in my room on a daily basis, but to get something printed out in the business center, which required logging on to my email quickly, I was charged a dollar a minute! I hit print at a minute 30 and nothing happened. I waited another 20 seconds or so and then called to the staffperson. She came over and made something work on the printer. By this time I had been online for 2 and a half minutes. I said, "so you'll just charge me for 2 minutes, right?" She said, "you were on for 2:40 and that rounds up to 3." I said, "but the printer was not working. I had to wait for you to come fix it." She said, "you were online for 2 minutes 40 seconds." Whatever. Somehow my one page printout cost $5. - Wireless works in public areas of the hotel, but in the room, I can only access the internet with the ethernet cable. - Food is pretty expensive in the hotel. Normallly the breakfast buffet costs $36. I received it for $20 as a long-term guest, but this still seemed like an awful lot. Food at the Chinese restaurant is $20-$40 for a single entree and is not geared toward the solo traveler. - Shower had mysterious issues. It would turn off after a minute or so of running. I discovered that letting it run for a minute and then either turning it off or letting it turn itself off and then turning it back on solved the problem. Agree with other reviewers that the bathrooms could use an upgrade. Lighting is also very poor in the bathroom and the mirror is bit off kilter. When I was plucking my eyebrows, I would think I had grasped a hair and I would not have it due to the mirror being wonky. - When I got a message on my TV from the concierge it said I had to call reception to get the light on the TV to stop blinking. Overall, I have no major issues with this hotel. It's just got a few kinks to work out.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: salthound
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Carlton many years ago and retruned there recently. The hotel was undergoing significant renovations (I seem to remember that this was the case previously!) The hotel offers all the facilities required for the business traveller but I had to pay extra for using the internet which always seems a con. The rooms are comfortable but you would expect this since it is not a cheap hotel. The location is good, close to Chjimes and a reasonable walk to Clarke/Boat Quays. It offers a reasonable place to stay on a business trip but maybe there are other places offering better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money, needs a little renovation”
Reviews.Author: Luckyvoyage
Reviews.Content: The hotel is next door to the legendary Raffles Hotel and Marketplace...about 10-15 minute walk to the Merlion Park. There's a local food court nearby if you turn right from the hotel, where they sell delicious bbq skates. I like the convenient location, good internet access, staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The only problem during our stay was the plugged up bathtub...we only stayed 2 nights, so didn't want to move rooms, but the plumbing is getting old in the hotel. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and will be back if we next come to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, good location, take an umbrella!”
Reviews.Author: WelshBirdEmma
Reviews.Content: Reception and public areas were great. Staff were all professional, friendly and attentive - the housekeeper on my floor and the doorman were especially lovely. Rooms were basic and in need of refurbishment although clean and functional. Great location and you can walk to most places of interest from here e.g. Raffles is accross the street, the river and Quay areas are only 5 mins walk and there are some nice malls a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: catietravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in August. The room was on the 21st floor with a great view. I was impressed with the clean room, and nice bathroom. The service could have been better but since this is not a 5 star hotel I wasn't expecting it to be at that level. I was very happy with the pool and was able to sit and read a book on one of my days off very peacefully. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet which was included in my package, and I must say the buffet at this hotel has a vast selection of choices. Very nice for a person on a long trip. The beds were small but comfy, and I would definately stay here again just based on location. Everything is with in walking distance, and the hotel staff will help you if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel - Extremely Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: ajnosl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel on 20th August at around 8am. I had called ahead and asked for a 3rd bed in the room and thought I got a reasonable price of $80. When we arrived the room was ready and we went straight to it exhausted. My son was thirsty and I allowed him to drink a bottle of water from the fridge only to discover that its cost was about £4.00 - so beware! If you come out of the the hotel and right then right at the lights you will see 7-11 across the road where drinks are far cheaper. The breakfast was included in the room price and was very nice indeed, a selection of everything from boiled eggs to omelettes etc. We were not allowed to eat on the first day because we were not supposed to check in before 2pm however they were kind enough to let us have the room immediately. On the last morning we left before the breakfast room was ready but they let us go in and help ourselves tobreads, pastries fruit and juice which I thought was good of them - but then we had paid for breakfast for this day! The room was spacious even with the 3 quite large single beds. The linen was crisp and clean and the beds were made and room cleaned everyday that we were there. We were on the 10th floor and view was very nice and we did not hear any of the work that has been discussed on this site, unless we went outside. There is a small swimming pool on the 5th floor with sunbeds but we did not use it although it was quite peaceful there. This hotel is excellent for its position in singapore. Immediately across the road is the Chijmes food complex. We went to carnivores as many people on here have mentioned it. However, we were not impressed as it was fairly pricey for what it was. Chefs come round with skewers of meat and you turn you table mat to green if you want some and red if you dont. Different meats come out at different intervals - mostly beef I found, but lamb, chicken and fish were all on offer. $45 dollars per head excluding drinks, 7% government tax and 10% service charge. It soon adds up. If you come out of the hotel and turn left, cross at the lights you will see Raffles Hotel. It was a wonderful colonial building for the rich and famous but a must see nevertheless. If you keep working right past it, you wil come to the Suncity Mall. In here you can buy a one or two day bus sightseeing tour, which offers hop on hop off options for the two days and you can use it much as you want until it stops running, it also offers a boat ride on the river which was very pleasant. I think was paid about $25 for the two days, but it was well worth it as we got to see everything including orchard road where you could get off if you had brought your mortgage money with you!!! There is plenty to see however this country is very expensive indeed. The "theme park" (sorry i cant remember the name of it) is an absolute rip off. You pay a couple of dollars to get in then pay the the ride, each one between 15 and 29 dollars per ride or £6 and £14. We walked in and walked out! Sinagpore as a country has no culture of its own and I found this very disappointing - It is just new everywhere or being built. There is this feeling of rushing, very much as in London and I found it stressful and couldn't wait to leave. The Carlton however, is a great place to rest your head at the end of a busy day sightseeing. My only disappointment with the carlton was that when I came to leave the price quoted for the extra bed did not include 10% service charge and 7% government tax. This annoyed me very much cause i was quoted cheaper in England for the extra bed through the travel agent. Still penny wise pound foolish!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dubious value”
Reviews.Author: Christine_sing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton in September for business. I booked online, then called them up to discover they had better offers which included internet - something which in China for example is standard for a 4-star or higher. Anyway, so I booked the higher rate incl. internet and breakfast. Mind, it was still about SGD 198, which is not budget. The room though definetly was. Equipped like in the 80s with the turn-knob flush toilets which dont flush, the small cream brick tiled bathroom also state-of-the-art in the 80s. For this price, I expected something much better. Since I came straight from Shanghai, this hotel could look up to the ankles to the 4-star I had there. The people at the reception were unreceptive to my complaints, so I had to pay extra to upgrade to a room I would expect in a 4-star hotel. Even though, late checkout was met with unresponsiveness. This is Singapore, so if you have a choice - which you do - stay elsewhere. Location-wise, there is the big 5-star just across the road, where you will get a better deal for your money. Or just stay somewhere else - in Singapore, you dont need to put up with this. Apart from the reception, this hotel had one big thing going for it - the service of the people below. That means the staff maintaining the rooms, the porters which were extremely nice, and the bellmen. Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Service is a let down”
Reviews.Author: mozilla_monster
Reviews.Content: As a frequent guest at the hotel, I can see the service has been gradually deteriorating. My last visit was really bad - the internet didn't work, and despite being promised resolution within a certain time, and being promised a call from the hotel manager, I didn't get one. The checkouts take forever, as do the check ins, and lately, I don't even get the complimentary bottles of water anymore ... I really think that service can improve. It's such a strategically located hotel that if you improve service, then you get a really good value offering. At the moment, I'm avoiding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great for shopping, dining, MRT access and more”
Reviews.Author: irah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Mid-July 2009 for five nights with my extended family - we had reserved four rooms. We were assigned rooms in the 'old' tower on the 15th and 21st floors. Apparently, the rooms in the 'new' tower are supposed to be nicer. But, we really did not find anything wrong with the rooms that we were assigned. Before we reserved, I did read some earlier posts complaining about the carpets and bathrooms. But we did not find them to be true. We arrived around 9:30AM, but check-in is only at 2PM. We hung around the lobby area and finally they gave us our rooms around 11:30AM. Our package included breakfast which was buffet style and had standard fare. Can't really complain about anything with this hotel.I would definitely consider staying here again. Singapore is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sydboy07
Reviews.Content: Was lucky to get a secret deal on wotif for this hotel, so the rate was reasonable for singapore. The rooms was a decent size, comfy bed. Location is great. Easy to get the MRT to anywhere in singapore, and a lot of tourist sites and the night life are a short taxi trip away as well. Plenty of places to eat and shop near by. Would gladly stay at the Carlton Hotel if they have another cheap rate :)

Reviews.Title: “Class hotels”
Reviews.Author: koolguysg
Reviews.Content: Carlton the name itself descirbes the class of the hotel. it is located in City hall the prime location in Singapore and easy acess to those who have business meeting in raffles and suntec city. i liked the hotel very much becoz of its class and service provided by them

Reviews.Title: “Will avoid unless absolutely necessary”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2009India
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff service is not good. Bad lighting in the rooms. Good room size. Breakfast menu is limited. Location is also not very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SunitaMumbai
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel situated near Raffles City shopping mall and the Chimes market. For evenings, one can walk upto the few markets and shopping area. Overall the hotel is nice and clean. The gym is good .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: friendlytipsMumbai
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location- opposite fabulous restaurants at Chimes, close to the mall, the metro is close by and close to the Raffles. Rooms are okay and suitable for a business visit. Ours was a mixed visit - a bit of business for my husband and also to have a Valentine's Day getaway. So from the romantic getaway aspect, it fell flat. We couldn't even get a double bed! Had twin beds in spite of requesting for it. Though we did not eat there, the restaurants seemed good. Have no comment about that. Concierge at the door was very helpful about where to go and what to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, but room and facilities could improve”
Reviews.Author: cheap_flashpacker
Reviews.Content: Room was part of a vacation package we bought, so lodging is not bad as far as price. Location is very good given that it's near the Raffle City shopping mall where subway is easy access and food/money changing is readily available. Staff was helpful, complementary breakfast buffet was clean and tasty. Raffles hotel is next door so I can easily walk there to take a great night shot. However, I may not necessarily choose this hotel if I had to pay. The bathroom is a little dated and the room is one of the plainest I've ever seen. Bed is not the most comfortable, but not the worst we've had and at least it's clean. There's construction nearby (good thing we didn't hear any noise, but not a good view). If owner is willing to spend money to do improvements, this hotel can definitely get higher ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and great value for money spent”
Reviews.Author: Trivedi-KA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Carlton is located in the heart of commercial complex. Room rent is very atractive and complimentary usage of conference rooms added further flavour. Breakfast is really very delicious and staff very very co-operative. I would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, disappointed with facilities”
Reviews.Author: Scalpy
Reviews.Content: The location of the Carlton is excellent, as are the staff. However, we were more than a little disappointed with the features of the 'Club Room/Lounge'. We decided to pay a little extra for the Club Room to take advantage of the personalised check-in at the club lounge, complimentary evening cocktails/food and breakfast. Upon arrival we did not receive the personalised check-in. That evening we asked what cocktails were available in the lounge, to be told they don't do cocktails (even though the welcome letter clearly states complimentary cocktails) but I could have a beer or spirt. Considering the price of cocktails in comparison to beer I feel slightly misled. The food was pretty poor. Mini-pizzas and extremely greasy deep-fried food being the main offering. On our last breakfast we were stunned to see fishfingers! The room was okay, but I was surprised to see a 4-star hotel club room with such a small bathroom, and a shower over the bath. There is also a large amount of building work going on next door where they are building the new Carlton Premium. There is a note in the room apologising for this and assuring that work finishes at 8pm. This simply wasn't the case with work often going on until around 11pm. Please let me reiterate that the staff are excellent. But the club-room/lounge service simply doesn't deliver to the standard I believe it should.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, slow internet and HARD bed.”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was very nice, and good service from checkin, to the restaurant, to the bellmen and room service. Breakfast buffet was awesome. Dessert in the restaurant was great... Overall among the best locations in Singapore - a lot nearby and Chjmes accross the street gave many nightlife and dining options. MRT station in the mall directly accross the street. Now the downside: The overpriced internet was wired and VERY slow. What made me check out and move to Swissotel: The bed was as hard as a rock. After 24 hours of flying, a comfy bed would have been nice. This was a slab with a nice pillow and comfortor. I get hard beds in Asia but this one was about the worst ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodations in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: limelemon
