Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Standard room for 10 days in February. Though the room was basic, it was clean and adequate enough for the duration of the time we were there. The buffet breakfast was included in our hotel package. The spread of food was generally good and there was quite a variety of food to choose from. The fitness centre was small and one had to arrive early in the morning to be able to work out peacefully. We really liked the location of this hotel - only a 5 minute walk from the MRT Station, shopping and other food and beverage outlets. The only downside to our stay is that we arrived early in the morning after a long flight from SFO. The bell hop took our baggage aside and advised us that the bags would be up. We waited over 10 minutes and then decided to go downstairs and pick them up ourselves. They were still sitting there unattended. No one ever called to follow up on our baggage. Wish more attention was paid to this particular detail. Other than that, we had a good stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: prashantkataria
Reviews.Content: this is a great business/tourist hotel. located very conveniently near City Hall MRT and walking distance of Funan electronics shopping mall and across the road from CHIJMES, where you have great restaurants and pubs. there's also a Kopitiam close by for quick bites and teh (tea) or kopi (coffee) singapore style. its not too far from Bugis as well. to get to Raffles Place or Suntec City, the prime business locations, one need just take a short taxi ride or MRT (especially to Raffles Place). rooms are big, clean and spacious with nice view and staff is friendly. the breakfast is decent. one negative was that i found the check-in to be slow (at least I have experienced this 3 times I been there). but overall, its a good place to stay, central enough and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for business people”
Reviews.Author: pinalhshah
Reviews.Content: Good hotel considering the fact that it's proximity to CBD & airport with excellent connectivity rail & road. Charges are moderate considering the hotel have a landmark sort of name in Singapore Average service - had to change my room once that too after repeatative request. No choice in food ( I was told with stright face that this is not a 'Indian' Resturant when asked whether for vegetarian dish. Good view of panaroma from the window Good quality furniture. Best for people wanting to spend 2-3 days at moderate cost Would not recommand to strict vegetarian visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Ideal fro Singapore Airline stops overs”
Reviews.Author: DavidA9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton on both outward and return stop over’s for our holiday in Australia. We found the check in on both occasions smooth and efficient. Our rooms were in both parts of the hotel, would have much rather been in the new wing for both our stays as the rooms are larger and more comfortable, the bathroom and shower arrangements were also much better, we had a buffet lunch and evening meal in the Cafe Vic, we found the food to be enjoyable and well presented, the Wah Lok Cantonese Restaurant served an excellent evening meal. Had a few drinks in the lobby bar and we also enjoyed the live music, the lady who serves the tables at time appears to be quite bossy, and not happy when chairs are moved, which was an exception in relation to the staff whom we found to be most helpful and polite. The hotel is in an excellent location, bus and MRT stops close by, within walking distance of most of the visitor and historic areas of the city, we had two great meals in ‘Fattys ‘ in Bencoolin Street, but was ripped off in Clarke Quay. Raffles City is close by with all the important shops for the ladies to spend a few hours browsing, and gives a chap the time to visit the electrical, gadgets and techie shops. We hope the building works for the new wing are soon completed, but they did not cause us any problems during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Food!”
Reviews.Author: tigertwids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 8-11. Value for money was excellent. We paid about SGD175/night includes breakfast via asiatravel.com. Hotel located at the back of Raffles Hotel. Walking distance to Orchard Rd. Food is excellent in this hotel especially the buffet breakfast. They have the best chinese resto (award winning they call it). Before we go for dinner, we always have a drink in their bar @ the lobby , loved it! esp "happy hour time" half the price!. Staff are friendly, accurate and helpful. Room spotlessly clean, free mineral water +++teas & kofi. Internet in room is available but not free. Room service quite fast also. Chijmes, a resto hub is just across the hotel. Lots of resto to choose from. We tried there the Carnivores (brazilian food, nonstop meat flowing..so juicy), Teppanyaki and chinese resto(forgot the name), all serves excellent food!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable and spacious hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hamalainen
Reviews.Content: Our room was in their new extension (as of March 2009) and was a fair old size! It was clean and modern with a huge bed - recommended really though not noteworthy in particularly. The hotel is well located, only a few minutes walk from City Hall station; at the bottom of orchard road shopping area and just 5 minutes walk away from the Bugis shopping area as well. We also chose to walk from the hotel to the Chinatown area, which was worth it as we found some smaller shopping areas we would have missed if we'd jumped on the metro. The buffet breakfast was just fantastic, typical of most Singapore Hotels certainly. I had a beer or two in the lobby bar which was enjoyable and relaxed - they have live music most nights, a singer and a pianist playing mostly melodic western tunes.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!”
Reviews.Author: i_love_getaways
Reviews.Content: My fiance planned a surprise getaway for me for my Birthday at Carlton this year, and boy was I stupefied! The reception was cold, we got checked into the wrong room twice, and had to wait an hour before we got to settled into the right one. The first room was at a smoking level, granted, but I've never in my whole life stepped into a lift lobby or room that smelt so dank and bad! The carpet was stained and looked grimy. And on top of that, the room looked depressing. The final room we got was in the "renovated wing". It was a little better, with a plasma television and bigger toilet, but everything else seemed "recycled". It was a really bad experience for me overall. They're constructing a new building which I hope will live up to standards.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be confused with the Ritz....”
Reviews.Author: MichaelX
Reviews.Content: The Carlton was recommended to me by a local business partner. The location is very good next to very good restaurants, shopping and an easy walk to museums and the river. The internet connection is reasonably priced and hassle-free. However, for the price I would have expected rooms that are more updated and less spartan. My television and remote do not work properly and there is jack-hammering going on a lower floor. Also, the fitness room is a bit tight and definitely outdated. A little long in the tooth, the hotel is putting their resources into a new luxury wing being build next door so my advice would be to pass until it's ready probably sometime in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: laurapoo80
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a short break/stop off. Really lovely hotel with a cute pool on the roof. The breakfast is amazing and such good value - we overslept on the last day and missed the breakfast (which we are still gutted about!). Would recommend this hotel for a short break. The hotel is in a really good location close to malls, the MRT and an authentic open air food court just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Loved to stay at Carlton Singapore”
Reviews.Author: YoanaMary
Reviews.Content: It was fantastic to stay at Carlton Hotel.. We had a full agenday for 4 days stay in Singapore and we had a really great quality to sleep at Carlton, besides the room was clean and comfort, also the restaurant have many kind of food. The live music was also fine.. If oneday I am going to Singapore again, I will stay at Carlton.. Good quality in price and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bit disorganised”
Reviews.Author: Pinketer
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at this hotel and not the best stay, despite the genuine efforts of the staff. I had booked a room for 3 adults through Expedia but it turns out the Carlton don't have rooms which accommodate 3 adults. (They told me Expedia already know this, but Expedia have chosen to blame the hotel rather than offer any kind of apology for charging me AUS$65 a night extra for my brother to sleep on a put up bed the hotel duty manager kindly managed to squeeze somehow into the room.) The hotel didn't provide 3 sets of towels or coffee supplies though even after putting the extra bed in there, we had to ask for this to be done. There was just a general feeling of disorganisation in the hotel which wasn't there the first time we stayed. The hotel is currently having an extra wing added so there was a lot of construction work going on which made sitting by the pool less relaxing than it should have been. Luckily we couldn't hear it from our 18th floor room that much, but we could hear the lifts all night which was a bit of a pain. You would be best to ask for a room away from the lift area and high up enough not to be disturbed by the construction work. The all you can eat buffet breakfast was great again, S$20 if you book when you check in but S$35 if you try and arrange it after that. We weren't told that on check in so were charged the higher rate for the first morning but reception quickly changed that for us when we explained. The best thing about this hotel is the location. You're round the corner from Raffles hotel, 5 minutes from the MRT which is a really clean and easy (and cheap) way to get wherever you need to go in the city, and maybe 10 minutes walk from Clarke Quay where you can get a decent meal for around S$10 (the beer is a little more expensive than we're used to but that's not a bad thing in that heat!). It is also clean and as I say, however disorganised things seemed to be, the staff were always at least trying their hardest to help and very friendly which makes a big difference of course. Special thanks to Mr Razman and Sharul for their help - I hope I have spelt their names correctly. Would I stay there again? Yes, probably, once the construction work is complete when hopefully everything will return to the high standards we experienced on our first stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms and good for business”
Reviews.Author: ShutterbugTraveler
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about this hotel. The rooms were great, the staff went above and beyond to accommodate me on several occasions, the meeting rooms were great as was the food. Also it's very centrally located in Singapore. I could walk to most major attractions and it's across from Chjimes, a restaurant and entertainment complex that offered a lot of options. I suppose that the addition they are building would be a turn off for some because it mars the view, but I didn't hear construction from my room and I faced it. This is also right across from a very large mall and the famous Ruffles Hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ArfaD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton on a Singapore Stopover holiday en route to Australia. Having read previous reviews we did wonder what we were going to get but were very pleasantly surprised. We had book a limo to meet us at the airport and the driver was waiting for us witha placard with our names on. On arrival at the hotel it was really special to be greeted at the door by name - a nice touch. Although we arrived early in the morning our room was ready for us and we were to grab a couple of hours sleep before venturing out into the city. We took advantage of the reduced rates for food by using our stopover boarding cards and ate both breakfast and our evening meal there. The food was excellent and the service very good. We had booked a higher floor room and were on the 13th floor overlooking Raffles. There is building work goin on to extend the hotel but this was never a bother. Our room was a delight with king size bed, tea and coffe and bath robes. The hotel is very central for all the shopping malls and taxis if you explore further. They even provide umbrellas for you when it rains - and boy does it rain! All in all an excellent stay and we would recommend this hotel for anyone stopping over en-route.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ali34xxxx
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews. This is a wonderful and very classy hotel. We paid AUD$174 per night and it was a beautiful, large room with a great view (and free slippers!). The concierge, tour desk operator and reception staff were very helpful. Every staff members greets you when you walk past and they are all very friendly and helpful wih directions! The hotel is a 20 minute walk to Orchard Road and it's across the road from Raffles. The location was wonderful and the amenities were 5 star. The only downside is that they charge $1 per minute for internet (you can walk about 15 minutes to an internet place that charges $2 for 20 minutes (ask the concierge for directions). This should be a 5 star hotel (not 4). I would recommend this hotel and definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Traveler91
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, small and dirty and then a billing problem that was never straightened out and I finally gave up. I travel to Singapore quite often and thought I would give this hotel a try, but never again. There are many other hotels in Singapore that are much nicer and cost less.

Reviews.Title: “best location for the price”
Reviews.Author: lou_lou_in_hk
Reviews.Content: we needed a hotel in town and it has to be near a train station for convenience. this is the most decent we can find for slightly over SDG200. the rooms are clean with just right amount of space for 2 people. it's just opposite Chijmes, 5 minutes stroll from Raffles City, 10minutes from Bugis Junction, very convenient. the hotel staff were not the most efficient. slow check in despite it was not peak hour and no one else was checking-in at the same time. they also asked us for the same personal details we submitted over the internet. we then waited for about 10minutes for them to check if the room was available. i couldnt understand why and they couldnt explain to us either. when we check out, they claimed that the hotel was not paid for online via the american express that we booked with. we werent so sure, so we let them charge our visa card. when we received our bill, we realised they made a mistake - in the end, what they did was charged us on the american express before we checked-in, then charged us again on our visa upon check-out, then finally credit us the money back on our american express on the same day. at least they did correct the mistake without us having to write in or complain. lastly, the mattress was hard with palpable springs. we got backache after the second night. we were used to the softer ones. but then again, the pillows were lumpy and too high. overall, given the bad mattress and inefficient admin, i would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: ChristineLBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at the Carlton and couldn;t find anything to complain about. Staff were good in all departments. Room was always clean and so was the carpet (someone made a comment on here about it being dirty). Building going on outside our window was very interesting to watch and the noise was very minimal. We stayed in Room 1114 on the eleventh floor. This was our second stay at this hotel and would stay again as I could walk into Orchard Road (15 mins to Singapura Plaza) and to other shopping centres close by.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: prw70
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Carlton recently whilst attending a trade show. Upon check in was told that the rooms were not available yet and to be back by 2-3 pm . This was perfectly reasonable so left and returned at 3 pm to be told that the room was available. Asked for a smoking room and was told that none were available try again at 5 pm. It would have been helpful upon check in to be asked what type of room I required and thus they would know exactly what I wanted and what time for me to return. Instead I had a 5 hour wait for the room. Considering there were a large number of fellow delegates at the hotel and we are all in the travel trade it would have seemed sensible to provide excellent service so that we would choose the hotel to send our clients to Check out was much smoother. Housekeeping excellent.Room service were OK but it seems strange that they did not remove the used tray from the room ? Food was Ok and service was good . Concierge. Due to work committments had to alter my flights to return on an earlier flight. When asked I was told that only SQ were available.All other flights were full. I went online and checked and the information was inaccurate. If the concierge had done the research and checking that I had done then he would have been able to book a seat for me on the flight that I wanted . As he was unwilling to do so I was too late and missed booking the flight and had to choose another airline. I understand extremely well the way the commission system works. However if a request is made and it is possible to do then I would suggest in future to say yes it is possible but there will be a booking fee of 20-50 SGD . This is reasonable and most people would be happy to pay. It is a nice hotel , location is good the facilities are excellent however concierge services need to be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: controllerman
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 14 night holiday in Bali followd by 4 nights staying at the Carlton Hotel in Singapre. The check in was smooth and we upgraded to a Premier room without even asking. The room was clean with a nice bathroom and separate shower cubicle. Our only problem was that they took our bathrobes away after one night and never replaced dispite numerous requests to have them replaced. We also had an unwanted visitor in our bathroom in the shape of a cockroche. The location of the hotel couldnt be faulted we were just one block away from Raffles to which we spent a good few hours walking around the grounds and and the shops there. We also enjoyed a Singapore Sling in the long bar. We were also about a 10 minute walk away from Orchard Road with its many Shopping Malls and about a 10 minte walk from the Singapore Flyer, which is a must do the views around Singapore are amazing. We also did a trip to the night safari which was a good evening out. Plenty of Restaurants to eat at that range from fairly inexpensive to very expensive , in comparasion the prices are very similar to London. The Underground networks is very cheap, inexpensive, and clean (unlike London's). A great choice for a stopover if you like shopping , my wife said that there was far to many shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “A 4* hotel?”
Reviews.Author: yvette21
Reviews.Content: The experience of staying with the "4 star hotel" is kinda disappointed. Let's talk about the good points first. The counter staff are friendly and they offered us an upgrading of the room, and it is at 22nd floor, the view is fabulous that you can see the whole city from the window~ However when i stepped in the Deluxe room they upgraded for us, i am kinda disappointed. Though the room is very spacious and with a great view, the hardware in the room is so outdated. The toilet is small and without a separate shower-room, and the tv set is non-plasma. Worst of all, they do not provide free toothbrush and toothpaste! I bought it via housekeeping at SGD$1.50. And the room service is very slow. Well, I don't think it deserves a "4*" ranking.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by service levels”
Reviews.Author: mscah100
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on 15-17 Oct for a business training workshop. Hotel looked good upon arrival, great location, nice lobby and decor. However, I was immediately put off by the young lady who checked me in. I felt she treated my three colleagues and I like little children on a holiday by ourselves, instead of the business travellers that we actually were (despite us dressed in our work clothes). Also, I was made to feel like I was a burden to her, especially when I asked for a king bed (which I had already booked), but due to availability, was given a twin room. That would've been fine, only my colleague who then checked in after me got a king bedroom. I accept that this happens, but it doesn't help that the man who served my colleague was much nicer than the lady who served me. A few other things: We ordered room service the following night and the man who answered the phone sounded irritated and got our orders wrong. He also hung up the phone before we did, although we had already said that was all. I'm a firm believer that when you're on the phone to a client or customer, you should wait until they hang up as the last thing they want to hear is you slamming the phone down. We also went to the business centre to borrow their phone conferencing facilities, which unfortunately they had none. A few other details here and there, such as my getting a poorer quality bedroom with an empty minibar and fewer room facilities despite paying the same price as my colleagues, and other things which overall left me with a less than pleasant impression of what should've been a good stay at what I believe is a 4-star business hotel. I've stayed at the Pan Pacific at Marina Square, which is fabulous, but I can't believe that the difference in service levels between that and Carlton is huge. Also, immediately after checking out of Carlton, I checked into Furama City Centre where I would be staying for the weekend, just to see if it was common to find that service level among non-5-star hotels. Apparently, that's not the case (I've left a review for the other hotel as well). All in all, my colleagues and I weren't very thrilled with our stay. I'm sure not everyone had the same poor service that I did, but it was unfortunate that this experience has turned me off what should have been a good stay at a hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “good price for location and standard”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: we booked the 'mystery hotel' with wotif at S$168 a night which for a 4 star hotel is a great price we thought. room nicely renovated. there is construction noise on the adjoining wing (supposed to end Nov 08) so make sure your room is away from that. bed firm and good. we only stayed 14 hours as a stopover. aircon was good. more of a business hotel we suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Good Position But Expensive”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Carlton many times with business but its been a year so booked an over nighter for myself. $350 for a room with no breakfast to me is very expensive. But I paid it as was in town for GP Carlton is central for everything but the premium in price is not worth it. Far better off getting a cheaper hotel and using taxi. The place is nice and clean and runs 24 hrs with people comming and going all times of day and night. There is a new extension being built which I think will just push prices up even futher. No complaints its just a central business hotel good for a few days stop off. Band in bar could do with a change as Eric sings too many love ballads.

Reviews.Title: “kiran mumbai”
Reviews.Author: kiranMumbai
Reviews.Content: the hotel staff is very very rude mostly all the people at the reception it feels like they get thier home fustration to their work place .not a good sence for the tourist even the duty manger has no manners how to behave with the foreign tourist .it feels at the reception they are running a 2 star hotel. rooms are ok nothing intresting . bathroom looks old and the beds are not very comfy .there is a lot of waiting for a taxi outside the hotel . even my house swimming pool feel bigger then what they have . i would really not recomend this hotel to any one

Reviews.Title: “Very very average, rooms r dated(2star) but priced at 4star.”
Reviews.Author: Nirupama
Reviews.Content: Don't go to Carlton. Location is great, so instead select hotels in the same locality but with better rooms, ambience, more services & FINALLY lower rates than carlton. Try Inter-continental(cheaper by 100 S$ & amazing colonial atmospheric building), Allson (next door)..anything but don't waste your money on Carlton. Carlton has a stunning lobby to impress the visitor in the first go & good reception staff & concierge but the story ends there. You won't encounter technical problems but YOU DON"T GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! Firstly, rooms are pathetic....they have a cold look. The furniture...can you believe it...is cheap light wood with metal. Toiletries (lousy brandless shampoo, bath gel , moisturiser & jst a soap) Carpeting is soiled throughout the hotel & rooms. Though initially we overlooked...but now we wonder why can't they change the carpeting (a hotel doing such good business can afford it). It sucks to pay a 4* price & get a 2* ambience. I must mention that carlton has gr8 tie-ups with airlines & tour companies because of which it is always packed & this is perhaps the reason why they are successful with their mediocre infrastructure. The unsuspecting visitor hardly has much choice once he lands there & since one has enough to do at Singapore one usually chooses to overlook the inadequacies of the room. Look at our experience. We stayed for 7 days in end of Aug 2008 in a PREMIER ROOM on the 14th floor (on full tariff). Now what wud one expect from a premier room? {chek the pics] We were shocked at the mediocrity, but reconciled, thinking perhaps this is Singapore standard as this was our first visit. For seven days we didn't get a single complimentary bottle of water & even a newspaper. We thought maybe in S'pore hotels...it is not free. For 7-days we had the same Breakfast. The variety was extensive but honestly, the taste or cooking of the meals was very average. The oil used for making eggs seemed stale. The fruits were cut in huge pieces, the sausages were bland & i can go on. What excites you about the b/f on the first look, soon fails once you start to taste it...& every item remains same each & every day. Now Bath. Out shower cubicle door did not close, we didn't complain. The hair dryer was in the room secured inside the writing table drawer (so have a bath in the bathrom & come around the room to dry your hair!!) There wasn't even a sofa in the room. The curtains were dated. The bed was QUEEN & not very soft. The TV hardly had many channels...except for one eng music & CNN channel..rest were local..that too some hardly around 18 channels. There was an old coffee maker inside the TV cabinet without the complete set of tea-coffee-sugar sachets for the whole of seven days. Twice we ordered room service but the food didn't taste well. Not stale but the chefs just aren't gr8 cooks! On our 8th day we left for a Star-Cruise & first thing we found on our cruise room were 3 complimentary bottles of water (which were replenished each day). These are small things but it makes a difference. When we returned, for the last day we booked Holiday Inn Park View Hotel near orchard road in front Istana Palace. We just had a standard room there but the luxury it rendered totally won our hearts. {see pics & compare it with carlton's premier room} Everything at Holiday-Inn-Park View was top-class...from red-earth toiletries, numerous towels, Bath robes, slippers, polished cutlery, extensive mini-bar, complimentary water & tea-coffee maker & even the rich crockery. The bed was huge & luxurious. The carpeting was spotless & the furniture was classy & all-deep-wood. Curtains expensive & bath good-quality marble. And GUESS WHAT: the tariff was S$ 100 lesser. The next day, the breakfast too was amazing, not as extensive as Carlton but everything cooked well with 4 choices for coffee. Now we even more realised what we were deprived off in Carlton!! We were disgusted that we wasted 7-days at Carlton & called them & complained about the services. They then confirmed that they do give complimentary water & newspaper & regretted that we weren't given any. Imagine this is the amount of attention they give to the services..which they never bothered to check during our stay. They said they'll make up for it...but now? after giving us a shoddy room & cold stay for 7 days. The staff is not bad but the offerings are not WORTH YOUR PENNY. We found many hotels nearby, much better...so pick one from them because for the purpose of exploration of the colonial district, this location is very good. So, all the best. Wish you all an atmospheric & cozy, warm & luxurious stay in one of the many other hotels nearby. And check the pics - they speak for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: sjanes
Reviews.Content: We had booked a premier room but were upgraded upon arrival to a club room. The room was modern clean and spacious with a lovely large bathroom complete with walk in shower and seperate bath and plenty of thick towels. I have back problems but the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever experienced in a hotel. In spite of some nearby construction our stay was very quiet. Our rate included breakfast which included a buffet of pretty much every breakfast food you can think of from many different cultures. The quality of the room was high and the service very efficient. The hotel is well located a five minute walk from Raffles City where there is a shopping centre and an MRT station making it easy to get around Singapore. The thing that really made our stay was the service, all of the staff we dealt with were all very polite and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. On the day we left we had a night flight but the hotel minded our bags and allowed us to use the facilities in the health club to shower and change before we went to the airport. The concierge called us a taxi and told us it would be between "3 and 5 minutes" and sure enough 4 minutes later it arrived. The Carlton wasn't our first choice but I'm now we chose it and we had an excellent stay in affordable luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Chinese Restaurant Wah Lok”
Reviews.Author: lcttravel
Reviews.Content: Ate dim sum over the weekend at Wah Lok Restaurant (the chinese restaurant at Carlton Hotel). Food was nothing special, eaten better ones. Customer service wasn't that good. Asked the waitress to pull an extra chair, she just turn away and started looking without even acknowledging. I later asked her to fill up my cup of tea, she said ok and never come back. Again, her attitude was as if I'd pissed her off.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended....”
Reviews.Author: kdaot06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carlton 1 night as part of a 4 day tour in Singapore. We wish we could have stayed longer! It is convienently located and a walkable distance to many things to see and do. Upon arrival, the service was excellent! The staff was friendly and helpful. Our pick up time for our departing flight was earlier than the morning breakfast buffet. However, the front desk arranged for us to have pastries and coffee before our shuttle arrived for the airport. The pool was very nice and relaxing. There was some construction going on, but it wasn't too noisy. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to others staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: NaMakani
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Carlton just one night at the end of our Malaysia trip in May ‘08. We had spent a week in Singapore at the beginning of our trip, staying at the Grand Plaza Park City Hall a short distance away. The Carlton is more upscale, larger, and a bit more expensive, but it’s in a terrific location just across the street from the wonderful old Raffles Hotel and the Chimes Convent. The MRT and the high-rise Raffles Center are just across another street. All major sights in the historic district are within walking distance or accessible by MRT. Our room (1402) was not large but adequate in size. It was tastefully furnished in a modern style with light wood and brown fabrics. The beds were very comfortable, and the a.c. was quiet and effective. The room had floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall windows with a nice view of the city. Note, though, that the hotel is expanding and a new tower will block the view from some of the rooms. There was plenty of counter and storage space. The tiled bathroom was adequate sized with good counter space, and had a tub/shower combination. The bathroom could use an update, but was still fine. The front desk staff were helpful and efficient. Perhaps the only minor disappointment was that we were under the impression that the hotel offered shuttle service to the airport, but this turned out not to be the case anymore. It is necessary to take a taxi or the airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is just around the corner”
Reviews.Author: G0ingnow
Reviews.Content: Just name it...everything is just around the corner from Carlton Hotel. Well, not denying the fact that Singapore is a well planned city with great infrastructure and connectivity, the hotel is just across the street to the Cityhall MRT interchange, which give you the great accesiblity. It is also adjeacent to Raffles Hotel - a luxury hotel declared a National Monument in 1987, CHIJMES - a national heritage site, which is now a popular dining, shopping and entertainment site and many other places of interest. I was there for a conference at Suntec City Convention Centre, the hotel provides free shuttle bus/cab services to take us to the doorstep. In fact, SCCC is not that far away. I managed to walked back to the hotel after conference via the underground shopping mall linking Suntec and Cityhall interchange. Carlton is also 2 blocks away from the Singapore Art Museum. I managed to steal time from work to get a climpse of Xu Beihong's oil painting masterpieces including "Put Down Your Whip". "Put Down Your Whip" is a 1939 oil painting by Xu, which was sold for US$9.2 million in an auction in April 2007, setting a record for the highest price ever paid for a Chinese painting at an auction. The room is Carlton was clean and comfortable, although, they can do a lot better with a more modern initerior. During my stay, I understand that the hotel was undergoing refurbishment for the rooms. Nonetheless, the view from my room was magnificent. Overseeing tall buildings blending in with colonial architecture of old chapels and churches. The Marina and Singapore Flyer are both within sight. It was a wonderful sight and stay.

Reviews.Title: “needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: orson_y
Reviews.Content: i booked a couple of rooms for my guests. i was bothered that despite their phone confirmation a few days before the check in date the rooms requested was still unavailable on the actual check in day. as hotel prices has been skyrocketting like nobody's business in singapore, i assumed that they have upgraded their rooms. unfortunately i was mistaken. one of my guest's room had a problem with the toilet flush. when i visited them, i was surprised that these are the flush that are used in very old government housing estates - HDB apartments. older people will have trouble with this type of flush, because it just does not flush completely. fortunately, engineering seemed to fixed it after 2 sepearte tries. some stuff in the room also did not work - blow dryer was faulty, the minibar was barely cold. the amenities in the room is limited. they do not provide any complimentary drinking water nor do they provide any qtips or cotton balls in the toilet. the only amenities is a sewing kit and shampoo/soap set. they do not provide any toothbrush/toothpaste/mouthwash. they provide a single pair of slippers for a twin bedded room. and free coffee/tea making facilities in the room. as stated by other reviewers, there is a tiny gym and swimming pool. they have a unisex sauna and steamroom. the lobby only have 4 chairs for waiting guests. so it gets quite crowded when the airline crew from ethiad arrives or departs. i guess with the rise in prices, my expectation has also risen. unfortunately, the rise in prices was just that - a rise in price. no improvement in the existing facilities can or should be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in SGP”
Reviews.Author: Wolrdwide
Reviews.Content: I recently went on a business trip to SGP (stayed at the Fullerton) but spend the WE already in town on my own $$ and got a great deal at the Carlton. I really liked the hotel. The location is very central next to restaurants and not too far from the shopping district. My room was nice and spacious (bigger then the one I had at the Fullerton) in a simplistic Asian design, the bathroom was nothing special. The room had a little alcove with a brilliant view over the city. I choose a bay view (a couple of $$ more expensive), however, there is not really anything to see of the bay, so would not spend the money again. The hotel has a gym which is pretty small and not the prettiest, but if you are serious abt a work out it has all you need (some machines and free weights). The pool is not very big and on a concrete plateau (5 or 6th floor). It is ok to get some sun for 1 hr or so, but no place to lounge for longer. Breakfast was included in my rate and was buffet style offering from fresh fruits, cereals, eggs, dim sum etc. all you ever could asked for. The breakfast room was not the most inspiring room and was a bit like a bee hive, but afterall it is just breakfast. Overall, I would choose the place again. Location and rooms are good - while pool/gym are not brilliant they are usuable. The place does not have the luxury feeling of the Fullerton or Ritzcarlton and could benefit from some new carpets, but then it does not have their prices neither.

Reviews.Title: “CONFORTABLE & CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: janluis
Reviews.Content: I was there on a leisure trip and spend almost two weeks, we had a junior suite overlooking The Old Raffles just opposite the ancient convent now transformed in a gallery with restaurants and shop, perfect for dine out on terrases. The hotel is confortable, quiet and perfectly located just off the metro in central Singapore. Try the restaurant on top of the Swis hotel, it s worth the vue and the food.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and convenient in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jon1949
Reviews.Content: City centre, easy walking to Orchard Road shops and Marina Square. One block from Raffles. Clean and comfortable room; helpful desk staff. Used by Emirates airline staff so presumably they're as happy as I was!

Reviews.Title: “Rising prices”
Reviews.Author: sunsets1011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlton in April last year. I loved it there. The room was clean and spacious, and I found the cleaning and lobby staff very friendly and helpful. I may be heading to Singapore again this year and was surprised to see that prices at the Carlton have hiked considerably on last year's rates. I'm not so sure my room (in the old wing) or the main reception area and facililites would do justice to these new prices. I understand that the Carlton is making imrovements to the hotel, but surely the price hikes should be coming after these renovations etc are (mostly) complete.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Kmc-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and son stayed here the night before the inaugural A380 flight. Looking for a 'value for money' hotel, we came across the Carlton - even better - it was available with inclusive breakfast using Airmiles! I had a few reservations as I was not travelling myself so emailed the hotel prior to the visit and received excellent customer service even before their trip. Their comments were: Easy transfer from Changi airport with only one change on MRT, even in rush hour. The hotel had been advised about early arrival and had arranged early check-in as the hotel room was free - a real bonus after a 14 hour flight! The room on the 14th floor was clean, no evidence of 'smoke scent' either in rooms or corridors. Bathroom was quite basic but adequate. Lifts worked perfectly! View was really good - Swimming pool, Raffles City, St. Andrew's Church, Singapore skyine and could just make out the tip of the Flyer. Breakfast was good - a buffet that started at 6a.m. - management offered a 'take away' breakfast if this was not early enough. Reception organised a taxi back to the airport - S$35. Generally, they found the Carlton good value - it doesn't claim to be a 5* hotel, it is undergoing modernisation and a new wing is being built. The new wing will obscure some of the views though. As in many hotels we have visited, management are often keen to sort out problems if they are made aware of them before or during your stay - customer service was certainly good here!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cybercomp
Reviews.Content: Let's start with internet access at $27/day from a wired link in your room -- might be high for wireless access, but excessive for wired links in this high-tech city (of course, they're outsourcing the service to Malaysia, so who knows). Then, despite the service stating you'll have time remaining after checkout, you don't. The floors (at least in the "old" highrise) reek of smoke, and the beds are like boards (firm is fine, but these are something else again). If you get stuck here by your travel agent, like I did, avoid the rooms by the elevators, unless you really like the sounds from the shafts (26 floors) all night. International direct calls are problematic and spotty. The elevators are plagued by glitches. Certain ones keep forgetting floors entered and send you back to the lobby, and others take you to your floor and...don't open -- you have to press the "open door" key repeatedly and hope it happens before the elevator goes to another call. Then you can get to your door, 20+ flights up, and have your room key not work. Oh, and if you think being assigned to a crap room on a "Carlton Club" floor gets you into the Club, you're wrong. Unlike chains like Marriott, Sheraton, Hyatt, and even some better Holiday Inns, no such courtesies apply here. You'd be a fool to stay here, and I won't ever do so again. Management wanted to have a chat just *after* I'd checked out. Not exactly a helpful service. But at that point there's really not much to be done, anyway. Stay elsewhere and have a better time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable hotel, thats about it!!”
Reviews.Author: Rasasayang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early December 2007 enroute from London to Perth for 3 nights, and again en route from Sydney to London on 3rd January 2008 for 1 night. We had booked 3 nights with the airline agency on a bed and breakfast deal with an upgrade to a superior room as we were staying 3 nights. We checked in ok, got our upgrade to a superior room, floor 21. When the lift doors opened on the floor, we could smell cigerette smoke on the landing and the carpet was just awful, very old and stained, and this before we got to our room!! Our room was ok, nothing special to write home about, though we did have a good view. Apart from the view, we could not make out what was superior about this room. The bathroom was tired, needed updating and repainting but overall the room was ok. Next morning we went down to breakfast which was ok, however expensive at £25 for 2 people. The good thing about the hotel is the location, right next door to Raffles Hotel, which we loved. Also the hotel is opposite to a large resturant area called Chimes which we ate in, very nice and very good food and value for money, much cheaper than the Carlton Hotel. The pool area at Carlton was nice but nothing special. The reception area was busy most of the time and not a very attractive area. Conceirge were very helpful and also the staff outside who get taxis for you. We would stay at the Carlton Hotel again, if only for the location for Raffles and Clark Quay etc and the shopping areas, but its an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lousy tired bathroom”
Reviews.Author: ahmlaw
Reviews.Content: I only stayed in this hotel for a night, taking advantage of the Singapore Airlines Stopover promo. I was assigned room 1107. The beds were small (twin sized), the room size was average. It would have been ok except for the bathroom. The bathroom was OLD, with grime on the floor and counter. The bathtub is so high it is dangerous; you have to climb into it, and bathroom accidents can happen if you slip or trip climbing out of the tub. The room and bathroom both old and tired-looking. Perhaps if they renovated and modernized the rooms, it would be much better. The location though is perfect. I am in Singapore at least 4x a year, and I always stay in the City Hall area near Raffles City. It's a 2 minute walk to the MRT station and the Raffles City Mall, and right across Chjimes, which has several great eating places. Also, for those interested in electronics and computers, it is a 5-minute walk to Funan mall, one of the 2 main malls housing most computer and gadget shops. On the whole, it's ok for just an overnight stay. But there are much better hotels in Singapore for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A bad beginning turned in a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: RicardoMadeira
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at my room, I found the bathroom very dirty, and I really think that anyone had cleaned it since the last guest. That is unbelievable in any hotel, even more in Carlton! However, at the front desk I found an unusual and genuine availability of Ms. Erfina, that turned a bad beginning in a pleasant stay (moving me immediatly to another room)! Carlton must be very proud to have such an amazing helpful worker...

Reviews.Title: “Major update needed”
Reviews.Author: pungpui
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a Category C accommodation with Singapore Airlines Stopover package (highest category is E, lowest is A), so we expected a mid-range hotel. We had previously stayed at Furama RiverFront Singapore 3 years ago, which is Category A – so why it is that we had paid double the price this time for Category C and we got an experience comparable to a Category A? This hotel is in major need of an update. The rooms look and feel tired, especially the furnishings and finishings in the room and the bathroom. The location is relatively good, right across the road from the Raffles Hotel, Raffles City and is 2 blocks away from Suntec City. In the other direction 5 minutes walk takes you to the Le Meridien side of Orchard Road. Then 15 minutes in another direction takes you to Funan Digitalife Mall for all your IT needs. It sits on a busy road, so taxis are never a long wait. Right next door at the Raffles is also the Singapore Airlines Hop-on bus, provided for free to Singapore Airlines passengers taking the Stopover package. This stop caters for both the City loop and the Sentosa Island loop. I’m not too sure about the distance to the nearest MRT station, although I’m sure it’s no more than 5 minutes away. We were provided free transfers from Changi airport to the hotel in a mini-bus, and every hotel that we stopped at the bus could go into the hotel bay drop-off area. At Carlton the exit requires the vehicle to pass the carpark so the clearance for vehicles is very low. Thus we were dropped off on the street (a bus multi-lane road) with no porter facilities. First impressions were not good. The lobby itself is quite dark, and never enough lounge spaces for waiting. Though it seems there were a lots of Australians there, and the hotel always felt busy with people coming and going. There is an abundance of staff in the lobby, with always someone at least standing there waiting – be it bell staff, concierge staff, etc. On the right there is also a small souvenir store (don’t buy there, it’s expensive). Rooms feature a nice bay window area and very tall ceilings to facilitate better air conditioning (hot air rises). These are pretty much the only things positive about the room. It’s not that it was dirty, its just that the rooms need a major facelift. There is grout in the tiled bathroom. The toilet is difficult to flush, light switches feel dated, colour scheme is very bland, single beds were comparatively small, the cupboard smelt damp, the list really does go on. Also, outside the window, the view of the pool was clear: grout in the tiling down there. At least the bed sheets were clean and sleeping was relatively comfortable. What also annoyed me was a sign saying that if you require a refill of the complimentary tea bags, it will cost you $SG4. It’s just not something that you put in the hotel room - seems really stingy. Also, internet access will cost you $SG27 per 24 hours. That is also unreasonably high, especially when I’ve just stayed in a 3 star hotel in Tokyo who has provided it for free. In the bar downstairs, $SG8 for a cup of coffee or tea. $SG8???? Even the Raffles doesn’t even charge that much! I know for a fact (since I went there) Ah Dengs at Raffles costs $SG7.90 for Danish, tea/coffee and juice in the breakfast menu. A good thing about the Singapore Airlines stopover package is you get 50% off at Cafe Vic – the hotel’s 24 hour restaurant featuring buffet’s at most meal times. During our stay, buffet breakfast was $SG35++ and buffet dinner was $SG40++ – so we paid half of that per person. This made it an absolute bargain since dinner included crab soup, fresh seafood (prawns, oysters, Balmain bug, raw fish and sushi Japanese style), cooked foods (including mud crab, fish, pork spare ribs), salads and desserts (including Durian pudding, ice cream and a chocolate fountain). A chef can also freshly cooked you a prawn or bowl of noodles, and in the mornings you can get fresh eggs cooked to your liking, as well as Roti Prata, pancakes and waffles (though the chef didn’t know how to use the waffle machine and ended up breaking it). Service was relatively flat, where no-one smiles at you and what happened to letting the guest walk first? Numerous occasions where I had to stop with a plate of food in my hands while staff just walked passed. I’m also not impressed with the taxes and service charges hidden from the advertised price – makes it very deceptive! Would I recommend this hotel? If you are concerned about location, this hotel is excellent. But i could get the same hotel product elsewhere for much cheaper. Would I stay here again? Not really, for the point above. Singapore has very cheap taxis comparatively, it will cost you less than $SG10 from one end to another, so for me location is not that important. The product itself is much more important, and I did notice that the hotel is building a Premier Wing right next door to be completed in a few years time. Maybe after that is complete they will look at updating the hotel but until then, no thanks. If looking at the SIA Stopover package, look at the Traders Hotel, in the same category so same price and in a better, more prestigious location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: CJ_australia
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay here. Was very busy when we arrived so there was delay in getting our rooms ready. However the staff organised free drinks us for the delay. Hotel is not brand new, but facilities are still well kept. Gym is small. Pool is decent. No spa/jacuzzi... Location is ok. Plenty of dining and shopping nearby. Chimes restaurant and bar is opposite the road and is pretty good. Very good rates if you book through wotif.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad business hotel”
Reviews.Author: melbourneboys
Reviews.Content: Stay was enjoyable, for such a busy hotel the staff took care of most matters in a time your would expect for a 4 star plus hotel. The breakfast was not to bad either also allowing you to eat until 10.30am. Check in was reasonable fuss free, we had booked a premier room which really was not anything special, the bathroom was a little bigger with separate shower/bath, the room had been upgraded to also include an lcd tv, the premier wing sits in a separate building however you access through the main lifts and then across a small connector. The pool area was great but very quiet, and the hotel was located perfectly for access to MRT stations being right opposite raffles station and raffles plaza. Perhaps this hotel though would not be suited to families! it does have a business feel about it!. Be careful and check various websites for prices as we found great differences depending where you booked!.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lolabout
Reviews.Content: Wow we loved this hotel. We were a bit worried having read recent reviews but we didn't experience anything that wasn't perfect and we have stayed in a lot of hotels. Booked this hotel on Asiabest website and got a great rate including breakfast. Check in was smooth and quick we got our double premier room, non smoking, high floor, late checkout all as requested. The buffet breakfast had a huge range of food - much better than those that we have had in Australia. We ate breakfast every day at about 10am and then didn't need to eat again until dinner. The hotel was extremely quiet allowing us to sleep in every day. we couldn't even hear the construction of the new tower ( though I'm sure it would be noisier as the new building gets taller). Our room was adequate in size and very clean. The foyer of the hotel was large and the staff were very helpful. The pool area was lovely too. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel at all and will be back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Staying at”
Reviews.Author: adamandrew
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is outstanding - right in the centre of the city. It is situated across the road from Raffles Hotel, and adjacent to Raffles Plaza (a shopping mall to rival Orchard road). The proximity to Marina Bay, and Orchard road within 500m is also worth mentioning. The service the hotel provides was also above average for our stay. Whilst staying at the Carlton ensure to try the 'Bay Breezer' in the loby bar - it was very nice. Only two minor low points. The fittings and fixtures in the rooms are starting to show their age, however if that doesnt bother you it shouldnt be an issue. Also, if the buffet breakfast is not included with your package speak to the front desk prior to entering the restaurant for breakfast and ask them to give you a discount voucher - this will cut $10 pp off the bill. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Carlton and recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Deliza
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Carlton en route to Europe from New Zealand. On the whole we had a good stay, but there were one or two things that could be improved. First, the good things: An opulent lobby, friendly helpful staff, a good cafe in the hotel with a wonderful included breakfast (everything you could want) and excellent service, a nice pool. Not so good: We were 'upgraded' from a standard to a premier room, but it was quite ordinary really. Stained shabby carpet on other floors once you leave the lobby and in our room, shower door did not stay closed so floor got very wet (they 'fixed' it by replacing seal, but still didn't close). This hotel was for us the first of many in a ten-week period of travel in Europe and U.S.A. We don't let little things spoil an experience we have invested a lot of time and money in. All we required in Singapore was a convenient clean reasonably-priced place to base ourselves during a stopover. This hotel did the job ok, but we'd probably try a different one next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not much better than the Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingKiwi44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton on a brief overnight stopover from New Zealand to London. What I want most on a quick stop like this is somewhere quiet and clean, so we can have a decent sleep before the next leg. Unfortunately, the room we got was very noisy - possibly the air conditioning but when I tried to turn this off the room was still too noisy. Not sure why. I ended up trying to sleep wearing noise canceling headphones, but that was too much like being on a plane. The room wasn't too clean either - the rubbish bin hadn't been emptied and the bathroom hadn't been cleaned well. It was not a good night, and we got back on the plane exhausted. I should also mention the transfer van. It was packed to the point where I was crushed into a seat by the luggage and the driver, and at the first corner a hardshell suitcase crashed onto my leg. I had to hold it back for the rest of the journey, and was a bit worried about the larger luggage stack falling on me too. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor room allocation”
Reviews.Author: AlMcDonald
Reviews.Content: The problem, as with other reports was in the check in/smoking business. We arrived before 5pm for a pre-booked Singapore Stopover double room. Only to be offered a twin bed room. Naturally we asked if our request for a double could be honoured. And there insured a very long search, with the computer beeping miserably as the receptionist tried again and again to find us a double rooom. An "A" for effort then, but how can a large hotel be so fully occupied by late afternoon? At last she came up with a double. Unfortunately, as the room docket was printed, reading upside down I spotted the letters SQ as room type. And it dawned on me that I was being put in a Smoking Queen room. As a life long non-smoker I avoid the foul stench of tobacco whenever possible. So it was back to the original twin room, which I was assured was non-smoking. Of course, you can guess, it stank of cigarettes and so did the corridor. Perhaps it was the air-conditioning wafting the stink around, who knows. I suppose it was inevitable that if a hotel does not even realise they should establish your preference, then they are not going to be careful how the rooms smell. I see in an earlier response from the hotel that they think non-smoking should be on the booking, well sorry, but 80% of the world does not smoke, so it’s the smokers who should be making special arrangements. There would be nothing wrong with this hotel for the stopover market, if they would sort out their room allocation and odour problems. It has an excellent central position, adequate rooms and restaurant, live singers in the bar and cheaper and better Singapore Slings than Raffles next door. We heard no construction noise, despite facing the site, which did also bring a great view over Raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Swissotel on Stamford”
Reviews.Author: Subitravellers
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Carlton following a fantastic cruise on the Starship Virgo. What a let down! When we checked in we requested a non-smoking room and were told that would not be a problem. Proceeded to our room to find it was a smoking room. Returned to the Reception and explained we needed a non-smoking room. The Clerk appeared confused and finally assured us we could have another room that was non-smoking. Proceeded to that room to find the access cards did not work. Back to Reception where we were treated as if we were a nuisance, given new access cards but no apology. Then tried to upgrade (at our expense), more confusion before being told the Hotel was full and we could not upgrade. The room was spacious but very old fashioned. Stopper in the hand basin did not work so if you wanted water in the basin, you had to keep the water running. Taps in both the basin and bath leaked. The drain in the bath did not drain properly and when having a shower you ended up in water to your ankles. Tried to use the safe deposit in the room and the front panel fell off. Reported this to reception but it was never repaired. The bar fridge defrosted on its own with water everywhere. Sound on the television did not work along with the remote. Reported that to Reception and a repairman called. Played with the TV for some time and although it improved, it was still not satisfactory. Tried to use the keyboard for the Internet and found it had no batteries. Eventually had batteries delivered to the room but the keyboard still did not work so eventually gave up on the Internet. Buffet breakfast was very ordinary and staff were not cheerful or friendly. Definitely will not go back to the Carlton as it spoiled what up to then had been a fantastic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but stark, premier room; good breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: SydneyNik
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 2 nights in a Premier Room on a short stopover. The package we got online included the breakfast buffet which made it good value. Check in and checkout were efficient and fast, and on checkout the luggage storage system was problem free. The room was spacious, had all amenities, but i felt a bit sparsely decorated (maybe it was meant to be that way, but some colour, ANY colour would have been welcome!). The bathroom was great, separate bath/shower and very large. Room service was fine, and when we had problems with our tv, and engineer came up to fix the problem within 10 minutes of calling reception. Buffet breakfast was pretty good, all the usual continental, hot choices, asian choices, pastries, fruit, and also a 'fresh food station' where you can get eggs/omelettes made to order, as well as fresh pancakes/waffles. They are doing some construction work at the moment, building a second tower building - while we didn't hear any noise from our room, it did detract a bit when sitting in the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Just another mediocre 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LUXXX
Reviews.Content: Singapore is constantly running out of rooms at reasonable rates every other day or week. The scarcity of rooms has really caused room rates to skyrockete through the roof. At the time of my booking a month before my business meeting on mid October 2007, this was the only available hotel with rates averaging Sin$250 ++. The rates includes one breakfast and nothing else. Like the Merchant Court, there is no drinking water. Exorbitant charges for internet access. Rememberables are the great location, the clean room and generally amiable staff. The rooms currently has a view of the Marina that it will loose it once the second tower is constructed. The lack of basic in room amenities like drinking water and bathrobe pushes it into a 3 star cat. hotel. The excuse of Singapore tap water is safe to drink is just lame excuse to provide drinking water that becomes a standard in most 4 star hotels. Even more lame when the rates are averaging at 250++.

Reviews.Title: “The Fawlty Towers of Singapore...”
Reviews.Author: kateandross
Reviews.Content: We booked the Carlton through our travel agent as we thought it looked like a good solid 4 star hotel with a good location. How wrong we were.... (and from seeing some other more recent posts, we're not the only ones) When we arrived early (around 8am) on 31st Oct we were told that a room wouldn't be available for check in for a couple of hours. That was fine, but when we were checked in we were put in a smoking twin bed room at the arse end of the hotel. As we had requested a non-smoking king room, we went back to reception and said the room wasn't acceptable (it was really disgusting, as it reeked of stale cigarette smoke). We were then told that our type of room wouldn't be available until around the 2pm check in time, but we could remain in the smoking room til then. As we'd caught the red eye out of the Maldives, we were knackered, so we collapsed in the stinky smokers room for a few hours, as we had no energy to go shopping (which was the hotel reception's standard suggestion for killing time). After going back to reception at 2.30pm we were told that our room was still not available as the previous guests hadn't checked out, but should be available in a couple of hours after it had been changed over. So off we went for a while. When we returned to the hotel at 6pm, we thought surely we'd be able to check in now, but no, on rocking up to reception, we were told once again, that our room still wasn't available. At this point we were ropable as we'd been waiting 10 hours for our check in, and after having to call a supervisor and explain our dissatisfaction we were finally checked in. This wasn't a great start to our 7 day stay and certainly tainted our view of the hotel, but over the following days we did observe quite a few other frazzled guests who seemed to be having similar problems to ours. Breakfast was always an utterly chaotic experience, as the illusion was given of self-service, but when you did, you were bustled to another table, or stopped from helping yourself. The day before we left we asked for our bill and a 5am wake up call as our transfer pick up was at 6.30am and we wanted a good hour to organise our bags and then 30mins for breakfast. The wake up call never came, but fortunately we woke up at 5.55am and raced around gathering our things together before a very rushed 10min brekky. Having stayed ina range of other accommodation across the world, we rate the Carlton as a joke. It certainly doesn't offer 4 star service, and its staff seemed inadequately trained with some bizarre management systems in place that simply hinder their ability to provide good quality hospitality and service. With so many other hotels available in Singapore, we'd suggest you give this one a wide berth - even if you think you've got a great deal on the room rate. It's not worth the hassle to your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mken1234
Reviews.Content: Check in/out services are comparitively slower than say, Marriott Hotel. Otherwise, this is a reasonable to good hotel to stay for a few days. There is a cheaper hotel across the road, Allson Hotel, which is only $25 to $40 cheaper than Carlton. But with Carlton Hotel, you will not be charged for requesting extra tea bags or coffee. The complementary breakfast is really good with variety of choices. The complementary first 24 hrs broadband internet is very fast. And the premium room is hugh with separate bath tub ( asian size only )and shower room. There were also Iron Board and Iron in the room. For all these( Online promotional package), i only pay $30.00 more than the standard room of Allson hotel. Above all, the room is clean and the staffs we met were friendly and eager to help. Will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Keith_KL
Reviews.Content: As I stay in KL i goto singapore a bit for work. The Carlton for me has to be (cost considerations) one of the best hotels due to it's location with rafflels shopping centre, suntec city, Chijmes, and other places. The rooms are professional neat & tidy nothing special as they say hard to like but hard to dislike also. The food is pretty basic, but being next to Chijmes you will find yourself rarely eating in the hotel anyway. The service is Singaporean, polite but with a bit of "I'm right" generally good. You get alot of airline staff staying here also if that means anything to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A good start to our Far East tour”
Reviews.Author: Portuguesemanowar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton on the first of a five leg tour of the Far East. On arrival we were courteously greeted by the doorman and shown to the check-in desk. The check-in was fast and efficient and the queries we had reference our booking were quickly resolved, these were mainly to with the number of breakfasts we were entitled to. Our room was pleasant enough, a large double bed and a roll away which didn’t appear to take up that much space. It was fairly minimalist in appearance at first glance but everything you needed could be found hidden in a drawer somewhere. The bathroom was large and nicely decorated. The staff were to a man/woman extremely pleasant and helpful, and were always on hand with suggestions with what to do. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide selection available, my advice would be to get breakfast in with your room price on booking as the rates were quite pricey if you paid as you dined. The foyer area was lovely and always a hub of activity, given the location of the bar just off the main foyer, this won’t be to everybody’s taste. The only disappointments with the Carlton were the pool area and the view from some of the rooms. Due to the high rise in the area, the pool does not get much sunshine. The pool area itself is in need of updating, and the surrounds become very slippery when wet as our 9 year old found out to his cost on his first visit. The fitness suite could also do with updating and enlarging. The higher floors also have views that won’t be pleasing unless you like looking at industrial sized air conditioning units, this won’t be a problem for the lower rooms. The Carlton has a great location 5 mins from Raffles, 5mins from nearest MRT (City Hall) and just opposite the Chijmes bar and restaurant. As a cheaper alternative for dining there is an excellent food court just next to the Allson Hotel again about 3-5 mins from the Carlton. Internet is available via the Business centre at 1 SGD per minute for a fast connection and 0.65 per minute for a slower but perfectly adequate service. All in all we enjoyed the Carlton, the pool area just needs sorting out.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton back in 1999. Did not have such a great experience then, when it was rather dumpy..Since then, have been reading a lot of great reviews on Tripadvisor and wanted to see what was going on. The hotel has definitely upgraded its facilities. The ground floor looks much more elegant than my last visit. The carpeting on my floor had a much brighter and friendly design than the gloomy dark carpeting I can remember. The room was pretty big but rather basic. The bathroom was huge and had a separate shower stall. Still, I was disappointed, considering I checked in early, that I wasn't given a room with a better view. The room was in the back, facing Victoria Street, and Singapore Management University. From time to time, I have stayed at hotels for the 1st time and front desk clearly wanted to impress me by giving me a room with a fantastic view or elegant amenities. I didn't feel staff at the Carlton wanted to impress me. It was like give me the worst room they had at the time. The rate I was paying wasn't cheap at all, US240 for the night I was spending (which was less than 12 hours since I was checking out in the early morning, 3 am), which is considerably more than you would pay at the name-brand hotels like the Conrad and Pan Pacific. If I was paying so much at the Carlton, naturally I expect better. It was reassuring to find that the taxi I ask them to book for me was waiting there when I checked out, too many times I have booked a taxi at a hotel only to find they have no record of it, so credit the Carlton for being organized. Ordered room service and was delivered in less than 30 mins despite the fact that a big party by SMU was taking place on the 2nd floor. But portions were rather skimpy and the meal didn't come with a glass of water. Usually, even if you don't order a drink, they give you water. The Carlton is a good hotel, I just came away with the feeling that unless you are a repeat guest, they don't go out of their way to make you feel special. Maybe I need to stay here 4 or 5 times before they would impress me. But there are so many good hotels in Singapore that if you don't feel you're getting great service, there is no reason to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loop5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights with our 1 year old in a premier room booked through the hotel website. Even though we arrived at 2AM the staff were friendly and efficient. Throughout our stay we were always greeted by the staff and they genuinely appeared cheerful. The room was spacious and very clean, nice sized bathroom with seperate bath and shower. The outdoor pool area is also very nice with a seperate kids pool. We never ate at the hotel as it was room only and the are loads of places to eat nearby. The Raffles plaza has 2 food courts and is just a couple of minutes walk away. The MRT is also here as well as an undergound shopping mall that links up the the marina complex just opposite Suntec City. As the Raffles hotel was next door we decided to have breakfast at the bakery there, what a disappointment!! Everywhere else we had fantastic service but here the woman behind the counter shouted across the room to tell me my toast was ready and she was doing nothing! All up this is an excellent hotel in a great location. The only minor point is they are building a new bit to the hotel next door but this never caused us any inconvenience. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bibster2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and we have to say that this hotel is up to a 4.5 standard in Singapore. The location is great and the staff are great starting from the entrance of the hotel......Our check-in was a breeze. It's so centrally located to all the shopping centres, MRT and restaurants. There is CHIME opposite the hotel where you can relax, have a glass of wine/beer and be entertained by talented musicians who played there. It's about 15 mins walk to Orchard but CIty Hall MRT is just across the road. We are heading back to SIN again this Dec and will I stay there again? Definitely, only if I can get a room......

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: katmandou
Reviews.Content: At the time of check in, we were told that we were upgraded in the top floor. We had an excellent view on the Raffles and the business district. But slowly few disappointments arose. Bed was small and pillows very hard. Housekeeping did not change our dustbin for two days; we had to beg for some toilet paper, one bed [--] and a newspaper; staff was not smiley and pleasant; swimming pool was dirty. The breakfast was good but way too expensive for children. Location is good. Not very far from MRT, 10mn walk to clay Overall, the hotel is overpriced for the service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and Happy Carlton”
Reviews.Author: kenwnz
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to The Carlton on a Singapore Airways Stopover deal from New Zealand to England and return with my wife. Found all the staff very happy, friendly and eager to help - and one or two helped to make our trip more memorable by going that extra mile. The room was standard top hotel and very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: karching
Reviews.Content: My husband, toddler and I stayed here for a singapore stopover on the way back from Italy. We arrived at 8 in the morning and to my suprise got checked in straight away which was a plus for us as we endured a sleepless overnight trip on the plane. All the staff were very attentive and helpful. They gave us a room which was situated on the 22nd floor with fabulous floor to ceiling views of the city. The room was very large. The bathroom was stunning. The Carlton provided us with every amenity needed. I was extremely impressed with this hotel, and I am very fussy. Next time visiting Singapore I will not hesitate to look anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times because they gave corporate rates to my previous company. Location is excellent. Relatively easy to get taxis compared to many other hotels. Staff are so-so Breakfast very average Rooms are clean but central aircond tend to be quite cold After staying here a few times, they upgraded me to the club rooms. Club rooms are very similar to ordinary rooms except you get an ironing board and iron. Overall, a reasonable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good rooms”
Reviews.Author: beachwalkers
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in this very good hotel. The rooms are very big and we had a lovely view. The air conditioner is very cold ( bit too cold) and the rooms are very clean and serviced very well. It has a great location near to the heart of the city. Very nice breakfast and a lovely foyer. Do not use the internet at the hotel- costs $1 per second so very pricey!!- some of the cafes up town have a free service.

Reviews.Title: “The Club room that wasn't....”
Reviews.Author: sasanqua
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on way home from Europe. We chose it specifically for the Club rooms which are on the highest floors (21-26) as a city view at night was what we were after. Alas, we arrived and without explanation, were assigned two rooms on the 16th floor. On querying this, we were told that the Club rooms were full, despite the fact that we had confirmed bookings made 2 months previously. We were upgraded to Premier Club rooms, which looked pretty average to us and with a blank view of the Singapore Management Uni building ensuring that we had no view whatsoever. Very, very disappointing. As well, the staff at ground floor reception did not acknowledge our presence straight away at check in, preferring to chat and type away on their keyboards. Jug took 15 minutes to boil, although it did have a 'stay warm' feature. Towels were well-worn, and there was a drink can in the pool. Little things add up and our overall impression was that the Carlton is a bit of a pretender. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS”
Reviews.Author: Minique
Reviews.Content: I love Singapore and I love shopping and when you stay at the Carlton Hotel you are well placed to enjoy both. The Carlton Hotel is in a great location... so many of Sigapore's must-see destinations are withing easy walking distance (and I hate walking too much or too far!) - the fabulously colonial Raffles Hotel is just a 2 minute stroll away, Arab Street and Little India a little further - the temples, the best shopping like Bugis and Orchard Rd are all a stroll away. The Hotel itself is just great - what can I say? You enter and it's cool and marbely! :) There are always enough staff on duty to deal with the number of guests - so if you find yourself behind a group of 20 Japanese tourists who are checking in - as if by magic extra staff will appear. The room I stayed in had a great view - then again both sides of the building have. Cleanliness is my no. 1 priority when staying in hotels and the Carlton is spotless - the building is relatively new and the rooms smell lovely...not musty as some hotels in humid climates sometimes can The rooms are also well insulated - you know how it is when you're in Asia - sometimes you hear your neighbouring guests and they're not always quiet... next thing you know the telly is turned on, the kids jump on beds and you get no sleep.
