Not so at the Carlton - it's just great and quiet with just the subtle hum of the a/c. Negatively I will say that they always seemed to have many guests loitering in the lobby. I fund myself in this 'loitering' predicament too on my last day as I waited for my airport pick up - what I would suggest is that they create more seating in the lobby for those who are waiting to be collected on tours or by taxis to wait - the way it is now just looks untidy... All 5 star hotels are pretty much the same arent' they? All snapped out of the same mould it seems - but what sets each one apart is the quality of their staff. I loved the relaxed and friendly atmosphere here and the staff were very sincere in their greetings and chats. The poolside barman dried glasses and had a relaxed chat with me - no phoney American 'have a nice day!' here... I used to stay at the Allson Hotel every time I came through Singapore and it's by chance that I ended up at the Carlton due to the Allson being fully booked - however from now on I will always choose the Carlton and ensure I book well in advace. P.S. The kettle at the Carlton is a buggah to operate! There's another negative...but as you can see, I am really scratching the bottom of the barrel!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Gblyn
Reviews.Content: The first stop of our month holiday, our triple room was fine. The location was fine - a good walk from the main shopping street, but also found a few shopping malls a bit closer. Hotel bar is quite expensive, although ambience is very nice (apart from the fact that it is very hard to find an area away from smokers - an issue all over Europe/London also), but there are other options close by. I was also a little surprised by the increase in the cost you think you are paying, once the taxes are added on. I would probably try somewhere else next time, although I didn't have any real complaints about the Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Birmandt
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Carlton for several nights while in Singapore. We booked a Carlton club room via their website several months before our holiday for a very competetive price. The Club rooms are situated from the 21st-26th floors of the hotel and have the most incredible views! The rooms themselves are modern, spacious and very comfortable. We could utilise the Club facilities on the 26th floor, including breakfast and complimentary drinks and 'nibbles' every evening from 6-8pm, both of which we can highly recommended! Likewise, our check-in and check-out was all done via the Carlton Club and was efficient and personal. The hotel itself is beautiful with friendly and helpful staff. The lobby area is cool and welcoming after the heat of Singapore! It is very close to several major shopping malls, such as Raffles Plaza, Bugis Junction and Suntec City and surrounded by a multitude of restaurants. Across the road is the famous Raffles Hotel and while we didn't sample the Singapore Sling we did partake in the lunch and afternoon tea sets in the Empire Tearooms and both were delicious! We cannot speak highly enough of the Carlton Hotel and it's staff and will definitely be staying there again on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Auswi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton May 07 - fantastic hotel - wonderful staff who couldn't do enough for us - especially concierge Radim. Location great -walking distance to most places. Room on 13th floor spacious and a great view of Singapore. Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NobbyWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for 3 nights from 28th March 2007. I booked directly with the hotel via their internet site and received a heavy discount on the rack rate. The hotel is perfectly located. Not too close to Orchard Rd to be crowded by shoppers every time you step out of the door, but still close enough to a tube station to reach other areas. As with some of the other reviews we did have an initial problem with the room. I had booked a double bed and a further single bed for my 9 yr old son, but was told on checking in that there were only twin bedded rooms available. I politely insisted on a double room and with no fuss was upgraded to a double in the new block. Unlike some other reviews I found all of the staff to be very polite. The concierge were particularly helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ayumi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton for three nights and it was PERFECT to say the least.. Staff are friendly, Checking in was abit slow but bearable. Price was reasonable and food was fantastic. Although we stayed on the 9th floor the view was ok. What i really loved abt it was the fact that we were always welcomed with a smile. Staff helped us look for places to eat. Location is perfect. A stone's throw away from Raffles City. Would most definately be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jemmie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton for 3 nights on our return home from Australia. Our room was on the 16th floor and was large and comfortable. The view was fabulous overlooking Raffles Hotel and out to the harbour. The staff were very helpful and we had no problems with check in, all done quickly. The bell boys will not allow you to carry any bags, be they suitcases or your shopping. The hotel lobby bar although not huge is comfortable and there is live music every night, they are not too bad. The restaurant is large and clean. Good variety of breakfast fayre. I made use of the hotel laundry service which was quick and the clothes return in good condition. The service was not expensive. The hotel pool is very nice with a pool bar and showers. Towels provided. Sunbeds always available. The hotel is well situated with Raffles Hotel next door. Well worth a visit. We had dinner there which was excellent. I loved the singapore slings. The hotel is close to the big shopping malls at the harbour and also for Orchard Road which is a continuation of Bras Basah Road and has hundreds of shops! No shortage of shops in Singapore, good news if you are a shopaholic!! We were given a 4pm check out without having to ask which was great as we were'nt flying out until midnight. The hotel will get you a taxi to the airport for 15 singapore dollars, we in fact only paid 12.90. Good price as it's a fair distance to the airport. All in all I was more than happy with the hotel, good value for money. Would recommend it and would stay there again if I return to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: GeordiesfromNE
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night on our way to Australia. Staff very helpful. Loads of choice for breakfast. Pool fantastic and never too busy. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great overall”
Reviews.Author: manilatraveller
Reviews.Content: On a scale of 1-10 (10 highest), I would rate our 4 days 3 nights stay at Carlton Hotel at 8. Good: - Great buffet selection! - Loved the live band playing at the lobby at night - Great location Bad: - It takes a loooooong time to check in and check out. Although there were 8 of us in the group, our travel agent has already done pre-booking, so I didn't understand why it took so long for the receptionist to arrange the room assignment/ keys etc. Must be the computer system the hotel was using! - Basic bathroom amenities like toothbrush, slippers are not free. I'm not sure if this is because of the price deal we got from the travel agent. Still it seemed weird. Bottomline is, this is a great hotel at a great price for families!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Happytiler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Carlton on business. Very good location with City Hall MRT a stone's throw away and plenty of restaurants around. Room was comfortable and clean. Buffet breakfast was the only minus point - there are better around but I guess you get what you pay for. Very busy in the lobby area but never any problem getting taxis. Overall I would say a good hotel especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Donegaltourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton one night on our way to New Zealand. My husband and I wished that we'd had a few days here as we were very impressed with the hotel. The reception staff were friendly, the foyer was lovely and our room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was the only thing that needed updated - the tiles were grubby. Our rate didn't include breakfast so not sure what the food is like. Ate at one of the many food halls instead. There was a lovely area for sunbathing by the pool on the roof of the hotel with free iced drinking water for guests. We had to check out at 12.00 so we were told where we could have a shower to freshen up before continuing on our travels. It would melt you in Singapore - humidity is something else! The Carlton is close to Raffles Hotel where everyone goes for a "Singapore Sling" - overated and overpriced if you ask me - couldn't taste any alcohol off the cocktail. The hotel is very convenient to the shops on Orchard road and is opposite Chijmes. Ate at the Brazilian Carnivore restaurant in Chijmes - go before 7.00 pm for the early bird menu - my husband thought that the meat was gorgeous. I'm a vegetarian so I stuck to the salad buffet and they made me a pasta dish. Another good restaurant is the Pasta Fresca on Boat Quay (avoid running the gauntlet by walking to the restaurant from the opposite end as you'll be tortured by other waiters/waitresses trying to entice you into their restaurants). The Indian next to the Italian is also good. Singapore is veeeeery busy and is one big shopping mall. Ok for a few days but wouldn't stay longer than 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!”
Reviews.Author: jackson_abby
Reviews.Content: This carlton is a fantastic hotel, its in a great location. There is a great atmosphere in the lobby lounge and its a great place to meet people. Also found it grest value for money as it has a bar happy hour in the evenings. The hotel is beautifully furnished, the staff here cant do enough for you and the service of a high standard! Will return there everytime i visit singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Situation”
Reviews.Author: Sybilsybil
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned after 3 nights( then a break of 4 weeks whilst in New Zealand)followed by another5 nights at the Carlton. We would have no hesitation in recommending the Carlton. We had excellent service from everyone from the doorman to the manager...We were on the 6th. floor and had an excellent view over the City (if one could afford an upgrade to the upper rooms one had access to the Carlton Club on the top floor I had the priviledge to gain access and it is wonderful with spectacular views) Our bedroom was immaculate the bed was changed daily. The dining rooms all served very good food. Cafe Vic open 24hrs. daily was where there was a wonderful buffet breakfast, as a wheelchair user it was not easy to actually serve myself however the staff were always on hand promptly and gave any assistance needed. The staff were always helpful at all times. The cleanliness could not have been better. The swimming pool area was lovely with nice tucked away areas where one could sunbathe at any time ( especially helpful in the afternoon heat )Altogether an excelent Hotel for anyone especially if shopping is your main aim...and who could visit Singapore without spending in these malls which were all within walking distance!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: gulfstream3
Reviews.Content: the carlton hotel would have to be one of the best mid range hotels in singapore for freindly and helpful staff, location, rooms and excellent facilities, would not hesitate to stay here again. 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service & Old Room”
Reviews.Author: Bryantay
Reviews.Content: 1st, the room was very old, one of the night lamps was fused, the boiled water from the kettle produced pungent smell & taste (staff commented that previous guest cooked mee in the kettle), it was quite a turn-off for my spouse & I stayed out the whole day shopping. The duty manager only get back to us once saying he will check it out but didn't get back to us on the outcome again. 2nd, the room service took 1hr plus to deliver our food, we called to check & the person juz said she will check it out but didn't get back to us on the status, we continued waiting until the food finally arrived. 3rd, upon check-out, one of the male staff was rude to us, in a way he told us to proceed to the cashier in a unprofessional manner to settle our payment, it took 5 mins before someone attended to us. He was there standing doing nothing. My god. 4th, only the breakfast was spendid & no fault abt. it. We will nt go back to the hotel to stay again giving the service & standards of a well-established 4 Star Hotel, but we will definitely go back to dine.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: neilmadhvani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlton for one night and think that the hotel offers excellent value for money. The location is ideal (opposite Raffles City) and just a few minutes walk to City Hall MRT. Suntec City isn't far either - around 7-10 minutes walk. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean, though the shower could do with an upgrade - not as good as in some other 4* hotels I have come across. The breakfast buffet is excellent - plenty of variety and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful too. I was well catered for as a vegetarian. The service at front desk was also extremely good. I didn't get a chance to try out any of the other facilities in the hotel so I can't comment on those. I'd definitely recommend the Carlton - a very pleasant and comfortable hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Central Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Lestel
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed for one night at the Carlton on route for a holiday in Phuket. We were recommended to stay here by our travel agent and we were pleased with the choice. As it was a holiday to celebrate our wedding anniversary the hotel gave us an upgrade to a deluxe room which meant we were on one of the upper floors. It was comfortable and well presented with great views over central Singapore. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful - very impressive. As we were only there for one evening we were happy that we could walk around the city easily and it's close proximity to Raffles hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Realistic_Oz
Reviews.Content: On the advice of our travel agent we booked at the Carlton for our 4 night stay to open our honeymoon. We were immediately impressed by the quality of the hotel and the impressive service. As a predominantly business-oriented hotel, the staff and systems were very efficient and used to high volume of travellers. Apart from groups of school kids on tours, we were likely the youngest guests in our mid-20's, but as we were there to experience Singapore and not just the hotel, this was fine. The best aspect of this hotel was undoubtedly the location. In the Colonial District/Quays area we found ourselves in close proximity to MRT stations for multiple 'coloured lines'. Keen walkers as we were we were also able to foot it to CHinatown, Orchard Road Shopping Precinct, Little India, Bugis Junction, the Quays and Merlion and many more. With the Raffles Hotel across the street there was plenty of tourist traffic in the area, meaning excellent staff and store English. The buffet breakfast spread was impressive (and regularly over-indulged in this regard). A nice pool which wasn't too busy and and onsight gym were other nice features. Room size was ample for visitors keen to explore the outside world. We would highly recommend this hotel for the short-term visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: dusty_piano
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore from Bangkok and only expected to stay one night (which turned into two). The hotel was very accommodating with adding the extra night at the same price it was booked online. They added an extra bed (because there were three of us) and it was setup before we could get to the room from the lobby. The rooms were clean and neat. The staff was friendly and helpful with places to party eat and party! Next summer when we are back this is were we are gonna stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggedtony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton for 1 night on Christmas day. Overall was very pleased with my stay there. Check in/out was swift and polite, room was quite large considering only booked the most basic room, breakfast was also excellent. The hotel has a great location right near to Raffles and all attractions are within easy reach. For the price I paid I was very impressed with the Carlton and would not hesitate to stay there again on future visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything!!”
Reviews.Author: VivaRobVegas
Reviews.Content: Whilst being predominantly aimed at business clientele and therefore possibly overlooked by tourists, the Carlton's exceptional location and proximity to points of interest plus very reasonable room rates should make this one of Singapore's standouts. The rooms are a generous size, well appointed and furnished in light tones with blond wood timber finishes. The massive foyer area includes a lobby shop, lounge bar and a restaurant/cafe with a huge outdoor terrace where each morning's excellent buffet breakfast is served. The location, on the next block from Raffles Hotel, is the highlight - City Hall MRT station is just around the corner meaning access to the rest of Singapore is a breeze. Despite the impression I had from reading maps before my trip that Chinatown, Little India, the Arab Quarter and Clarke & Boat Quays were a decent distance away, they were in fact within easy walking distance. Orchard Road is also within walking distance, however, consider the MRT if you have several shopping bags in tow! My only complaint (and it's small) was that despite the abundance of staff servicing the breakfast area, getting them to attend to the tables to re-fill coffee etc took a lot longer than it should have. Otherwise, I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for very comfortable and reasonably priced accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Family99
Reviews.Content: The Carlton is located in an excellent position. It is across the road from Raffles and the Raffles City shopping centre, is close to the MRT and Suntect shopping and business area. We stayed with our three year old in a Premier Room. Our room had a King Size bed and plenty of space. The bathroom contained a bath and separate shower and was finished to a high standard. The food at The Carlton is excellent. Our buffet breakfast provided numerous choices and the food was constantly replaced. We had room service for dinner for two nights (easier with a young one in tow!) and sampled the local cuisine available on the menu. This was excellent. It was efficient and exceeded our expectations. The swimming pool area is great and there is a paddle pool for little ones. Check in and out is efficient. We asked for a late check out and we were granted one without a problem. We will stay here again on our next visit to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: manutd1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night after being in Australia for 3 weeks. This hotel is 1st class, couldn't fault it in any way. Great location with Raffles Hotel just across the road. bars and shops on your doorstep as well. The staff were great, breakfast was really good and i am fussy, would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Could'nt fault it”
Reviews.Author: georgieboy
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9am and were given a voucher for a complimentary cup of tea or coffee and were told to come back in an hour. At 10am our room was ready, on the 7th floor overlooking Raffles Hotel, and the swimming pool, room clean and well serviced. Buffet breakfast excellent. Staff very helpful and friendly, booked our trips to The Night Safari and Sentosa in the hotel. It is very well located for shopping and we walked down to Clarke Quay which took about 15 mins to take a boat trip. Only 15-20 mins from the airport in a taxi which cost S$17.90 from the airport and S$24.90 back as we left before 6am and there was a surcharge. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: princessvixen
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel about 8.30 after a long journey from london.Asked for an early check in-they asked us to come back in an hour.Got a voucher for some free drinks for the wait.Had some brekki and was able to check into room by 10am. The room(superior)was enormous!2 king size single beds,fully stocked mini bar,huge wardrobe,tv and chairs and a table that had an amazing view of the city.Bathroom was well stocked and everything was spotless and clean.Went up to pool area the next afternoon-this is simple gorgeous!The music was rather loud and full of expletives which amazed me for a 5 star hotel but the service was quick and towels were provided.Room service were quick and when we needed tea/coffee or extra pillows they were quick and had them brought to us asap.The doorman too needs a special mention.my freind and I were forever asking him for cabs and directions to surrounding area's.Nothing was too much trouble.Overall I a very satisfying experience and will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAbroad
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed a couple of nights at the Carlton and had a great experience. Lovely room, bathroom a little outdated but clean, friendly staff throughout the hotel, great breakfast and lunch buffets and a comfortbale lounge bar with nightly music. After arriving from Europe at 6am I was promptly checked in which was a surprise that enabled a few hours sleep before seeing the sights. It seems clear from the range of reviews on this site that there is obviously a huge difference between the renovated and unrenovated rooms so I suggest asking for a renovated Deluxe room which was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: KIWIKEITH
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two day stop over in Singapore .If you have booked this hotel for a few days don't worry it is ok for a short stop over.We were so busy in Singapore we only hit the bed at 1.00am and up again at 8.00am and on the go.Singapore is a great place and has plenty to do and see to keep you busy for a week. I booked this hotel on what reviews were available back in Febuary. At that time the hotel was about 18 th on Trip Advisor and looked like a good deal for the cost,but I can see why it is slipping to an all time low. I too found many of the problems with staff and poor maintenance and house keeping. First off we arrived early evening and after requesting a non -smoking room back in Febuary was told that there were no non smoking rooms avaliable. I protested to no avail and was told if I was not happy with the room they would get house keeping to fumigate the room in the morning. We were in a hurry to get settled and go off to the Night Zoo(over rated ) we did not argue.The smell of smoke hit us as soon as we got out of the lift and yes the carpets looked stained from the constant cleaning. Our room was not too bad for smell so we went no further as we had better things to do than mess around changing rooms.I have to say the following night I got better treatment from the woman on reception and was given a 4hour late check out at no charge and without any fuss.Check in and check out was quite quick .Breakfast was what we expected plenty of choice with fresh pancakes and omelets . Yes the tea & coffee was a bit slow in coming yet they had a diningroom supervisor standing watching everyone but did nothing himself ??Yes it is handy to all the shopping but so too are twenty other hotels and with cabs only costing $7 to go most places (Zoo $20 )If you are staying in Singapore for any length of time stay at one of the top 15 hotels on Trip Advisor after that good luck .Best things we did. Bum boat ride from Clark Quay $15. Day or night up to 8.45 pm Sentosa Island - Under Water World & Fort Siloso,cable car ride.Food and drink is expensive here .Take a few drinks with you. Markets and Mosque around Arab street Newton Hawlkers Food Market clean and good cheep food Shopping Suntec & Orchard Road 10 am to 10 pm Mostaffas for all night shopping. Walk along river at night by Clark Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: North_England
Reviews.Content: This was the final stop for us after a wonderful trip around the world. What a disappointment! The hotel must have worked very hard to recruit so many rude and ill-mannered members of staff. In fact out of the 20 or so staff we had contact with only the doorman and the bell boys had any sort of manners at all. The reception staff were rude, the catering staff were rude, the bar staff were rude.... Breakfast may state that it is served until 10.30, but we saw several people practically refused entry at 10am and nothing that ran out was replaced. We could not even get a re-fill on our cups of tea. After we signed for our breakfast we recieved two phone calls to the room to make sure that we had paid. We also requested an upgraded room as this was a very special trip for us - we too were given a standard room. But the best bit was that they gave us a twin room when were were on our honeymoon. When we asked to be moved we were made to feel that it was somehow our fault for this mistake. The rooms are now very dated and a lot of the switches and lights did not work. The concierge had very little knowledge of the surrounding area and could not even direct us to the nearest bus stop. The location of this hotel would be good if all you wanted to do was shop - however you would be better staying near the Orchard Road area. The only good thing about the hotel was the shortness of our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location- Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lee2
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for most things in Singapore. Taxis are cheap enough, you can get most places for just a few dollars - though you may have to wait a while at peak hour! We stayed here for 2 weeks while on business. Upgraded on arrival to club room (not able to use club facilities though) Room was clean and refurbished. Comfortable but not extraordinary. Breakfast was standard buffet but more than adequate. We found the staff helpful and any requests we made were dealt with efficiently and with a smile. This hotel is quite busy as it is used as an accomodation choice for a major cruise line and so there are quite a few guests in party mode either departing or returning from a week long cruise. The hotel is also used by several flight crews. Nearby Raffles City has good shopping and Jasons supermarket in the basement is excellent for most essentials as well as having a liquor store and a reasonable bakery. There is also a cheaper asian style food hall and the requisite takeaways - subway, burger king etc plus a great whole food takeaway -cedene- if you are just looking to get a bite to eat and then back to the hotel for a sleep. (We were on business with 12-14 hour working days so this was an option some nights). Overall a good hotel in an excellent location with all that you would need - only suggestion is that you ask for a refurbished room on booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good location no regard for their guests”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviews written headed 'Beware' and 'Ok but....' below as we encountered similar problems. This was the 3rd stop of our honeymoon having just flown in from the wonderful Poppies in Ko Samui (- go there instead!) The difference in approach between the two hotels was striking. Despite it being booked as a honeymoon 15 months in advance, we arrived to find our 'deluxe' room had two single beds. The reception staff were not particularly helpful when called from the room and reluctant to do anything about it. We persisted despite our tiredness and it was only our insistance which surprisingly produced a room with a double bed on a club room floor. As with the reviewer below, this upgrade to club room level (room no bigger or better just on a higher floor) did not bring with it any advantages at all - this was discovered on attempted entry to the club room and I was made to feel like a second class citzen for that attempt. In addition, the supposed honeymoon extra's of fruit and flowers on arrival were not present, even in our original room. It took numerous phone calls to get these just out of principle. The standard of decor was a little tired, even in these supposed deluxe/club rooms and some of the tiling around the bottom of the bath needed attention as well as a leaky tap. The reception staff are still inattentive and not bothered about helping you swiftly - if you are going to Singapore for something special i.e. honeymoon, anniversary, do not go here despite it's great location, you will be made to feel like a small ant in a very big ant hill. They have too many rooms and guests to care about individuals. Food in restaurant is good but expensive, we had problems given such a short stay though to find somewhere close by that served breakfast during the week so were stuck for choices. The gym and pool facilities however were fine, particularly the pool - welcome break from a city. Although being able to see raffles from our window we wished we spent the extra and stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cattravelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton pre & post a trip to Thailand. Our travel agent had made an error and booked twin rooms. Were thankful enough to be upgraded at checkin after much umming and ahhing. Have to admit that the room was quite nice. Asked on departure if they could change our next booking to double. No sorry not in system yet you'll just have to try your luck on checkin in two weeks time. Well we turn up again in two weeks and ask for the change - sorry very full, no can do but you can have one on a smoking floor? We said no would rather put up with single beds. Get to our room to find we have still been given the queen room on a smoking floor. Room is in terrible condition with no safe and not even mini bar (the fridge was empty!) and burn holes in the curtains. Figured a change of rooms was in the 'too hard' basket but then my husband tried to have a shower and the plug in the bathtub doesn't work and won't empty. Other issues was as it got later it only got smokier. Ended up changing rooms to another standard rm but with single beds and have to say that the previous comments re the condition of their bathrooms is correct. Very disappointing and feels like its dirty. They need a revamp. Staff at breakfast were not overly helpful/friendly either and each time you leave the hotel the concierge at the taxi desk hits you up to go on shopping tours to his mate's stores. Location I agree is excellent but this is one hotel where you need to pay the extra cash for a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Needs attention”
Reviews.Author: bushwalkergirl
Reviews.Content: Agree with others who rate the location of this hotel, as I would stay here again purely for its location. However, I thought that our standard room was beyond shabby. We arrived to find rubbish from the previous occupants in the rubbish bin and the drawers, and I thought that the bathroom needed a complete overhaul, the tiles and bathroom sink were badly cracked and looked quite dirty. Photos attached so you can see what I am talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the Carlton”
Reviews.Author: angelikiSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed three night at the Carlton Hotel In April 06, and it was wonderful. The staff were all friendly and helpful, we arrived at 9am and were able to check in straight away, the breakfast had an excellent selection and the atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming. The room was large and clean with a view over the city. The hotel is in a great location, Chijmes is across the street and Raffles is just down the street. Loved Singapore cannot wait to visit again, and would stay at the Carlton next time. I would recommend a night cruise on the river, and a trip to the bar at the top of the Swissotel, Little India is more interesting than Chinatown and the Hippotours hop on hop off bus tours are informative and a good way to get you bearings- you don't have to hop on and off.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: DelayedAgain
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very helpful staff, good standard of accommodation and well prepared food. Exactly what visitors on a city break require.

HotelInfo.Name: Carlton Hotel Singapore
